description:
We just saw this spot accidentally on our way to basketball training at St. Ignatius and wanted to eat a quick dinner after a long drive here. Glad we stopped by and ordered before reading other reviews! Actually decent prices and food was pretty good. We had the vegetarian eggrolls which were with the vermicelli noodles and shitake mushrooms which I like. It had taro in it as well but could not distinguish this- overall good. 

Pad Thai was the usual and good. Then we had the pumpkin curry and they use kombocha squash instead. I love kombocha but pumpkin would be even better, but understandable since not in season. So the dish was still good and mine was spicy enough that I liked it. 

Nice and clean. Service was friendly and quick. They were very attentive and filled our water cups. This will be one of my quick go-tos when I am in this area! I can't wait to try the other dishes ( my son only wanted Pad Thai but loved it all after eating it all) bc I saw other diners and they had the rad na( like chow fun) and angel wings which looked even better than what we had- Yum!
author: EllenMarie S.

description:
I've been here a few times for lunch now and I get the Thai fried rice with chicken every time! Although the rice is a tiny bit mushy sometimes, it tastes good overall.

My girlfriend gets different dishes each time: red curry with rice, tom yum soup, garlic pork, etc. All of them were delicious!

The restaurant is kind of small but there were tables open each time we came here. The staff is nice, service is good. I would recommend checking this place out if you're craving Thai food.

One thing I wish this place served is fried chicken fried rice!

Note: there is a lunch special menu available from 11:30am-3pm.
author: Wesley S.

description: Just about what you'd expect at any Thai place. The service was great, I got an order of pad Thai with prawns to go and it was ready within about 5 minutes. However there was only 3 shrimp in the entire thing, and I paid extra to have them added. They also didn't give me a fork or napkins in the bag and I had to borrow those items from a friend. The pad Thai tasted great though, no complaints. I'd have included a fourth star if there was a more fair amount of shrimp in it.
author: Dakota C.

description:
I would give this place a zero if I could for making my 3 year old cry. We have been loyal customers but the team who works Sunday nights is awful. They delivered our green curry to another table, set 2 dishes that we didn't order on our table. We told them they were not our dishes and the waitstaff left the dishes on our table
For 5 minutes then decided to serve them to another table. That's not serve safe. Then our pineapple fried rice took 30 minutes to get to our table. We explicitly told them no prawns because of a shellfish allergy. They brought us prawns in our rice. All this and still no apology. Then said well do you want us to exchange it? IT HAD Shellfish which would make us die! By this point my 3 year old is crying because she's so hungry. They never gave use our rice and never apologized and didn't even try to make it right.
author: Soledad M.

description: Pretty average Thai restaurant, close to Ocean beach. We came here mainly because it was a 15ish minute walk down the beach and we were hungry!! Ordered Thai tea (yum), Pad Thai, and Green curry with rice. Pad Thai was pretty good, nothing too impressive. Came with big prawns, I was pleasantly surprised by that. Big portion, a lot of noodles. Green curry was okay. Overall average Thai restaurant, convenient close to the beach, and good prices very affordable. Good service!
author: Amanda C.

description: Lunch special is great price and delicious! Treat yourself by coming here. The L1 and L4 combo was perfect.
author: Daniel C.

description: Nice restaurant! We ordered the spices beef salad, red curry, sticky rice, and drunken noodles with chicken. Everything was priced really well. Most dishes were only $10. Will definitely come back to try the lunch specials.
author: Angela T.

description: Nice neighborhood thai place with yelp check in for free thai ice tea that was really sweet and had to be watered down.  Service was friendly. Food was good and just hit the spot.
author: Helen L.

description: The place is clean and very inviting.  The food was hot, and the food was very tasty.   The portion was good to share with family.  I would come back again!  Even received a free dessert.
author: Joel P.

description: We got a lunch special with pad Thai, yellow curry, and rice. We also got angel wings. They were all super amazing. The pad thai had the perfect amount of tanginess and the perfect amount of ingredients. The yellow curry was yummy when mixed with the rice. It was kind of coconuty tasting. Very good and cheap deal for lunch special. The angel wings were crispy and tender. It includes wings and legs. We got free coconut ice cream with the check in. It was very yummy as well. The service was fast and friendly.
author: Amanda L.

description: They serve the best thai food in the area during lunch time hands down! For the taste, quality, and price you cant beat it. Haven't been there for dinner but I plan on it soon.
author: Kealiiaumoku K.

description: Food isn't great. Tried the chicken Pad Thai (usually my favorite dish from any Thai restaurant). It was bland and fishy, missing the real essence of good Pad Thai. Also tried the yellow curry, which you would think you can't really go wrong with, but this place really didn't taste good.
author: Vivian W.

description:
Meh
Overpriced 
Overrated 
Petulant take out cashier 
Last ditch effort for late nite grub in outer sunset


Skip if possible
Otherwise prepare to spend thirty dollars for two entrees from a snobby cashier who gives no utensils and napkins for thirty dollars of food that should cost half as much
author: Charles B.

description: Pretty good thai food from what i tasted. I did a lunch special. They have 1or 2 item lunch specials. I chose the 2 items, eggplant chicken and yellow curry chicken. Their food is definitely worth the struggle of parking. Theirthai iced teas are nice and strong.  We will come back for sure.
author: meeky P.

description: For $10 you get only this. Food is good but expect to get 2 portions (I'm 5'6" 130lbs) or down a bunch of starchy rice.
author: Jayce T.

description: I'm in town staying at a nearby motel. I ordered delivery over yelp. Food was delivered quicker than I expected. My order came wrong. I ordered the pad thai and asked for the prawns on the side, no peanuts and no  bean sprouts. The itemized ticket clearly says this. My meal was delivered with both peanuts and bean sprouts. The side of prawns came with 3 pieces.  And I also wrote I wanted many many extra sides of the Chile garlic sauce. They gave me 2. It was also delivered with no utensils!  I'm not ordering from here again.
author: Cindy M.

description: I've been here a few times before and liked this place but tonight was not a good experience. Short pour on wine, main course came while eating our starters so our entrees were cold when we got around to eating them. Under spiced and under flavored. Garlic pepper pork had no flavor of pepper or garlic, also hardly any cabbage. I wanted another glass of wine and was not given the chance to order one. We felt rushed. I don't think we will be back. Too many better options in SF...
author: Lauraine E.

description:
We've ordered togo before and its always good. This time, nearly everything was wrong.
We ordered mild yellow chicken curry with extra potatoes and chicken with a larger serving of rice. 
What we got?
They ran out of rice so we only got a small order, not a big issue. But when we got home, the curry was not the same. It was spicy, and still somehow bland. The last time it was rich and sweet. It also didn't come with any extra chicken or potatoes, instead they gave us a bunch of veggies (cabbage, carrots, broccoli, and some tofu). On top of that I found a hair in the food. 
So disappointing. Only reason for 2 stars is I understand sometimes these things happen, but it was so many issues and my husband cannot eat spicy food for health reasons so we had to toss it.
author: Bella T.

description:
GREAT THAI FOOD Hiidding spot that I got just by accident and this will be my Thai restaurant from now on...

The food is EXCELENT !
The service was very clean and on point...

It was so nice I was able to leave  my doggy outside and They brought her watter....that was a very kind gesture from Them.
author: Daniela L.

description:
Garlic Pork! MmmMmm

Staff has always been nice to me and seating area is always clean.
author: Michael L.

description: This was an awesome place for a quick Thai craving. Star w friendly and food was flavored well
author: Bobin G.

description:
The best lunch special in town is here! Great food comes with lot of options around 13 bucks!

Be careful with your "to go" orders, one time they forgot to put the entre in the bag and I had to complain when I reached home.
author: S J.

description:
If you are ever craving that spice in your life, or should i say in your work day. This place will give you that extra kick.  My co-worker and I came here for lunch and parking wasn't too bad.  There was already a small crowd of people already eating but we still got a seat.  They have a special lunch menu which is great for your wallet.  You can pick 1 or 2 items for just under 10.00.   That's a pretty good deal for the amount you get.  

I got the Ga Prow with chicken with chili, garlic, bell pepper and sweet basil along with the Pad Ma-Kuer with was sautéed eggplant with fried tofu, chili, bell pepper, onion and basil.  I was prepared to add more hot sauce to my dish, but I didn't have to.. It was so spicy that I downed my drink so fast.   I love the spices in this dish and I'm glad they did packed it with lots of ingredients.  We also got the fried calamari.  The Fried calamari was really good. the Calamari was not covered in batter like most places.  You have a good large slice of calamari that is lightly dipped in batter.  

Overall i love this place, but i'm sad i lost all my pics before this review.   If you check in on yelp. you get a free scoop of coconut ice cream.  The ice cream was so good, I'm not sure what they put on top of the ice cream but it made it the perfect combo.  I'll be back!
author: Belinda C.

description: First time having dinner here.  My aunt taught ESL to the owners children.  This is a family run business and for a week night this place was busy with customers.  There were 5 of us for dinner 2 beers and 6 dishes and brown rice.  We had a range of dishes and each dish had their special flavor.  I will need to go back again!!!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Came here for lunch during the work week. I probably wouldn't have come here on my own due to the lower reviews for this place, but I'm glad that it was recommended!

Their menu is quite extensive and their lunch menu offers a shorter list of options, but still great variety. You can select one or two entrees from the lunch specials list and it comes rice and soup or salad. 

I chose the salad, which came with a sweet dressing and Pad Thai and Green Curry with Prawns. The pad thai was pretty good and came with lots of tofu and two tiny prawns. You can choose your protein for the green curry. I wanted more prawns which was an additional $2. I believe it only came with two prawns. Chicken or beef is a better deal! I chose this curry specifically because it offered eggplant, but I didn't notice any in my portion. It also wasn't spicy at all. Perhaps I should have asked for extra spicy! Despite all this, it was pretty good curry, perfectly creamy and delicious to mix with my rice! Portion sizes are perfect.

My lunch mates also went with the two entree lunch specials and really enjoyed their food as well. 

Overall, good value and great tasting food! Awesome lunch option!
author: Dorothy L.

description: The best lunch special in town! I get pad Thai, yellow curry, rice, and a cup of Tom kha soup for less than 14$! It always ends up being two meals. And the food and service is amazing. COME HERE NOW!
author: Phillip T.

description:
One of my favorite Thai restaurants in the City. My favorite dish is duck and they make a great roast duck red curry. The Orchid Duck dish is also good. Prices are reasonable and the staff are friendly.

I will definitely return and I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Chilly W.

description: I've eaten in this place a few times, and the food was decent, so I thought it would be safe to order for delivery. I placed my order a few minutes after 5, and it arrived a few minutes before 6. The woman who took my order said delivery would take 25 minutes. Let's move on to the food. The green curry with chicken was at least medium spicy, but I ordered mild. I had to strain the solids from the too spicy liquid. Where was the curry flavor? The stir fried veggies consisted of mostly pale white cabbage, bean sprouts, and soggy fried tofu, not exactly the crisp stir fried green veggies I had imagined. But worst of all was the brown rice. Instead of visible grains of rice, I got what looked like a big glob of thick, mushy rice pudding. It's really sad that Vanida Thai would stoop so low as to serve me this crap. I flushed most of the food down the toilet where it belongs. Obviously, I won't be ordering from this place again, and I would advise you to stay away as well.
author: Mike T.

description:
A local joint in the outer sunset... no one would seriously venture into this part of town to get a picture of a Pad Thai to post onto their IG or snapchat accounts.  There's nothing fancy about this place, your usual hole in the wall.  For the price and decent thai flavors, this makes it a go to for a quick fix.  

I always get the pad thai or pad Kee mao aka drunken noodles.  I've been to Thailand more than my fair share and the flavors here always bring back memories I've had there.  That's enough for it to land an easy 3.5/4 stars.

Service isn't bad but it is a little awkward.  I come back for the convenience, price, and authentic flavors that resembles more like home cooking than a restaurant.
author: Colin M.

description:
Dined here for lunch on Lunar New Year's Eve and the place was quite empty at 1pm. I had made a reservation 2 days prior, but it definitely wasn't needed. The price was good for the portion size. Seems they have the lunch menu every day of the week, which is pretty awesome. 

I did enjoy my mom's garlic prawn combo. The flavor was delicious; too bad it was much too salty though. The one-item combo came with tom yum soup, which did not taste authentic at all, as well as a side of rice. My drunken noodle dish was beyond spicy! I know it was stated on the menu as such, but our server did not make sure I was aware when she took my order, nor did she ask if I would like it to be more mild. Also, the service was extremely slow for how empty the restaurant was. She did not ask what we would like to drink; instead, she asked as an afterthought when taking our orders. None of the servers looked our way during the meal either. It took me awhile to flag our server down for more water and to have them send over the forgotten house salad that came with our family friend's meal.

Parking was surprisingly decent; everyone was probably flooding the Chinese restaurants on Noriega or Irving. Judging by the inattentive service and just average tasting food, I don't think I'd visit in the near future.
author: Kristi T.

description:
~~~~Yes, They Deliver For Free~~~~
~~~First Time Using YelpEats24 App~~~
~Overall Experience: Tethered btwn 2 & 3~

It's always a plus when food is delivered to us. Especially for a group of 15+ in SF. This restaurant was very close to where we rented a house for the weekend. We actually didn't have much of a selection in terms of delivery. 

Let me tell you, it was quite a process to use the YelpEats24 App for a large party. I would recommend to place a phone order instead and here's why. 

1. Some items they offered were not on the app. This delayed our order. I had to ask my friends to order items from the app after we realized this.

2. Write orders down first instead of plugging it in the app. It had been over 45 minutes by the time I was able to grab and enter everyone's order and double check them. We almost lost our order!! 

One of my friends wanted to use her credit card after I had plugged everything into my phone through my yelp app. When I entered her name and credit card information under my yelp app, it prompted me to re-log into my yelp acct. I lost our order when I did so. Luckily, my Samsung S7 Edge had a back button. Somehow I was able to place the order under guest, instead of logging into my yelp account.

3. It took another hour for the order to arrive. We put in 15% tip on top of the total bill of over $145. On top of the SF Health Mandate Tax. Perhaps we should've paid cash for tip. We did not receive extra napkins under special request. In fact, we didn't receive any napkins or utensils. Maybe we didn't put enough tip??

On with the food:

In my opinion, it was mediocre. Well my Tom Kha Goong Soup was not prepared right. It is quite tricky to prepare coconut milk soup. When prepared right, there's a noticeable separation in the coconut milk, with lemongrass and other spices added, the flavors are truly harmonious and this takes time. What I received tasted like sweetened milk with no hint of  lemongrass or other spices. I ate all my shrimps. It was clear that not enough time was put into my soup. I do judge Thai Restaurants by how well they prepare this dish. 

If you're still reading this review, you might be thinking this review sounds more like a 2 star review. I bumped it up because two of my friends enjoyed their eggplant dishes. One even mentioned it was the best she ever had but she mentioned this after she finished her dish. I was not able to confirm, however she did finish it.

Thai bbq chicken was a bit on the dry side, mentioned by the one who ordered it. One mentioned the pad thai was too sweet but we had three orders for it. The rest of the dishes ordered had no complaints. From what I can remember, we also ordered pineapple fried rice, a couple of non-coconut milk soups, red curry, chicken satay and couple of Thai Iced Teas. 

Fyi, usually rice is an additional fee at Thai Restaurants but some people have a hard time believing this until their curry dish or soup dish arrives without it. Luckily, some of us ordered and sharing is no big deal in our group.

We we're all too hangry to take pictures by the time the  food arrived. However, I did snatch one quick photo of my soup I posted under the tips section of this restaurant.
author: Yuri K.

description:
Average thai restaurant located in Sunset. 

They have affordable lunch deals. I believe they deliver as well? Check it out! their pad thai wasn't bad.
author: Danae L.

description:
This is the grossest restaurant I've had the misfortune to try in SF.  We ordered a noodle soup and a fried rice dish for takeout. Started with the soup and found a very long dark brown hair tangled with a piece of chicken. Disgusting. Ditched the soup, started eating the fried rice... after more than halfway through the plate, we found a DIFFERENT type of hair (a short, coarse black strand) in it. Unbelievable.

I think the flavors were decent... not that it matters.
author: Sara H.

description:
I came here with the family for dinner. It was pretty empty, but could possibly also be due to the rainstorm and no one was trying to leave their house. The six of us weren't too hungry, so we ordered four plates to share: Beef Satay, Pad See Ew, Combination Fried Rice, and Green Curry. The beef satay only consisted of four skewers, which is quite minimal but pretty good tasting with the sauce. As for the pad see ew and fried rice were pretty classic, so you can't go wrong with it. Last but not least was the curry, which was quite unique as it was my first time having green curry. If you're into spice and coconut, this is a great option. You also need to order rice with the curry, and as someone has mentioned --make sure to get two orders of rice at least or you'll have a lot of leftover curry.

With each Yelp check-in, you get a free scoop of coconut ice cream. I liked that it was topped with some fried coconut crisps and was quite refreshing to end the meal. Overall, pretty decent spot for Thai food.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
I ordered from Vanida twice during my week in San Francisco. They serve up some unbelievably delicious Thai cuisine, and EAT24 delivers it. I ordered my favorite dish: panang curry with shrimp. 

The only problem was that the steamed rice doesn't come with the curry and if you forget to order it separately, you're screwed. That's what happened to me the first time with my delivery. And if you do order the rice, make sure you get two orders. If you don't, you will likely end up with way too much curry sauce and about half the amount of rice to eat it with.

Other than that the taste, the seasoning, the spice level, and overall quality was delicious! Four solid stars for the food, and 3 for the service.
author: Helina G.

description: OMG OMG OMG is it enough of OMG for this Vanida Thai restaurant?  I mean seriously OMG!!  I found this little insect in my bowl of soup after I ate almost all of it.  I felt like I wanted to throw up instantly, so disgusting.  I just hope it's not more than one insect was being cooked in my soup and now in my stomach.   Bullshit place to dine at.   Plus their meat was way overcooked.  This is the worst eating place that you don't want to dine there.  They don't take good care of their food that they serve.  I guess there is a reason why it's so empty during meal hours.   People didn't know they are so bad will come here once and they will never come back again.   I think they should close their store for goodness sake.   I would give them zero star if I have that option.   A total Thumb Down restaurant.
author: Winnie C.

description: Awesome! Lunch special is a great deal. Two selections of Thai foods for $10.95 plus a side (salad or soup). Wonderful service
author: J S.

description:
I'm going to start by saying their lunch menu is exceptional in terms of portion size and value. You get to choose one or two items from a list of options which also includes a soup or salad. These items not only include your ginger pork or satay options, but also things like pad thai or various curries, which would usually cost more on its own anywhere else than this entire combo meal.

I ordered the green curry with beef and pad thai as a two-item combo which came out to be around $12 (A STEAL!). There was so much food I honestly could have split it into two full meals had I not made dinner plans already. I particularly enjoyed the coconut milk-based soup we were given as the starter. Both the curry and pad thai were flavorful. 

The one area this place needs to improve on is service. It took forever to get the waiter come write down our orders and just as long to get our bill. I typically am not a stickler about service,  but considering the restaurant wasn't even full, I can only imagine how much worse it can get with a packed house.

Other than that, I definitely would come back again for their lunch menu and try their other food!
author: Derick N.

description:
Had an incredible lunch here today.

First time here and the food and service was EXCELLENT.

I parked in front and then proceeded on in. I was greeted right away and found a seat near the front window. I asked for water and then looked in the menu. They have a lunch special which is good because these meals are at a reduced price compared to the normal evening hours. I was looking for the Pad Kee Moa and found out that they do have it but it called Dragon Noodles here. AWESOME.

After I had placed my order I took time to look around the restaurant. This is very fanciful. There is not too much color or over the top decoration. It almost seems like this place is a hidden gem in the sunset. Everything about the inside is peaceful and relaxing. Even the music being played in soothing. I had a very peaceful lunch here.

When my food finally arrived I was ready and so was my stomach. The meal was hot and tasted incredible. It seems like every time I go to a new Thai restaurant the Pad Kee Moa gets better and better but the taste stays consistent. CONSISTENT TASTE IS KEEP!!! The meal was very pleasing and met all my hunger needs. 

The waitress was very attentive and nice. She refilled my water and checked on my food and myself. She did a phenomenal job of taking orders, greeting customers, seating customers, and bringing out the food. Super sweet and nice. These kinds of non verbal cues and actions will put BIG tips in her pocket. Kudos to her.

It is easy to be stirred away from this place based on some of the reviews posted but just come and check it out for yourself. I had a wonderful time.
author: Robert F.

description:
Vanida is a solid Thai option while in the Sunset.  

The restaurant is clean and small, with limited seating. The staff is always super fast and friendly. They seem to do a lot of TOGO orders and also offer delivery.  
 
Most recently we ordered Pad Thai with prawns (small prawns might I add!), Chicken Eggplant, Cashew Chicken, small side of brown rice, and the Vanida Salad with Fried Tofu.  The salad was yummy with fresh veggies and a warm peanut sauce that is to die for. Eggplant was a little too cooked for my liking but the flavors were still there.  I would have never ordered the cashew chicken, but my dad really wanted it so I was down to try it. Sure enough it was the star of dinner.  Really good flavor with crisp bell pepper strips. For desert I had the coconut ice cream with toasted coconut flakes on top (complimentary with a YELP check in!). 

Will I be back?  Heck yeah!!
author: Vanessa S.

description: Great lunch special, food was flavorful with hearty portions. The complimentary coconut milk soup to start was delicious. Service was quick and friendly, can't beat the quality for the price.
author: jessica f.

description: Below average food for average price. "Medium spice" was inedible due to heat. Paid Thai was disappointing. Coconut soup was ok.
author: Anthony D.

description: The rice was ok, but everything else sucked! I asked for beef fried rice, but gave me chicken and the chicken wasn't even cooked right. Soup was bland too. I will never come here again.
author: Giovanni F.

description:
Excellent quality and taste. My go to place for Thai food in the Sunset/Parkside areas. 

Check this place out. You won't regret it. 

The beef satay appetizer is the bomb.com. So many other good dishes, too. 

When you check in here, you get a free scoop of coconut ice cream. So yummy!
author: Gigi F.

description: Went there for dinner with my cousin tonight. When we walked in around 7:30pm there were only one couple inside the restaurant. We hesitated to go in but it was getting late so we decided to give it a try. We've ordered the Pork Thai Fried Rice, Grilled beef and Seafood Eggplant. The portion was so small. The seafood was stale and nasty. The Grilled beef was cold. The food was so bland and greasy. This place is so over price. When we were driving home, we both had a stomach ache. We almost did not  make it home in time to use the bathroom. Boy did we both had diarrhea. We both felt so sick to our stomach. Hopefully we won't end up in the ER tonight. This is the WORST thai restaurant we ever been too. Think the Health Department needs to be called in to check on their kitchen and their cleanliness. Boy this is the worst experience we have ever been to. We should have known better not to go in when we only saw one couple in the restaurant especially on a Saturday night.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Ordered Pad Thai and Crispy Noodle with prawn today for dinner through Eat24. Never had the crispy noodle before so I decided to try it as it looks good on the Yelp photo review. I don't know if it's because it's Monday night, but portion is small, only has 2 prawns, literally only 2, no bean sprout as it said on the menu, teeny pieces of tofu, and that is all. For $10 plus tax, that's bullshit. I rather drive to Irving and get a really decent meal for that much. I come here almost everyday since I live just a clock from here. But for what you pay, it's north worth it. It's only convenient cause it's close. But again, I would never order dinner again here. This was the last time I order dinner here. For some reason, when I order food for pick-up, it's just meh...
author: Jas L.

description:
Found this Thai place on a Yelp Ad while hanging out by Ocean beach.  Very glad we decided to come here for lunch.  The place is very clean, the decor is nice and relaxing, and the service is great. 

The lunch specials allows you choose from 25 items like pad thai, green, curry, spicy eggplant etc. and it comes with soup (tom ka or tom yum) or salad.  They also offer rice plates and noodle dishes as part of their lunch specials menu.   Our server was very attentive, and handled the lunch crowd with ease. 

I ordered the yellow curry with and eggplant dish in a spicy sauce with delicious tofu and rice.  The food was good, 3.5/4 while the 5, star service and great prices will have me back soon.
author: Marlon T.

description:
I was craving Thai but wanted to eat at home, so I found Vanida on Yelp and decided to order for takeout. I got to the restaurant, the interior is very cute! Not a big restaurant, but it was simple and I could see there were a couple people here on a date. 

I ordered the Duck Basil and Pad See Ew with extra noodles. When one of the servers handed me my check as I waited for my food, he did not say a thing to me, nor did he make any sort of eye contact, he simply handed me the check. Umm how rude..? Anyways, I got my food and headed home.

When we opened the food at home, I wish we had opened it before we left Vanida. First, it was a takeout and they did not give any sort of utensils or napkins. Second, the duck basil dish....literally had 2 pieces of duck in it. WTF?!?!!? 2 pieces of duck with actual meat, the rest was just skin. The pad see ew was okay..nothing spectacular. At least they actually gave us the extra noodles. 

I've definitely had better Thai in the city and will not be coming back.
author: Christine Y.

description:
I've ordered from Vanida a number of times since its a block from my house, but I've never had a 'good' experience there. It's decent Thai food, nothing great - and definitely nothing that justifies the rude employees that work there. My fiancé and I usually pick up our orders , but the last time we picked up food the employees were talking about us negatively, in their native tongue (non English), and likely didn't realize that my fiancé understood what they were saying. 

It's been a little while since we ordered from them again due to this poor experience, so decided to get delivery thinking it would be better. Wrong! The guy delivering the food was another rude employee. When I opened my front door, the delivery guy hands me the bag of food and immediately says 'whoever ordered this didn't include a tip'...this is super rude. I ordered the food online and since I've worked in the food industry for yrs, I always tip cash. So for this guy to just call out there was no tip, as if he was entitled to a tip was completely poor judgment. I gave him the cash that I already had in my hand and told him to have a good night. 

Bottom line. This Thai food is alright at best but the service gives me more and more reason to just order from one of the other, many, Thai food spots around.
author: Joe G.

description:
Ordered Postmates. 

Pad See Ew - too many fillers of cabbage and carrots. Bland 
Pad Thai - asked for no bean sprouts and extra lime. Was given extra bean sprouts and no lime 

Worst Thai food. Ever.
author: Serena F.

description: Indifferent service by immature teens.  Bland tasteless food. Fairly decent small seating area. Good for a safe bet from stomach horrors, but that's about it.
author: Devon S.

description: We didn't get what we ordered (takeout). They didn't put any chicken in a dish that was supposed to include chicken. And put mussels and calamari in a dish that was only supposed to have shrimp. The noodle dish was also greasy.  It overall could've been a lot better.
author: Breonna C.

description:
I ordered pickup through eat24 app:

I have had an obsession with Indian food recently and decided to switch it up and break the cycle last night with some Thai food. I actually had not eaten Thai food in a couple years (because ahem I used to be obsessed with it!)

I went with Vanida due to it's proximity to my house and because they were on the eat24 app.

I ordered for pickup Pineapple fried rice, Pad Thai Pak, and Spicy eggplant tofu.

When I arrived there was only street parking so I double parked with my hazards on in a side residential street. It is a small place and upon walking in, there were about six tables with people dining in. I walked to the back and picked up my order.

No disposable silverware or napkins were provided in my take out bag, which annoyed me. I guess you have to request for that? 

Pineapple Fried Rice: This was very bland. Huge chunks of pineapple but I only counted five pieces. Three small shrimps. Maybe two and a half ounces of chicken. It lacked any kind of spice or dominating flavor. Probably the saddest thai style fried rice I had ever consumed. 

Pad Thai Pak: All the noodles stuck together in a huge clump. Plain noodles in the center where the sauce had not penetrated. A good 15% of the dish was composed of bean sprouts. Being a veggie dish, I only counted 2 small sad pieces of broccoli. I threw most of this dish away.

Spicy Eggplant Tofu: I think they messed up my order and only served me the just the spicy tofu , because this dish did not contain any eggplant whatsoever. It was also the most flavorful dish of the three with a spicy sweet and sour sauce. I actually poured this sauce onto my fried rice to give that life. Still it's fried tofu so you can't really screw that up-

Overall this was not food made with any passion. I wanted to give this a try and support a local business, but with so many other Thai options in this city I am willing to keep searching for one that I like instead of returning here.
author: Travis B.

description:
Thai food isn't something I prefer on a regular basis, besides their desserts. But Vanida Thai deserves at least 3.5 stars. The customer service is FANTABULOUS! Absolutely amazing because there was only one waiter to tend to the many tables on the floor. He seemed to take care of everyone very well! Props to him.

My friend ordered the Roasted Duck Noodle Soup with extra Chinese broccoli. After digging through the noodles a bit, she couldn't find any Chinese broccoli so she asked for more. Somehow, it was actually hidden deep in the noodles. She told them nevermind but they gave her the veggies anyway and didn't charge for it. Obviously, if he already put in the order for extra Chinese broccoli, they're not gonna just throw it away now that she found it but still. Good customer service deserves to be recognized.

They have a really good lunch combo deal. You can either choose 1 dish for $7 something or 2 dishes for $8 something and they come with either white/brown rice and a soup, either Tom Kha or Tom Yum (chicken OR veggie)! If not, they have other options. I LOVE their selection of Noodle Soups!

I really enjoyed this Thai restaurant - one of the few after my Thailand trip.
author: Athena C.

description: Had the pumpkin curry with prawns and chicken... and wow! DELICIOUS! One of the best I've tried (and I've tried many!). It's creamy and full of flavor. The portion was bigger than most places. Also had the pad Thai and the basil chicken. Neither disappointed either. Definitely recommend trying it out.
author: Norma M.

description:
I love their Angel wings!!! I really think this place should be known for these wings. Everything else is good too but my favorite will always be the Angels wings and red curry here. 
And you can't go wrong with mango sticky rice.
author: Alane N.

description: Very great food, really good flavor, and super service! I'm very picky with food and this is one of the best Thai places around, it is also quite cheap.
author: Nicole K.

description: All my experiences coming here were amazing the service the food was all amazing this to me is one of the best Thai restaurants in the Bay Area
author: Tadhg M.

description: Among the things I miss about my old neighborhood in the Outer Sunset in S.F. this place is near the top of the list. I used to go there often or order for delivery, and the food and service were top notch. I'm glad to see that it's still there in case I'm ever in that neighborhood.
author: Kristen L.

description: It was ok. I ordered the fried sweet potatoes, pad Thai and mixed veggies. The veggies were just beam sprouts and carrots not very good. Pad Thai was ok. I won't be ordering again.
author: Bobbie M.

description: Food is always delicious and fresh.  Try the Pad See Ew and fried tofu.  Their beef larb is also off the hook! Great neighborhood Thai eatery!
author: Roger E.

description: Have been here for lunch a few times. The food is solid, service is prompt and the restaurant is clean. It's one of my husband's favorite places.
author: Christine H.

description:
Hey Vanida, glad to eat ya
For the kind of filling Thai food, I must beseech ya
Hey, eating with you is a top priority
Ain't no need to question their yellow curry 
Menu on the board, the chef of attention
You got mouths to swing in your direction
Hey, I like your pad see ew, you know
Vanida Thai food, you gotta put me on
author: Augusto M.

description:
simply amazing!
super sweet staff.. prompt service.. beautiful ambience.. amazingly delicious food.. what else do you expect from a restaurant!
love this place and will definitely be coming back more often..
*seriously whoever was the chef.. thanks for the awesome food.. loved it!
*last but not the least, loved the flower made out of straw cover on the straw with my drink.
cheers!
author: Karan M.

description:
I didn't know how lucky I got when I moved in around the corner from Vanida. This place is awesome. I've never been disappointed, I've ordered from them literally hundreds of times. Try the chicken eggplant, it's my fav!
It looks to be a decent place to sit and eat, although I've never stayed, only take-out. The staff is always friendly.
author: Mike H.

description:
Haven't been here since 2011 and I'm not sure why. Came here for lunch with some friends on a Sunday. It was pretty empty from what I remembered. I think we were the 3rd party in there.

The lunch deal is so worth it!! You get to choose an entree for 8$ and it comes with rice and soup/salad There's also an option to choose 2 entrees for 9$ too. I went with the green curry with chicken and some tofu vegetarian dish that the server recommended with rice and the Tom Yum soup! SUPER FILLING and SUPER WORTH IT!

I highly recommend coming here for lunch. Biggest bang for your buck!
author: Jenny C.

description: I went here for lunch and had the Pad Karee with a side salad. The service was really excellent and the side salad was fresh with a light, simple dressing, but the main course was pretty bland. There wasn't anything particularly bad about it, and I had no problem eating the whole thing, but I was hoping for a little more flavor.
author: AJ P.

description:
We went in on a Sunday afternoon and it was busy but people were leaving and about 3 table opened up.  There was only one waitress working the dining room and she never said 'it'll be a couple minutes...'   We were completely ignored.  After about 15 mins of trying to be patient - we walked out.   I blame it on the owners as they have to staff properly.  At least have one waitress/waiter and one busboy person.  

The food may be good and I love supporting local businesses, but I have to draw the line, if I'm not even acknowledged as a customer.  It's unfortunate.
author: n y.

description: Been coming here for years and it's still our regular spot for lunch (sometimes dinner) because it's close by our house. The food and service are both good. I like their lunch special combination. I also love their tofu eggplant and papaya salad. Today I ordered tofu Sam Rod and garlic pork and they're both very good. I took off one star because I think there is another Thai restaurant on Judah is a little better than this one.
author: Tien L.

description:
The service and quality of this restaurant has gone downhill quite a bit. We used to come here alot since we live a few blocks away. Last friday, me and two friends came in on a friday at 7:10pm and ordered our food. We knew something was wrong when the waitress insisted on us ordering something to drink when we said we were ready to order our food. 

We got three dishes, Pineapple Fried rice, Pad See Ew, and Chicken Curry Noodles. Our friend's Pineapple Fried Rice came 25 minutes after ordering. The two noodle dishes never came until we got up and left at 7:55pm. We waited over 45 minutes at this establishment for our food. We asked two different waitresses where our food was, and they said it's coming. When one of us said, "we're leaving" the waitress had the gal to say that our food was cooking in the back. After telling us that, 10 minutes the food still hadn't come out and so we said we weren't paying for the unserved dishes and demanded our check come in right there and then. 

We also watched people come in, order, eat, and pay for the check well after we came in. There was an elderly couple next to us who stated that they got the wrong dishes, but the waitress bullied them into believing that those were the dishes they ordered. Also no less than 5 take-out orders were given before our friend's plate was given.

As we left they handed us our noodles and said that they were sorry. Too little too late. To give a time table on how quickly I can actually make those noodle dishes, is 10 minutes. I'm not a cook by any means, but Pad See Ew only takes a few minutes to make. The curry chicken only needs the curry powder and noodles and takes even less time to make. All in all, the people running the place last friday don't know how to run a restaurant. 

I'm never coming back here again.
author: Clinton L.

description: Their garlic prawns is what keeps me coming back! Thai food is one of my favorite cuisines and I've been to a lot of other Thai places in the city. This spot is one of the few that have it on the menu and that does it well every time. Just do it
author: C M.

description:
9 months later, let's hope this place didn't take a dump in the sunset. Ocean beach is dirty enough as it is now. Where to start off...when you think of Thai food. Probably one of the first thing you would think of getting on a sunny day is Thai ice Tea

 The Thai ice tea here: Much better than quickly of course but doesn't quite stand out when you compare it to King of Thais variant. That could be a good or bad thing. I guess it just depends on whether you're a fan of sweet teas or not.

Pineapple fried rice: Huge chunks of pineapple pieces in the fried rice, but out side of the little bits of fruit in it, the rice turned out pretty bland, even with the combination fried rice option. of course my appetite requires the removal of onions but still, maybe im not used to the thai version perhaps? but i still think the pineapple fried rice from Banana Island kicks this one in the crotch.

Overall Result:
-Thai Tea - Pass. (+1)
-Pineapple fried Rice - Fail (Lack of flavoring rather than screwed up) (-1)
-Service: Pass, they were on point. (+1)....a whole lot better than the clusterf*ck i had to deal with last time
-Bathroom- Cleanish...pass (+1)

Verdict:Would go back if in the area and if i wasnt feeling chinese food. but not the at the top of my list.
author: Eric C.

description:
Good thai food.  But I'm not a fan of the curry.  Have tried the Duck Curry and Green Curry which tasted too sweet for me, possibly too much coconut milk?  
However, I've liked the other dishes I've gotten here.  The Pad Ma Keur was tasty, not oily like I've seen at other places.  The Crab Fried Rice is also good, with plenty of crab pieces.
It's a great quiet place for dinner, with great service.  Can't complain.
author: Karen L.

description: I just knew that they've special every month & this month is a roti ice cream. It was awesome. The roti was crispy and the coconut ice cream is good as usual. I's really enjoy the time here.
author: Fan C.

description: I finally gave this place another chance and it's pretty awesome. Where the food is actually spicy! Now addicted to their drunk noodles! Recently updated their menu and the service has improved immensely. It's now a regular stop for me after work. They do a lot of carry out and delivery so service can be a touch slow if you're here during a prime time.
author: Kayleen R.

description: Totally disgusted. I can pick up my entire container of pad see ew with my chopsticks. The flavor is unbelievably wrong. I have a metal flavor stuck in my mouth from this. I've ordered from Vanida Thai before and the food is ok but today, this is completely unacceptable. Also ordered garlic pork and they forgot the green sauce that makes the dish! Won't be ordering from here anymore.
author: Katrice S.

description: After a few years, with friends in town, decided to give it another shot. Walked in and every empty table was stacked with dirty dishes. They cleared off a table, and we ordered soup to start. After 40 minutes, we weren't served, not even sure the incompetent wait staff had even entered the order, we left. Never to come back again.
author: Scott R.

description: I love this place! Great ambiance, friendly staff, great Thai food. Be sure to try the garlic pork with the green sauce!
author: Angie L.

description: Garlic pork..with house green sauce is to die for...Thai iced tea is super strong...yum
author: Sandra S.

description:
(Review for take-out)
This is Thai food for people who really don't like Thai food. The dishes were bland and overpriced. I've traveled extensively and repeatedly in Thailand, and have eaten at countless Thai restaurants in the USA. Vanida's green curry had almost no basil. The Pad Thai was a solid lump of overcooked and unflavored rice noodles. The seafood eggplant was tasteless.
author: Phil S.

description: Order takeout twice so far when I'm craving Pad Thai. Pretty good place. Will come back again.
author: La G.

description: Pretty rude service for takeout! My boyfriend just wanted to let them know he's in the area, server rolled his eyes and sais to him" tsk" it a not ready." I went to pick up the food 15 mins later and the server was rude, just was like here ..and the food is sitting on the table. In the car I noticed they didn't give me any u utensils or napkins. Seriously am I suppose To eat with my hands and wipe my mouth on my shirt. The only reason this place got two stars is because the food was half decent better then average I would say, but that rude service interaction has me think twice . You can get so much better service elsewhere.
author: Susan K.

description: Great service. My yellow curry on point.  Friday night's dinner service and take out was served in 15 minutes. Perhaps an exceptional experience? Nonetheless, made my night, my week and maybe even my year.
author: Angela F.

description:
This is one of my favorite Thai food restaurants in the city. The service is amazing and the food is delicious. They also have free delivery! 

Some of my personal favorites include the curry puffs, Thai fried rice, tom khan soup with coconut milk. They have tons of vegetarian options which I love. 

This is a good spot if you are in outer sunset and want some Thai food.
author: Little E.

description: Had the pad eww see noodles.. it wasn't bad. The wait times weren't so good but they throw in some salad and Tom yum soup to go. I wish they did t box everything up in a box so it's like a cube of food. The noodles were fresh however.
author: Selby C.

description:
Dishes ordered: 

Combination Fried Rice.-
One of my biggest, biggest, BIGGEST annoyances is when Thai restaurants use chinese rice for fried rice. I LOATHE chinese food and in particular their fried rice, which is why I ordered Thai. My fried rice dish tasted like sub par chinese fried rice, absolutely zero seasoning. I do not recommend it unless you like rice mush. Pros: a lot of fake frozen squid, which I am ok with cos I like it, a lot of chicken.

Yellow Curry(beef)- I am not sure how much sugar one is supposed to put in Yellow Curry, but this tasted like yellow curry ice cream soup with beef. Pros: there was plenty of beef and cutely cut potato. 

Curry Puff- Vanida claims this is their famous known appetizer on their menu on Postmates. This was the highlight of the meal. And by highlight I mean doughy, pasty filling with a tad of flavour. No dipping sauce so used some soy and sriracha I had here at home.

Price: $35.54 not counting tip.
This was my first time trying Vanida and I'm good, I'll stick with Sri Thai from now on.
author: emma g.

description: Food was very good and we enjoyed ourselves. We had a large group and they were able to accommodate us.
author: Regina H.

description: I ordered the seafood eggplant today. It was good and I would order it again, but I'm going to request not spicy or mild next time. The default option of medium was way too spicy for me. I could hardly eat it.
author: Wendy L.

description: This is probably one of the best Thai food in San Francisco. Their best dish here is the garlic pork! The taste is on point and the green sauce is very unique and delicious. My partner is vegetarian and he really loves the tofu dishes. We always go here since my partner's office it's just A few blocks so when I have the day off I will pick him up to have a lunch here. Anyway, A few downside that I can say is I actually like the grilled chicken but it's a hit and miss. Sometimes I will get like a"re-heated" or maybe old grilled chicken. Pls be consistent and I'll give this a place 5 stars. And for God's sakes just fill up the Thai iced coffee, what is a few more ounces of coffee poured in the mason jars???
author: Range B.

description: The restaurant is clean, decent food. I'm writing this review for June, a server there, who provided us with excellent service. She was very courteous, patient, willing to answer questions and customize the order. I asked for a soup they were willing to make spicy for my preference. On arrival I found it to be too spicy and so she graciously accepted to let me cancel that order without in the least making me feel bad for it. Smiling and happy server- such rarity these days. Always be like this June!
author: Nutcrackin C.

description: We live in the neighborhood and sadly, it has taken us far too long to try Vanida. After both dining in the restaurant and ordering delivery (a few times), Vanida is now our go-to, neighborhood Thai restaurant.  I highly recommend the papaya salad. I have tried it at various spice levels (a 5 was a mouth killer!) and settled on a 3 or 4 for a good kickback which doesn't knock you out.  Great service, clean restaurant and quick delivery service.
author: Johanna W.

description:
Never coming back...never eating food from here again.

That said and done, I guess you can tell that I am not happy with this place tonight.  After a long day, stopped off here to get my usual order and a side of steamed rice to go.  Got it home and when I dumped the box of steamed rice out onto a proper plate, there was all kinds of dark, odd foreign objects disbursed throughout my box of, what should have been clean white, steamed rice.

Almost went back, but I think it's quite obvious what has happened here.  For decades, I've heard nasty rumors about asian restaurants re-using old leftover rice from tables and have always tried to put it to the back of my mind.  Not sure if that's what happened here or if someone used a dirty spatula to put it into the box, but the damage is done.  I initially tried isolating the offending bad part, but got pissed off that it was so nicely distributed throughout the whole box.  

Not sure what happened...not sure I really want to know.  Anyway, I took a bunch of pictures and posted a couple here in the photo section.  BTW, as you might notice, the amount of rice on the plate, relative to the box is quite less...the reason is that I got so mad that I started throwing away the worst parts before I realized I should take a picture.  Regardless, these pictures should suffice.

In all fairness, I guess I could have gone back and they probably would have replaced it, but to be honest, why should I?  Why should I have to drive allllllll the way back there and also why should I even have to deal with this BS?  Once the trust is violated, I see no point in ever going back.

Bought a replacement box of steamed white rice to use as an accompaniment from another restaurant in another neighborhood close to home.  It may have been cheap, low grade rice, but it was hot, fresh, white, and clean...hell, it was like the Cadillac of white steamed rice tonight after the other rice that I got at Vanida.

Food didn't quite taste the same tonight either.  Front staff was different from who we usually see too...did they sell the place?  I have no idea.  Sorry guys, I referred a bunch of people to you in the past, but you won't see me in here anymore.
author: Roy N.

description:
If I can give them 5 stars based solely on how nice the staff is, I would, but, unfortunately, that was the only bright spot of the meal.

The prices are about average to any other Thai restaurant in the Sunset area. The taste is nothing extraordinary. The portions for the entrees in this place are small, however, which makes the average price seem like a fortune.

Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, but my entree was very stingy. Ordered the garlic shrimp and out comes a plate covered in a bed of lettuce and on top are 9 (yes, I counted) shrimp tossed with some garlic sauce. And these weren't big shrimp, but the size of shrimp that are served in bulk at buffets. This comes down to $1 a shrimp for this entree!

Great staff, but not worth the price. Still willing to give them a shot later on (ordering something else of course), but definitely not when I'm super hungry (just in case).
author: Zeia V.

description: Had a late night carry out and went with their Drunken Noodle. It's one of my usuals at Thai places and hard to mess up. While I came on a Friday night towards closing, one could see the staff trying to rush (more so because of the limited staff and several people trying to get food). The gal was very friends and polite. When I finally tried the drunken noodles there was a strange alight sour odor. Wasn't sure exactly what it was and the over all dish seems really pale/light. They didn't put in enough sauce which you could tell when there were blotches of noodles still untouched by anything. The chicken was great though and overall meal wasn't too bad. Definitely not the best or standard I've had.
author: James L.

description:
New chef? I have been eating at Vanida for 12 years or more! And I have really noticed a major change in the last few visits this past month. I like that when you ask for spicy they are going for it with Thai hot meaning lots and lots of Thai bird chilis chopped up in a multitude of color. I like the heat but I'm also noticing less flavor in the spice and herb category. Be it pad Thai, Prig Khing, drunken noodles, and Ga Prow. The green papaya salad has been on point! The veggie Tim yum is full of a wide variety of veg but has gotten way way too sweet. 

The quality of the produce and meat is fantastic that has remained. The service is the same seems like sweet shy family members. King of Thai doesn't feel clean and I don't think they wash the produce before prepping and Marnee is far from this neighborhood.

I will keep going back.
author: Carey C.

description:
I am a pick-up order regular here. I love this place. I am a forgetful & tired person so I forget they dont take amex and i forget to check my bank acct before I pick up or bring cash and had to walk back home to find an alternative payment method twice so far haha. The staff were so accommodating and were very nice about my slip-ups. I promise I'll bring the right payment next time lol!

So obviously the staff gets a 5/5 for being really chill and patient.

The food is fantastic here. They do a great brown rice, and I usually get yellow curry with chicken (5/5)  to eat with it. The yellow curry is a little spicy and I dig that. 

 I also recommend the garlic pork (5/5). the pork and the green sauce that comes with it are both delicious. get it with rice. 

angel wings (4/5)  are nice and crispy. 

Pad ma keur (eggpant) also gets a 5/5. w/rice

If you come here at lunch, you can get several choices with a side of salad and rice or pad thai for like 8-10 dollars or so (I think).

cute place for a date, good lunch deals, and pickup time is usually 10 minutes!
author: Rose M.

description:
they used to be really good, but the meals have been not so good lately.  Recently, we got a mango rice dish (thats normally good) and it looked a little rancid, it was gross.  Sometimes our dishes were burned, and they seem to be skimping out on varies things now....unfortunate, this place used to be pretty good.

The hostess/waiting staff is really good though.
author: Jordan M.

description: I come here often and the food is always solid. Love the pad kee mao and the curries are excellent. Don't forget to use the check in offer for free ice cream!
author: Edward H.

description: The red curry was awful. It tasted like it had sand in it and the flavor was super off. I ordered a red curry with tofu, side of rice, and side of veggies and all of it was tasteless with the most obscured textures. Save yourself the hassle and hit Thai Cottage down the street.
author: Lindsay K.

description:
Ok, I live very close to Vanida Thai Kitchen so I've had the opportunity to come here a few times and finally give my impressions.

The interior of the restaurant is nice and comfortable, a fairly small interior but nicely lighted and decorated. Clean feeling. The wait staff is also friendly.

Some interesting dishes include the Mee Krob (crispy sweet noodles with prawns). Although I'm not a big fan of sweet appetizers, it was still interesting and something I've never had before. I am a fan of tofu, so I also enjoyed their Tofu Tod. Thai French Fries were also worth trying.

Their curries and noodles are also all tasty, and portions are generous as well. Everything's plated nicely, and they offer delivery too which is convenient. All ingredients taste fresh as well. I've yet to order anything that was straight up bad.

All in all, great experiences here so far. Definitely an above average Thai restaurant.
author: Melody S.

description:
Thai French Fries, ordered from the vegetarian appetizers part of the menu, were made from wedges of yam in a light batter coating and served with sweet peanut sauce. The yam was done perfectly - firm yet soft. Of course, the sweet peanut sauce was just the right combination of sweet and sour. The menu states they only use healthy oil without trans fat and just slightly saturated. So, I didn't feel any guilt eating all the Thai fries. 

Reminiscing about my favorite adventure writer, Jack London, I decided to order the duck curry. It was a great choice. There was an unusually generous portion of duck in the curry and every bite of the fatty meat was delectable. Combined with the brown rice to soak up all the curry, I didn't leave a morsel for any mouse.

When I ordered a glass of cabernet sauvignon, the waitress thought I said curry noodle! I gave her a very punctuated English lesson about cabernet sometimes being referred to as "cab" like a taxi. I think she sincerely appreciated it. I was worried that the cab was going to be from a stale bottle, but it was fresh and a generous serving.
author: Ken R.

description: This place is under-rated and not too many people that I have talked to know about this place. I only have been here about three times but if I could I would go everyday especially since they offer a sort of happy hour type deal until 3. They have really good deals where you can order two things from the menu as a combo and still get a soup and a scoop of rice. I really liked their eggplant basil and crispy rolls. The soup was ok, I think too creamy for my taste buds. The server was pretty nice and was very mindful about checking to see if I had enough water. All in all, I will be back again.
author: Desiree C.

description: Food was hot when we got it. Good service. We ordered the Chicken Satay, Yellow curry and Pad Thai.  Yellow curry has good coconut favorite, a little sweet for my taste.  Pad Thai has good favor. Will come again.
author: Christin W.

description: Had the roasted duck noodle soup for lunch. Broth is flavorful and duck pieces are delicious. As expected in a traditional Asian restaurant the duck does have some fat and skin. Waitress was very pleasant.
author: Raul M.

description: This is one of my favorite Thai restaurants! I usually only eat here during lunch and there is never a wait. I always order the lunch special for $8.50, which comes with soup or salad and a choice of two different entrees. The portions are good enough to fill me up and most of the items on the menu that I tried, I enjoyed. The ground chicken ga prow is a favorite of mine that I get literally every single time I eat here. The pad thai is also one of my favorites here.
author: Andy Z.

description: This is a nice little place.  They have good vegetarian options, if that matters to you.  Pleasant atmosphere, courteous service.
author: jonny s.

description: Something has changed.  Prices are 20% more... Food portion looks smaller.   Thank God it is still tasty.
author: william f.

description:
My buddy and I needed a place to grab some grub after getting our drink on at the Yelp event in Potrero Hill.  We had originally planned to eat at Vanida Thai in the sunset before the event and decided to stick with the plan afterward.

I ordered the lunch special with 2 items and got the green curry with chicken and peanut sauce beef.  The meal started off with a cup of their creamy tom kha soup with chicken and I found it to be pleasantly extra creamy but didn't really like the sliced onions in it.  The entrees were a decent size and I enjoyed their peanut sauce.  I got a really big piece of cartilage in my beef though and the curry came out really spicy but kind of bland and I would pass on it next time.

Overall I wasn't all that impressed with Vanida.  The food was mostly meh and the service was very rushed since I guess they were wrapping up for lunch and I ended up paying for our meal in the middle of it.  I might have come at a bad time, but for my money I will go with King of Thai Noodles next time.

Food: 4/10

Service: 5/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 5/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Too lazy to cook and too lazy to eat out, I ordered take-out from Vanida Thai Kitchen.

The minimum purchase of $17 for free delivery was not bad. However, we waited 50 minutes for our food to arrive. We were starving!

Thai French Fries (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uauHhqLPVP0ug-_qCzzT9Q?select=4Krzl021-bYj2gbMcpAzHA): $6.50. Deep fried yam in coconut butter, served with spicy sweet and sour sauce. I imagined the yam in the form of fries, but instead it looked like tempura. Nicely battered and fried, the yam was soft and sweet. The sauce was not needed, but added tanginess to the yam.

Duck Curry (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uauHhqLPVP0ug-_qCzzT9Q?select=T_t3gQ_NR528f_WEICYDyg): $8.95. Boneless roast duck in spicy red curry with tomato, pineapple, bell pepper, zucchini and basil. Being that my mom cannot handle spicy foods, the mildness of the curry was perfect for her. For me, it was disappointing since it did not taste spicy at all. The portion was quite small and the curry was thin. Despite all that, the curry was the best dish of the night.

Pad See Ew (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uauHhqLPVP0ug-_qCzzT9Q?select=g80-9doI2fHnCMndcQPKGg): $7.95. Stir-fried rice noodle with chicken, egg, Chinese broccoli in soy sauce. A simple dish, yet this one came out extremely dry and bland. There were only pieces of chicken, and hardly any egg in sight. 

Total came out to $29 with tax and tip. More than I'd like to pay for small portions, decent flavors and a long wait.
author: Marti L.

description:
Came here cause we could not find parking near out first choice restaurant.  The servers were very nice and we got seated quickly.  Ordered the tom kha for 2, pad see ew with beef, yellow curry with chicken, Thai iced tea and 2 scoops of rice.

The thai iced tea came with a cute little rose made of the wrapper, nice presentation.  You really cannot mess up thai tea and their was nice and strong.  The soup was yummy and just enough to start dinner on a good note.  The other two dishes were not too great.  The yellow curry was way too spicy.  We ordered the yellow curry so we could feed our toddler but it was too spicy for even us.  Every other restaurant I've been to, the yellow curry was nice and mild.  Also, the potatoes were undercooked which is a no-no.  The pad see ew was lacking flavor and the beef and chinese broccoli was undercooked.  

I would try them again for the lunch special and maybe order other things that people are raving about like the garlic pork...
author: Maria G.

description:
Vanida Thai Kitchen is a great option for Thai food. The outside looks dated but inside is a clean, modern, cozy restaurant. For couples or small groups, it's a nice place to eat-in, or pick-up is fine too which is what I did. The surrounding area is generally residential so just drive around and you'll be able to find some parking. I picked up: 

- Tom Yum Gai: A let down! The soup had all the right tom yum fixins but it lacked that sour heat element. I like tom yum soup that makes my mouth pucker and no puckering here.

- Pad Kee Mao (Drunken Noodles) with beef: Delicious. The noodles were a bit thinner than those I've had in pad kee mao dishes but the flavor was spot on. 

- Garlic Pork: They nailed the garlic flavor. The meat is tender and the Vanida green sauce is like a Thai chimichurri. It's herby, citrusy, salty, a little sweet and with some spiciness. It's the bombdotcom, and trust, I was dipping my beef from the pad kee mao into the sauce. 

- Duck Curry: The curry was flavorful and had a good spice level. There were ample pieces of duck (skin included...yumm!) but the dish had a little too much pineapple. It surprisingly wasn't overly sweet because of the pineapple. Still a good option if you want curry.
author: Maya S.

description:
I love this place! This place always amazes me! Great food, awesome service and never had to wait for a table. 

Every single dish is full of delicious spices . The curry, fried rice, chicken dishes....omg, they are finger lickin good! 

Parking sucks so you're better off just ordering take out.
author: Annette F.

description: Nice neighborhood Thai restaurant. Order delivery from Yelp often and they offer excellent customer service. Forgot to pack my Thai iced tea one night when I picked up my order and they offered to deliver it to my house. Would recommend the angel wings, pad see yew (Thai spicy), and any of their curry dishes.
author: Sophia N.

description: The service was friendly and I really like that they have a lunch combo for a really fair price (two items for like 7 bucks). Also comes with your choice of a salad or soup. I had the chicken yellow curry and the garlic pork. The curry could have had a bit more flavor for my liking and I really enjoyed the garlic pork, especially the green sauce that it comes with. I think I'll come back to try some of their items in the near future.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Good thai food.

Tom Yum noodle soup was yummy. Wasn't too sour like other places.

Fried calamari was good. It was seasoned and lightly battered. 

Pad thai was well made. Meat was cooked perfectly, I hate it when I get super over cooked meat in my pad thai. 


Service was very polite. 

I always forget about this location becase it's a bit out of the way.
author: Erica L.

description: Very friendly staff, reasonable price, place was clean and comfortable, food was good.
author: Steven L.

description:
This was my local Thai restaurant and wanted to give this place a try because of that. The place was small and the restroom was inconveniently placed. They squeezed so many tables together that one is bound to hit the table next to the which one is sitting when sitting down or getting up. 

The food is pretty good, just need to know what to order. I would stay away from the seafood. The seafood that I had ordered tasted more like fried tofu than fish. And there were a couple other plates that could had been better.
author: M C.

description: Vanida is delicious and affordable. (One time I was in there and they gave me a free bottle of wine!)
author: Kyle N.

description: Vanida is delicious and affordable.  One time I was in there and they gave me a free bottle of wine!
author: Laura P.

description:
Ordered an array of lunch items through Caviar for a business lunch--
Food was for the most part edible-- but the veges in the Tom Kha soup ( 8.50) 
were spoiled ( baby corn) and  broccoli had quite a bit of yellow. I didn't realize corn was spoiled until I wasmore than half way through soup, as I usually save the baby corn for last -- and now my tummy is feeling terrible-- I am afraid it spoiled the broth ..... This was a tofu and vege soup and there was about 4 small pieces of tofu-- so in short-- not good and too much money for what I got. When a place serves spoiled food that's the end for me --
author: Alexandra C.

description:
This place is delicious. My boss orders from here each time we have a work event/meeting. It is the highlight of my day each time.

The Pineapple fried rice is the best I've had. I usually go to Marnee Thai and it's great there too, but something about the texture and the soft clumps of rice that just work for me, every time! That usually gets devoured the most I also enjoyed the Pad Sew (not sure what it was called). It's tasty here, wish I would've known about it sooner!

Parking isn't bad, it's street parking but since it's in closer to the beach, it's not overcrowded like how it would be in other parts of the city.

Happy eating!
author: Sweets N.

description: Good Thai food, nice staff, and decent prices. Knocked one star off bc of recent experiences. One time, I chose a side of soup but received a salad instead. The waitress insisted I ordered the salad even though I specifically asked about the kind of soup they had and never even said the word "salad." Another time I had dinner with a friend and ordered pad see ew. "Chicken?" asked the waiter. "No, tofu," I said. Pad see ew came with chicken anyway. The waiter first said he wouldn't charge us for that order due to their mistake, but ended up just giving us a complimentary dessert (totally fine). And just last night, I ordered food to be delivered - pork eggplant, but AGAIN got chicken. A little frustrating!
author: Krizia L.

description: This place is so far only the people that live close by would eat here.  Nothing special but the service was good.  I would not drive here for this though even though it's more cost efficient than Osha.
author: Chris L.

description:
Most of the dishes on the menu are only average but have you seen the prices. Lunch at a Thai place staring at $6.50 is hard to beat plus it is close to my house. 

As you might have guessed my family ordered a few lunch combinations: 

Ga Prow - my favorite; I wanted to eat the entire dish but decided to be generous and share 

Red Curry with Chicken - not great

Pra Ram - least favorite of the family

Gai Yang - chicken was tender and liked the spicy sweet & sour sauce

Pad Ma-Kuer - not great but we needed some veggies

All of that to feed a family of five with a couple boxes of leftover. This place is affordable and have a couple decent dishes.
author: Andrew W.

description:
Just a great little place in the little "Restaurant Row" of the dear little Outer Sunset.

Every dish the wife and I have ever had there has been fantastic. We can only opine on the vegetarian options.

* Curry Puffs, which are deep fried taro, are rightly renowed. Yummy and very satisfying.

* Papaya salad: Just terric, though the excessive dressing forms the South China Sea at the bottom of the serving plate.

* Tofu Satay: Nice job of getting char marks and grill flavor on skewered tofu cubes. Good peanut sauce.

* Thai French Fries. Like the Curry Puffs, this deep fried dish is deeply satisfying, the kind of dish you can really sink your teeth into. The coating is fresh and crisp, like well made tempura. Yummy sweet dipping sauce.

The service is warm and efficient, and the atmosphere is simple, pleasing, and relaxing.

A winnah!!!
author: Duke E.

description:
TL;DR: solid choice for a mellow, intimate meal with fresh ingredients, traditional fare and  good service. Too bad they close early during!

Been here for dinner and really liked the salmon panaang. Went for lunch today. LOVE the lunch specials. 2 item combo for $8.95 and added $1 for brown rice, which includes tom yum or coconut soup. 


I got the shrimp and tofu. Well spiced, flavorful and authentic tasting. Ingredients seem fresh, incl the veggies. Good portions. Service on point and never had to flag down server (big in my book when they're proactive).
author: Jason N.

description:
I have never written a review for a restaurant before, but I feel compelled to write a review over the treatment that Vanida gave myself and friends. My girlfriend and I have lived in San Fran for about 3 years, and we have been ordering from Vanida occasionally, totalling about a couple dozen times. The food is good, the delivery time is reasonable. 

For my birthday, we decided to get Vanida for delivery. We ordered two curries, one mild and one medium spicy. We also ordered drunken noodle, which is not supposed to be spicy at all. There was no indication on the menu that it was spicy. We also ordered the drunken noodle from their restaurant several times before, and it was never spicy. When we got the food, EVERYTHING WAS LAVA HOT SPICY. My girlfriend and I like spicy food, so spicy is not normally a problem for us. But our friend could not eat spicy at all, and she was the one who ordered the drunken noodle. We could not even eat the drunken noodle, it was pure fire.

Of course we call to complain since our friend could not even eat the food that she paid for. The staff was extremely unapologetic. I believe they said, "Other people ordered these dishes, and they didnt complain it was too spicy!" After talking for a couple minutes (really arguing and defending), they finally redelivered the food about an hour later... with the condition that we return all the previous food that was too spicy. The delivery driver was also on the band wagon that it was all our fault. When he delivered the food, he insisted that "next time, ask for not spicy at all".

So remember Vanida customers: If you do not want your food to be inedibly spicy, you MUST ask for non spicy. Even if you like spicy food normally. Even if you the menu says that it is not spicy. Even if you had ordered it several time before and it was not spicy.

I worked in a restuarant for seven years, so I know the standard operating procedure when it comes to dealing with customer complaints. The way that they got so butt hurt about it leaves a bad taste in my mouth (pun intended). Will not be ordering from them again (good job Vanida!)
author: Neville B.

description: I used to come here 20 years ago- it was my initial delving into Thai food. Unfortunately, the place has changed over time - probably a rotation in staff - and we won't be returning. My favorite had always been the corn cakes (Tod Mun J) but they've changed the recipe over time and it's no longer outstanding. The entrees were acceptable, but the service was highly inattentive, even though there was only one other party in the place. We waited for everything, all the way to waiting for the bill. It was like being in a bad Chinese food restaurant. It did not have the pride of a family restaurant - it seemed like they'd much rather be doing something else. With the tone of other reviews here, they may get that opportunity. Such a loss.
author: Nick L.

description:
Good Thai food. Fresh & tasty ingredients. Prompt and friendly service. Lots of take out orders wandered through while I was eating my dinner. 

Quiet, except for the top 40 radio station (ugh)

I will eat here again if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: K H.

description:
This place is pretty decent for something that's literally right across the street from where I live. Idk why I never gave this place a try until this year! 

I like that they have a vegetarian menu. My mom goes on her vegan streaks from time to time and this is a really nice place to go to when we have our dinner dates. 

-  Calamari is delicious. It has a nice crisp to it and it's served along side a sweet and sour sauce. 

- I absolutely love Tom Yum soup. I get the Tom Yum Goong which is with prawns.

- I don't eat curry much, but when I do, I always order the yellow curry. I specifically order the Tofu Curry from the vegetarian menu just because I love love love tofu :)  i'm also not a big fan of having chicken or prawns in my curry anyway because its usually very dry, which I don't like.

- I ordered the Duck Basil before which is duck sautéed with chili, garlic, bell pepper and basil. It was good, but the whole dish consisted mainly of bell peppers and not so much of the duck. 

- Pad Thai and Pad See-Ew are also great dishes. Nothing special, but these are usually the dishes i order when i eat with more than two people. 

- The Pineapple Fried Rice is the dish i ALWAYS get for myself when i'm here =] I think i have a little obsession with pineapple...haha! they definitely don't skimp on the pineapples in this dish. Super sweet chunks of goodness! 

Overall, i definitely see myself coming back here to eat every now and then for as long as i still live across the street from it!(: Service here is very quick and the waitresses are very sweet.
author: Anh T.

description:
Yums: tom yum soup, pad thai, spicy ginger tofu. 

Could be yums-ier: the lunch salad.

Service is fast. Small place, but I liked how clean it was and that the music playing in the kitchen was fun and audible in the dining area. 

I'd go back fo' sho'!
author: Monica D.

description:
On all other occasions I would have given this place 4 stars, but I had the unpleasant experience of finding a long black hair in my sticky rice. I can't think of anything worse than paying for food and getting all the way home only to find your food completely inedible.
