When you pay money for food, you expect and trust that it is sanitary and you shouldn't have to fear that there will be hairs in it. I'm truly disgusted. Sadly, despite enjoying my other visits to Vanida Thai, I will not be returning. 

Clearly the food Gods hate me, because this same experience happened at Chipotle. Sigh.
author: Justine M.

description: Vanida used to be my to go spot for Thai food but over the years their quality has been slowly declining. Their flavored just aren't as robust as they used to be and lack that special touch they used to have... They have also become more and more skimpy, I used to be able to be full off of one entree but now I need one and a half.
author: Allen Z.

description: This place is pretty good flavorful dishes and inexpensive lunch special. Will def be returning since its way better King of Thai that I usually go to for Thai food in the neighborhood
author: Theresia B.

description:
This place is a small, cute Thai restaurant in the Sunset. Yes, parking is always a problem here as is anywhere else in the city. The inside is colorfully decorated with lots of things to look at. I always love looking at the things hung up in restaurants. Guilty pleasure perhaps?

We were seated right away. I was surprised that it wasn't that busy on a Friday night, but that's okay since I was hungry! Our waiter was very nice and helpful to some of the people in my group who hadn't eaten Thai food before. However, there was a waitress there who seemed really irritated with every little question we asked her. (Rolling eyes, just a very 'I don't want to be here' attitude, etc) 

The food here was good Thai food. I tried a little bit of everything: pad thai, baby corn chicken, eggplant something??, yellow curry, and sticky rice with mango. Wasn't disappointed at all; it was all really good! The pad thai was a little drier than I've had before, but it wasn't that big of a change to make me not like it. The sticky rice and mango was a delight! Such a refreshing dessert, hands down one of my favorites. At Vanida, it was decent as in it hit the spot and I was satisfied but not the best I've ever had. 

Overall, other than that one waitress, it was good dining experience.
author: Priyam D.

description: Tom Yum Goong Soup was horrible! It was way too salty, too salty to eat :/ I ordered it spicy and it was barely spiced. Good fried rice though. Disappointing place. I hope you have better luck with your delivery.
author: Aditya D.

description:
Ok, this place has turned around.   
The food is back to the quality that it used to be.   
This is a must go Thai spot.
author: Johnny C.

description:
My friend and I were in the neighborhood yesterday and decided to give Vanida a go! We Yelped this place before hand, and it seemed to be a relatively good place, however we were quite disappointed with our experience! 

We arrived around 6pm on a Tuesday, with only 2 other parties there, just before the dinner crowd. The decor is very cute, ethnic paintings are displayed on a burgandy and cream wall. 

I ordered the Pad Thai and substituted the prawns for beef, and requested it to be "medium-spicy" and an iced Thai tea. My friend ordered the Pad Thai (as is) and the Yellow Curry with chicken. By now, almost all of the tables in the restuarant were full! 

My Pad Thai was eloquantly garnished, however the taste was underwhelming. It was under-seasoned, and needed more salt. I was very disappointed that there was no spiciness at all whatsoever. My friend agreed that the Pad Thai wasn't the best, however I must say that the Yellow Curry was flavorul and spicy. 

As for the prices for dinner, I was very surprised how small the portion was for the price! The Pad Thai was $7.95 and the curry was $7.78. NOTE: the curry does not come with rice!!!! You must purchase rice on the side for $1.25 per person! I found that to be very odd, usually curry comes with some rice on the side. 

Overall, I had high hopes for this place, however was very disappointed with the quality and quantity of food provided. For a $10 dinner, I could have gone to Panda Express and ordered much more food! 

tl;dr - If you're going to order a curry dish, you need to purchase rice on the side! It does not come with it!
author: Alissa M.

description:
Phone ordering is problematic. They stopped accepting web orders long ago. 

Long time loyal customer, loved Vanida. Used to order almost weekly. 

As of December, I can't get an order through. The person who now answers the phone doesn't understand me (not a problem in the past 3 years) and hangs up on me, or leaves the phone on the counter for minutes at a time without a word.

Bizarre, but I now have to find a new Thai restaurant, despite the delicious food. 

Vanida, your phone problems are costing you a long time customer.
author: Robert F.

description:
With decent reviews and close by, the boy said we should try a new place for Thai food- so we stopped by here. How this place has such high ratings, I don't know.

We started with the Thai French fries which were not fries at all. They were round slices of yam, some cut so thick that it still seemed raw. Batter used seemed more like tempura.. More fritter like than fries. False advertising! 

We then shared the Pra ram with the mixed veggies and a vegetarian pad Thai.  Pra ram sauce was chunky and okay.. veggies in the dish were not fully cooked and was hard to eat. As for pad Thai, same undercooked veggies and the sauce was just bland. as the boy put it, maybe we just ordered their worst 3 dishes. Who knows.

The interior is very nice and service was good, but food was straight up disappointing. I expected a lot more based on reviews. Will not be coming back.
author: Katrina L.

description: So just got some food to go. After looking at a few of the pictures and reviews from everyone. Garlic pork looked amazing, so I went for that, some soup, and angel wings. Wings were good (marnee thais do kick their butts a bit though) and the garlic pork does not look anything like the pictures on here, which were all juicey/saucey looking. It was; tastey, but only the slightest garlic flavor. Just not what I thought it was going to be. I'll give them another go.
author: Mark A.

description: Haven't actually been to the restaurant but I get Vavida for take out and it's delicious. The pineapple fried rice is bomb but could use more pineapple. Chicken wings are okay and pad Thai is pretty good. Good Thai food of you're looking for it in the sunset.
author: Anastasia P.

description:
Cute lil' Thai restaurant in the Outer Sunset that I just found out about through Yelp! My boyfriend is a vegetarian & we were needed more veggie-friendly options. They have a whole section for vegetarians! Yay! 

Food & service was great. The restaurant was going to close within an hour, but the servers were still friendly & allowing people to come in (some places give you dirty looks). I had the Tom Yum Noodle Soup. It was delicious, but only had 2 shrimps & it wasn't that spicy. My boyfriend has the Tofu Cashew Nut with veggies & it was delicious as well. The sauce was on-point & I kept eating his food. 

Servers checked in with his and did not rush us. Decor was nice & parking was easy (well maybe it's because it was at night). 

I'd come back again!
author: Michelle F.

description: Prices were good. Especially considering the plates were very tasty! The $1.50 Tea was BOMB, and free refills. Overall this spot really gives you more bang for your buck, and you'll leave not regretting anything.
author: Dayne C.

description:
I went to Vanida Thai for lunch, there weren't that many people around so we were seated quickly.  

I had the curry noodles with chicken.  The food arrived long before we would start wondering where it was.  The curry noodles tasted great, nicely spiced without too much curry.  My only complaint was that the portion size was rather small.  I could have eaten a lot more.
author: The Bottomless Pi T.

description: The best Thai Restaurant!!! I get sad when the food is not good... But this restaurant is the bomb!!! The Garlic Pork with the house green sauce, pad see ew, pork yellow curry, and chicken basil. The best that I've had!!! Hmmm...hmmm!!! I will definitely go back!!!
author: Paul C.

description:
4.5 stars! Overall great taste, cute decor, good service. Nice. 

We ordered the Chicken Eggplant, and Yellow Curry with Prawns. The flavor was yummy and the ingredients were fresh. Presentation was good, but not fancy extraordinary. Nonetheless, I love this little place. 

For dessert, we had the deep fried banana with honey! YUM! exactly what i was craving! However, I've had better at another thai place, probably because they cut the banana at an angle so the ratio tasted better at the other place, but here they cut it horizontally. But those are just my quirks.

The only thing is that the bill came out larger than I had expected. Still relatively cheap though.
author: Josie W.

description:
Vanida Thai Kitchen is the only option for good Thai food around this area and thank God this place is absolutely a gem. Along the lone restaurant row of lower Taravel St. This place is the it place if you need a family owned good Thai joint, on the outside it looks like the rest but in the inside with clean decor, minimalist yet inviting tables it is a perfect place for a date or with good friends. 

The food is awsome!  Lunch special is a must for the local Sunset folks .. next best option may be to go either to King of Thai for street food style up on 28th Ave. or Sloat, but why bother when the perfect place is right here. 

They have good mix of the usual Thai fare, from Pad Thai, Yellow, Green, Curries and specials include Salmon and interesting coconut concoction. Vanida Thai is spot on for good, comfort Thai food. You never know a gem in the middle of residential Sunset area until you go in.
author: Eui O.

description:
When I'm lazy and don't want to leave the house for dinner. I always grubhub.com VTK for delivery. Items I have ordered:

tom yum noodle soup- yum
pad see ew with chicken- yum
garlic pork- so good especially with the dipping sauce
pad thai- meh
pineapple fried rice-bland
chicken satay- moist
egg rolls- it's usually good but the last time was doughy (under cooked maybe)
fish cake- yum
angel wings-yum
papaya salad- fresh and light (get the dressing on the side unless you like it drenched in it)

As for service...I've never dined in at the restaurant but the delivery guy is always friendly.
author: Jo S.

description:
I've eaten here for lunch and dinner and the food is decent.

I never had any issues with waiting because every time I've been here, there were always tables available.

Service is decent. They check in on you to make sure you're satisfied with the food.

My recommendations:
- Lunch combinations: you can choose 1 or 2 entrees along with rice and soup/salad. Some of the entrees have an additional $1 charge.
- Tom Kha soup: this restaurant does a good job on making my favorite Thai soup!

Overall this restaurant is pretty good and I would come again to try out more of their dishes. However, I do have other Thai restaurants that I prefer to go to more.
author: Jenny T.

description: I love this place. They have great lunch specials and generous portions. The only thing I would comment on is that some of the curries are not always consistent and there always seems to be new staff who don't know the menu well but don't let that discourage you from eating here! It's great!
author: Natasha D.

description:
I've lived a couple blocks from this place for years but I don't know why I've never tried it. 

My aunt and I randomly came here for lunch and was pleasantly surprised at how nice and clean it looked on the inside. The lunch menu deal was so cheap! 6.95 for 1 item or 7.50 for 2 items. Both with either a salad or soup and rice. 

I got the fried eggrolls and pad thai. They gave me 2 eggrolls cut in half and they were pretty good. The pad thai was alright. Kind of dry for me and for a pad thai with shrimp, it only had one shrimp but then again this is pretty cheap...

One of the favorite thing was how they fold the wrapper of the straw into a rose. It was such a cute touch. They even do it for the to go thai teas. And the thai tea was really good, not too sweet or bland. 

Overall, I would come back if I'm craving thai food and don't feel like venturing too far. Probably won't get their pad thai but hopefully their other stuff is better. I saw that they have free delivery which seems pretty awesome on a lazy rainy day.
author: Katie M.

description:
Great food, prices and service. Parking is usually good but this is the City. 

I'm in a mixed marriage, vegan and omnivore, and we are both happy here. I can't recall a bad meal in the dozens of times we've been here. Even the one street crazy was entertaining. I'm a very satisfied diner.
author: Art R.

description:
Yeah, seriously, wow.

I lived right down the street from here, a good three blocks away. To be honest, it was the best Thai food I've ever had. The Pad Thai was fantastic, and the peanut sauce is remarkable. 
The restaurant has a nice aesthetic, they provide generous portions, with very good food. Definitely check it out. 

And yes, vegan friendly,

Enjoy it, and as always, think before you eat.
author: Travis J.

description:
Vanida offers very good - if somewhat pedestrian - Thai food. I should begin with the note that I'm a bit spoiled, having previously lived in the Thai Town neighborhood of LA, and experiencing some of the best, authentic Thai food around. That said, Vanida does a great job at what they do.

And what they do is a slightly more accessible Thai offering. You can get the standards - Tom Yum or Tom Khai soup, curries, Pad Thai, sticky rice and the such. They do all of these items well - very tasty, high quality ingredients. 

The restaurant has a nice ambiance, and their delivery time is pretty decent. Friendly staff makes the experience good, too.

I'd add an extra star if they added more of the adventurous Thai items to the menu, and also if they amped up the spiciness. But it's a good place that I frequent often, check it out.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
3.5 stars (4 for service and cleanliness. 3 for food) I came here for lunch after staying at a friends house. We wanted something good, but not too hearty so we decided to go here for the lunch specials.

The lunch special prices were very reasonable. I opted for the 2 selection combos so I can try more one thing since we weren't doing the typical family style. I got the pad thai and the garlic pork, which was served alongside with rice and an option of soup (tom kha or tom yum) or house salad. The plates are pretty big. I was only able to finish half of my order. My friend ordered the satay chicken, and her portion was as big as ours. I really enjoyed my garlic pork. It was marinated very well and was accompanied with a cilantro/lime type of dipping sauce. The pad thai was good, but I'd had better. I felt that the noodles were slightly overcooked, so it stuck a lot more. 

Service was great though. The waitress was really friendly and always kept our waters filled, which is really appreciated after a night out. Overall quality of food and prices, I'd recommend this place.
author: Vi L.

description: I stopped in here after work completely starving. I ordered the Pad Thai but there was no peanut sauce or peanuts in sight (or taste). All I got was a big clump of noodles left over from the bottom of the pot with a side of cabbage and bean sprouts. The noodles had almost no flavor and I could pick up the whole clump with my fork. Should have gotten a burrito on my home instead!
author: Manuela R.

description:
It's a high 3. Very close to making it to 4 but it lacked a bit of punch that I am accustomed to at a Thai place. The food came out very mild even when ordered Thai hot.

We ordered 
Miang Kum ( 4stars) 
roasted sweet coconut, sliced lime, red onion, ginger and cashew nut, all served on a spinach leaf with a side of tamarind-Ginger syrup
Red curry Tofu
Thai Fried Rice
A beer and an Iced tea.

All tasted pretty good but nothing extraordinary. They have a huge selection of veggie appetizers...definitely will go to this place when I am in the neighborhood.
author: Ravi C.

description:
Love these guys!

Not calling anyone a liar, but I when I read some of the recent negative reviews they seem like they must be talking about another place. The inside of this little place is very clean and charming, and every time I call to order takeout the person who answers gets my order right, and doesn't even hesitate when I ask for "No fish sauce". Also, a note for fellow picky eaters like me: Many Thai recipes traditionally feature fish sauce so if it kind of grosses you out (or you want to be able to keep left overs in the fridge) you can order it without and these guys won't sneer!

I usually order lunch to go from Vanida, their lunch specials are all around $7 I think and are pretty generous portions for that. My personal fave is Chicken Cashew, amazing! I have definitely had weeks where I had Chicken Cashew from Vanida 4 days in a row, too tasty and too good of a deal. 

Bottom line: If you are in the Sunset and hankering for some tasty lunch for less than $10, check these guys out!
author: Jon J.

description: Just got my order via Eat24. This place is fantastic! Chicken and beef satey was juicy and tender. Portions very generous too. Rice, Pad Thai, and my Tom soup were superb. And delivery in 39 min or so. I think I will be ordering a lot from this place.
author: Laurie P.

description: This place was mediocre at best before...Mostly came for the low prices. I really enjoyed the Tom Yum Gai- until I just so happened to find a cockroach in it! Luckily I looked at my spoon before my bite!  So sad because I really liked that soup. Got my "meal" for free and left feeling hungry and disappointed... And pretty grossed out. Come on Vanida! I was rootin for ya!
author: Nicole K.

description:
get the mango curry
very high quality food
not full of grease floating at top
always come here!
author: Aditi A.

description: Vanida was to be really good a year ago. But now, it gets worse and worse... we even got sick for the last two times after having dinner there.
author: June F.

description: Most underrated thai restaurant in the city. Service is on point, atmosphere doesn't get better, and the food...unmatched. I've lived a block away from this establishment for 4 years and I haven't been let down once. The menu is updated frequently and it's always a pleasant surprise when I try the new items. Recommendations: vegetarian food. Drunken noodle is to die for and the thai french fries are innovative and delicious. You won't be disappointed. 5 stars.
author: Cameron B.

description:
This has been one of my neighborhood restaurants for a long time and I never ate here (or maybe did one time long ago). Recently I was reading their reviews here on Yelp and saw people write positive things about their lunch special, so I decided to check it out.

Indeed it was pretty good, and it's served on weekends also. You can choose a one-item combo for $6.50 or two items for $7.50, and included is a choice of a side salad or a cup of tom yum soup.  I believe there were 23 items for you to choose from. I chose the Thai barbecue chicken and the red curry beef. For a solo diner like me, it's a good opportunity to sample extra Thsi food items on the same plate without ordering whole entrees.

The decor is very nice and so was the young lady working as the staff yesterday afternoon. It's definitely worthwhile to consider returning.
author: H K.

description:
Wow - this place rocks - the food is delicious and the people are so gracious. I've eaten here many times, it's a favorite of my favorite people. 

So their daughter set up a surprise party for my favorite couple and they did a buffet style meal w/ appetizers, curries, meat on a stick (obviously I don't know what anything is called) and it was all delicious. they had this seafood in a ramekin thing that was awesome. 

I also really like the ambiance in this place, nice warm colors in the room, solid cherry wood chairs, table cloths - it's a great find and really affordable.
author: Rew C.

description:
I've lived in the Sunset almost my whole life and I pass by this place ALL the time.  My BF and I wanted something Mediterranean but we couldn't think of a place close with parking.  

We decided on coming here based on the yelp reviews.  We ordered the chicken satay and that got the thumbs up.  The curry puffs were also good and I was drawn to them because of the taro ingredient.  I couldn't get past the curry to taste the taro though.  And last we got the yellow curry with chicken.  Curry sauce was good but the chicken was a little tough from being over cooked.

The service was friendly but we did have to wait a little at the end to get our check.  I grabbed a to-go menu because it was good enough to eat again but next time I think I will have it delivered.
author: Rosalind S.

description: Love this place. Lunch special is awesome and incredibly cheap. Pork is phenomenal here.
author: Kelly B.

description:
I tried Vanida for the first time today. In the past i'd go to King of Thai on Sloat but I haven't been having good experiences there. 

The service is way better at Vanida. They were friendly and always refilling my hot tea. I ordered the yellow curry, which was good and you get a huge bowl. The rice is sold separately, which is unusual, but I think the amount of curry you get makes up for it.
author: Christina D.

description:
Why is it so hard to find good Thai in SF?  There's a ton of options, but in the last 2 years since I've moved back I've managed to stumble on a series of overpriced, small portions, no flavor, dime-a-dozen Thai joints.  Incredibly disappointing.

NOT ANYMORE!  I love this place.

1. Great food!  So fresh, great portions, great price.  Granted, I do admit it seemed to take awhile to get our food out... but worth the wait.

2. Great service!  The staff was super friendly.  Always kept my water full and checked in often to make sure we were okay.

3. Convenient!  No wait to sit down on a Wednesday evening.  Easy to park (!!!).

Will definitely come back.  We were super satisfied with our order:

Chicken Larb appetizer- No lettuce wraps here!  Almost all larb... almost too much so!
Pineapple Fried Rice- I am a sucker for this.  Maybe it's the big pieces of shrimp, perfectly cooked chicken, cashews, or pineapple... but I love it!
Chicken Green Curry- Plenty of chicken, zucchini, thai basil goodness.  A little runnier than I like my curry, but still great and flavorful.

Totaled about $25 before tip.  

YUM!  Will definitely be back!
author: Christine K.

description:
Me and my husband are often having lunch and dinner here. The place is nice and clean. The service is good too.

For lunch time, I always order the lunch combo: Garlic Prawn and my husband order GaYang Chicken + Garlic Prawn. 
The lunch combo served with Tom Yum (Sour) or Tom Kha (with coconut milk), you can choose either one. And they're all have a good taste.
I once tasted the Pad Thai, but I think the taste was so so.
For dessert, we always have Fried Banana with Ice Cream. yummy!

For dinner time, they serve the a la carte menu. We tried their Sweet and Sour Fish Fillet and Crispy Calamary, The fish was good, but the calamary was not as crispy as the name :)

overall, it's good food and good place.
author: Joice K.

description: Vanida is walking distance from the crib. Bonus for me! Cuzzo J. and bf both love this place too so that's another plus. It's a nice little neighborhood restaurant. Very cozy and clean inside. Simple decor, nothing too cheesy like some other Thai places. Last time, bf and I wanted to have a light dinner so we just got the Yum Yai (salad) and Drunken Noodle. It was more than enough for both of us but we managed to polish them off bc both dishes were so yummy! Everything was fresh and flavorful. We like tons of basil in our noodles and they delivered. Service was accommodating as usual. Great for take out too!
author: Liv A.

description:
Came here with the boyfriend for lunch and ordered off their lunch menu--which I might add is semi-reasonably priced (depending on what you order)

Service was okay. Nothing too memorable. Considering we were the only people there during lunch time, they would have been more attentive. We got our drink orders in (both of us had Thai iced teas), and I, in boredom, proceeded to watch our server make them. It put me off a little to watch him get large ice chunks from a bag of ice (the type you buy from a grocery store), and fill it to the rim with ice. It always leaves a bad taste in my mouth to see so much ice put into a drink. Oh well. When he brought them to our table, my bf got stuck with a large iceberg piece of ice floating in his drink. The drinks looked lighter than usual (perhaps all the ice?), but taste wise it was alright. I've had better thai teas.

Now onto the meal...Whenever I go to any Thai restaurant I find myself ordering the same Pad kee mao (with chicken or shrimp). I was a bit disappointed to see my plate set in front of me. I thought the portion was small, despite knowing it was a "lunch menu item". However, by the end of the meal I clearly had a case of "eyes bigger than my stomach" and I was filled, which my bf eating the leftover. The taste was yummy, so I was pleased with that. I thought this dish was reasonably priced.

Boyfriend had some two item combo with garlic shrimp and tofu with peanut sauce. I can see why he likes this place. The garlic shrimp was great, and the tofu as well, however the portions seemed kinda small and I don't see how it could have filled my voracious eater of a bf.

On a happy note, they gave us a complimentary dessert of sticky rice and mango (maybe cause the bf knows the owner who wasn't there?). I've ALWAYS wanted to try it at other restaurants, but always been put off by my slight picky-ness for mangoes. I was pleasantly surprised, and I will definitely find myself ordering dessert more often. Overall, I would come back here for great lunch deals.
author: Jenna H.

description: Probably my favorite spot to go to for Pad Thai pak. It's a perfect environment to have dinner talk with some friends.
author: Alicia H.

description: Great lunch specials especialy for take out! Very affordable and quality food. Love the garlic pork!
author: Casey C.

description:
I had a few friends with me and we decided to try Vanida's.  We ordered  Pad Thai, fish cakes, sweet and sour Tom Yum, and a chicken yellow curry.
It was pretty busy there. The service sucked, it took a while before we were seated and then once we were seated it even took more time.  Once our food got to the table the server hurried to serve the soup . . . spilling and clanking dishes around.  Out of all the dishes the soup was the best.  The yellow curry was rather sweet and not so curryish, the fish cakes were okay, nothing special, and the Pad Thai was good but nothing that really hit me. Overall the service sucked and the food was just okay. I was quite disappointed esp. checking out the Yelp reviews. I Won't be back.
author: D M.

description:
I was excited to see the reviews for this place and that they delivered.  We ordered Tom Yum Soup, Fish Cake, BBQ Beef, Garlic Pork, Pad See Eww, Panang Chicken, and Thai Iced Tea.  Total was $44 plus a $5 tip.

The soup lacked flaver, the fish cake was okay.  I didn't like their pad see eww, and their meat was tough.  The thai iced tea was good.   And I did like the flavor of the pork...but not the texture.

Their delivery time was right on.  And when I got their menu they were 1/2 full during dinner time.  But yea.... I tried.
author: Sheenie L.

description:
I had the chicken red curry lunch special and Thai iced tea. The tea was delicious. Not overwhelmingly sweet nor too creamy. At $2, it's cheaper than most other restaurants.

I chose tom yum (hot and sour soup) with my meal and it was alright. Instead of getting chicken I got vegetable tom yum so I found out that they put the vegetables in the soup base instead of having a separate pot of vegetable tom yum and chicken tom yum. The vegetables in the soup were crunchy which I can see why people may not like it, but I'd rather have fresh slightly crisp vegetables than soft vegetables that lost all of their flavor and nutrition. The soup wasn't very spicy, just okay. 

The curry tasted just like my mom's. I should add that she's from Thailand. A+! Unlike King of Thai, Vanida's has a less viscous curry with more coconut milk. It's more homemade and has simple flavors than all the stuff wt King of Thai I have no idea what they put in it. There's lots of chicken and just the right amount of rice on the side. The only downside was that the rice was really moist. Usually I like rice a little sticky, but with curry dryer rice soaks up the curry better. However I'd rather have the rice moist than dry and thinking that it's old. 

Additional info: One of the workers/owners is really funny. He loves singing. Very friendly staff. :)
author: Stacy G.

description:
Ordered these items

Nuer Yang (BBQ beef)- Great seasoning. 5 Stars

Pineapple Fried Rice- The dish was really small. It costs nothing to add a little more rice right?  Family and I also were expecting the dish to be served with a real pineapple. Anyway, we didn't get that strong flavor of pineapple from the rice. A little disappointed. 3 stars

Tom Yum Noodle Soup. This is supposed to be spicy. We even told the waiter to make it as spicy as they can. It's tom yum! It supposed to make us cry and sweat like crazy! Anyway, I will not order this again. 3 stars

Yellow Curry- Really Really Good! 5 stars!

Drunken Noodle- The best dish we had. A must try. This is basically a dish like Dry-fried beef ho fun. But they add some special seasoning. Pretty good indeed. 6 stars

Thai Iced Tea- 4 stars. I think it's $2.50. A little expensive. 

My dad found his plate to be a little dirty when we first sat down at the table. The owner gladly changed a new plate for him. No big deal. Would definitely come back to this place. Customer Service was great! But I never include customer service as part of my rating.
author: Ka N.

description:
Tried it once, and loved it!
I understand now why people like Thai food and Vanidas, it clearly makes the food worth the delivery wait!
author: Khaloud D.

description: Food is so unique and fresh. Try the coconut soup and taro puffs. Yum!
author: Bree G.

description:
I feel bad being a downer amidst a sea of good reviews. Here goes anyway.

The menu was obnoxiously long. Intimidatingly long. It was like, 100 items. This is a personal pet peeve of mine. I don't have time to try all those. But I won't dock them because, luckily, there was a sheet on the front for chef's favorites. So I took one of those -  the lamb curry. It was not very good. The lamb was hard and chewy. It was really more like a soup than a solid meal. And honestly, I felt like it shouldn't have been an entree. It would be a great side dish, but on it's own it was just not something you'd want to eat a whole meal of. 

I think I may have just made the wrong decision. A lot of my friends' food looked better than mine - pad thai especially. But why would lamb curry be the chef's favorite then? Put something better on the chef's list. The curry just wasn't very good.
author: Grant M.

description:
I miss this place. I frequented it when I lived in SF. Delivery is fast, prices are low, and the food is delicioussss. I dream about the peanut sauce.

I highly highly suggest Tofu Pra Ram and the chicken wings.

I can't wait to visit SF again to go to Vanida. Georgia's thai food is NOT happenin'
author: Brittany B.

description:
Vanida Thai Kitchen is a gem in the Outer Sunset. I stumbled upon this restaurant and it has quickly become my one-stop-shop for Thai. Not only is their food terrific, but the décor and ambiance are great whether you're on a date or having some bromantic time. Their staff is friendly and didn't mind us hanging around talking after dinner. What I really appreciate about this place is the cleanliness. I've been to some dingy Thai places and it really detracts from the experience for me.  

I'm a fan of their pad thai. It's been consistently tasty and my go-to dish. The pineapple fried rice was surprisingly good (who knew pineapples and rice could go so well together?). I've heard great things about their curry dishes too. Don't miss out on their desserts. The fried banana is worth saving room for.

My tummy gives Vanida Thai Kitchen...5 Stars!
author: Allan L.

description: Absolutely delicious everything we tried!!! Will be back again!  The crispy coconut with lime and spinach was my favorite.
author: Iuliia Y.

description:
Our family of 4 were nearby Taraval, decided to eat some thai food.

Searching for Thai food on yelp, we found this little place call Vanida, 
the picture on yelp is probably old, they have recently did some renovation.
The food is decent, however...

I am not a big eater, so does my two kids. Come On!!!  The curry dishes are so small, I mean less than half of a bowl, it's not a big bowl either, I end up getting two order of rice, the curry was like $9.95 and two order of rice was $3.  I had to eat wife's portion of rice, lol.

There are much much better Thai place out there.
author: Tiger L.

description:
I can't believe I just discovered this place. 
I live, like, 5 blocks away, or something and I've always just gone to Marnee Thai..
However, no more. 
I think this will be my go-to spot for Thai. 
I haven't tired much there, 
but I'll totally vouch for the garlic pork. MMmmMMmmMmm
author: Garland W.

description: The delivery was timely, but the food was terrible! Way overpriced for the tiny portions. The beef noodle soup was just pretty much just broth, and the seafood salad was way too small for $11.
author: Heather S.

description: The food was good. The reason I'm giving the place a low score-- and the reason I won't go back-- is that when I picked up my take out order and the waiter ran my card, he gave himself a tip.  Not acceptable, esp as little ole me doesn't qualify as a party of 6. When I commented on it, he sort of giggled his way through it.
author: Elvis P.

description:
Food was OK... Empty place.

We ordered angel wings, red curry, and pad see eew...

Angel wings tasted like they were deep fried then drowned in sweet chili sauce... Nothing special and didn't taste marinated.
Curry was soupy and bland for curry.
Pad see eew was OK. vegetables were cooked perfectly where it was still crunchy, noodles were soft and not bad. The beef was terribly chewy...
author: aaron t.

description:
This place has good lunch deals, but for dinner, it's not as worth it.

My favorite are the noodles with egg, but the portion is not large. The portions here are not large in general.

We also got the basil chicken which was fine. You have to pay for side orders of rice though; otherwise you have nothing to eat it with.

Yellow curry is okay.

Fried banana w/ ice cream is fine and I would get it again.

The inside is nice and clean. It's very small and I haven't seen it really busy before. Last time I went for dinner, they took a while to get our dishes out because they wanted to serve them all at the same time.

Usually, it is a toss-up for me with this place and King of Thai. For lunch, I would also pick here. For dinner, I would prefer going to Lakeshore Plaza's King of Thai for their $18 deal (if they still have it).
author: Derek M.

description:
I first started coming here just because of the proximity to my school. It's nice that the nearest MUNI stop is at the corner also. 

Overall, I've had good experiences. Actually, I've only had one bad experience here. I usually come during lunch time, & the service is great. My one bad experience was when I came for dinner. It was PACKED. There was a 30 minute wait for a table. My party (a party of about 8) waited more than two hours to get all of our food. It was absolutely ridiculous. This was the one and only time I've been there for dinner, and I won't ever do that again. But lunch is great! They're supper fast.

I suppose I'm boring, as whenever I go to any Thai restaurant I always get Pad Se Yew. It's my absolute favorite, and they make it really well here. Not greasy at all, and the Chinese broccoli is cooked just right. Though I must say that sometimes they run out of the flat rice noodles (bummer...) When they do, they always tell you and ask if you would like to substitute with another kind of noodle.

The Tom Kha (coconut milk soup) is also very good here. An the prices are amazing; you can't beat a thai food lunch for less than $7!!
author: Kimberly B.

description:
This place is OK at best.  It's nice if you're in the area and are craving Thai food BUT if you're picky with your Thai food it's probably a waste of time. Their tomyum goong is too sweet. Forget asking for your food to be spicy because that request just gets lost into outer-space. Their prawn salad is really good. Pumpkin curry is my favorite thing that I get there. Everything else is alright. Nothing too exciting. 
They do have very good service. (aside from the complete disregard for the spicy request) 
All in all, A-OK
author: Janu A.

description:
I have been here a few times and finally I am going to yelp it.  

Food is ok.  Clean, which is important. 

My problem with this place is that the staff slacks on the portions, contrary to other reviews, portions are not suitable for sharing even if you order from the dinner menu/a la carte...esp. if you order soup for dinner.  I was surprised to find a very small container of soup for 5 people.  For the garlic pork, chicken or even beef, I'm not expecting a to-go carton full of food, but let's not "fill" in the container with shredded cabbage.  C'mon now.  

Looks like if I'm hungry and don't want to drive/cook, I can check out the other restaurants next door.  And at least they are cheaper
author: John Michael R.

description:
I must have a bias because I feel like I always give out 4 or 5 stars...

Anyway, I first tried Vanida at a Sunset fair many years ago. It was one of my first ever Pad Thai experiences. 

I think their lunch specials are the best...you can order Pad thai and an entree, which is perfect because I always get Pad thai at Thai restaurants...

Inside is pretty fancy as well.
author: Alison N.

description:
The location is great.  Has street parking and on the L-Taraval line.  Get off on MUNI on the L-line at 40th and Taraval, and walk 1/2 a block to restaurant.  Also reasonable street parking.  Great location..

Food is great.  Went there for lunch, and the food was delicious.  The prices for lunch special was good too, and reasonable.  Nothing to complain about the service either.  

Would go back again.
author: A M.

description:
Perhaps I'm being a harsh judge because it was takeout and we didn't get to it for an hour or so... but I thought it was mediocre across the board, and the serving sizes were smaller than anywhere I've gotten takeout in the Bay Area.

The beef satay was flavorful but a little tough. The yellow curry was milder than I like it (ordered spicy), and the soup was a bit watery. That being said, nothing was BAD either. Just definitely middle-of-the-road across the board.
author: Sean B.

description:
Great Yelp find, esp for delivery! This place is so good if you're craving Thai food, best part is that they even deliver! The food was delivered quickly, efficiently, and was still steaming hot! The driver deserved a tip. 

#26 Tom Kha Gai - so good! I love soups with coconut base, but this wasn't too coconut-y. T'was nice and smooth with my favorite - mushrooms. SO good. Yum. Very generous serving.

#57 Chicken Eggplant - wasn't too spicy. LOVED how the eggplant was cooked.

Panang Salmon - exactly what it was. Juicy salmon filet, sauteed in thicker red curry sauce. 

So THANK YOU Vanida, if I ever feel so lazy and am craving Thai food count on me for calling you guys!
author: Christine F.

description:
Chicken satay yummy, and the cashew chicken was super flavorful!
garlic pork! yum!
author: Alicia S.

description:
Don't let the outside fool you; inside is a really nice, cozy, neighborhood restaurant.  Parking can be difficult at times..but where there's a will, there's a way!

Best pad thai I've had to date; I was not disappointed with sticking with my usual pad thai instead of getting another noodle dish...though I hear that pad see yew is also very tasty.  I also had a taste of my bf's order of Thai fried rice which was flavorful & not plain like other places I've tried.  I've also had in the past the peanut sauce chicken & bbq chicken.  Both had yummy accompanying sauces & were cooked perfectly.  They don't skimp on the portions either.  Ohhh, & you must get the fried banana with ice cream...yes, fried makes everything better!  On my last visit the fried bananas were sprinkled with what looked like toasted sesame seeds making it different then other places, but a pleasant surprise.

Great food, affordable prices, & friendly & prompt service puts a yummy in my tummy & a smile on my face!
author: Cat C.

description: The yellow curry was bland, only dry thin strips of chicken with potato and onion.  I only ate here because I had 30 mins to kill waiting for the L Muni to come.  The owner was very nice, but I wouldn't come back unless I were in the area.
author: Letitia L.

description: When i want to thai one on, i go here. I love the pineapple fried rice or the garlic chicken. Its all good, and three blocks from home. Staff kills it, and its cheap.
author: dave d.

description:
Seriously amazing food
The chef has a great pallet.
Can't wait to have time to drop by to discover another amazing dish oh and all food is cooked without MSG
author: M. B.

description:
Had some food to go from Vanida and while the food was good with medium sized portions (smaller is always  better when you put noodles in front of me), the really friendly service we received wile drinking our warm teas and waiting for our food, was lovely! This place is so close the the Muni it's fantastic, not to mention the decor is pretty nice in this place. I imagine it having a pleasant dinner atmosphere.

Plus, the pad see ew and pad thai were enjoyed heartily when we took it home.
author: Tanya D.

description:
I just went to a private party (graduation, SF State) at Vanida this afternoon. And I've gotta say, this place is wonderful. 

We will be back again and again. (Of course, the fact that Himself-the-Spouse works at SF State makes dining here after work quite feasible. )

We loved the staff, who worked tireless behind the scenes. 

We loved the food, which was fresh, savory and authentic.

We loved the company...which consisted of family and friends of the graduating SF State student...marvelously diverse in every sense of the word. Each one more erudite, witty and charming than the next.

You won't find our dining companions at Vanida in all likelihood. But you will fine good food, nice staff and a cozy little place to eat. 

Paradise enow.
author: Dorothy C.

description:
I was helping my Aunt with some errands (she doesn't drive). Afterward, she treated me to lunch at Vanida Thai Kitchen. 

I have not been to a Thai restaurant in quite a while. There are so many restaurants to choose from these days that none seem very special to me, not even the local restaurant in my own neighborhood. So I was not expecting much at this outer Sunset location.

We selected from their lunch combination menu. I had the garlic pork and vegetable green curry with white rice. My aunt ordered the Gai Yang (marinated broiled chicken) and Poh-Pia J (deep fried spring rolls). Our lunch included steamed rice and our choice of soups or salad. We both chose soup. I had vegetable Tom Yum, my aunt had chicken Tom Kha. I also had their Thai iced tea. 

The iced tea was nice, not syrupy or too sweet. The food was fresh and delicious. The Tom Yum was nicely balanced with the salt/sweet/sour. The only thing I felt it lacked was a bit of heat - it was quite mild.

My garlic pork had a nice char and was quite tasty. There was a green dipping sauce that tasted of vinegar, mint and cilantro - very herby. The vegetable green curry had a bit of heat to it, but still mild by my standards. Maybe I could have ordered it a little spicier, but they didn't offer and I didn't inquire.

I had a bite of one of my Aunt's spring rolls. It was made well, the spring roll skin had a nice crunch and was not greasy. But the filling could have been seasoned a little bit more, I thought it was a touch bland for my taste. But maybe that's what the dipping sauce is for. I finished my curry and took home the rest of my pork to enjoy later.

Their prices are very reasonable and they have generous portions. Our wait person was friendly and efficient, the dining room is clean and comfortable. Judging from the other reviews, it appears to be a popular place for take away in the neighborhood. The next time I head to the Sunset to help my Aunt out with errands and she says "let's get something to eat", I'd definitely suggest going back to Vanida.
author: IM M.

description:
Man, it's hard to write a review when you're eating leftovers from the restaurant you are reviewing... but I will charge forward with mouthful of curry. 

My gf and I came here because shes been craving Tom Yum soup. We found this place on Yelp and headed out there since we live in the area. The first order of Tom Yum soup was too spicy for her, so we ordered another serving without spices. The soup was ok, but i'm not a huge fan of Tom Yun. We ordered a side order of sticky and jasmine rice. The sticky rice is really good and I highly recommend it if you like to use it as a sink sponge on your dish. I ordered the Pa Nang chicken curry, which was awesome. The sauce was so awesome, I felt guilty for gulping this stuff. I wanted to bathe in it.

 We also ordered the vegetarian yellow curry, which was ok, but didn't blow my mind like Pa Nang.

The flavors here are great and the dishes are paired up with equally fresh ingredients. I like my sauce so much that when I got home with my leftovers, I joked that the waitress had stolen some of my Pa Nang sauce cause I swear there was more!

Overall, the prices are good, we walked out of there for under $38 for 2 peeps and full bellies.
author: Wil M.

description: Excellent Chicken Basil, Pad See Ew, and BBQ Pork. Service is always friendly.
author: Aaron I.

description: I've been here twice so far, once for dinner and once for lunch, and I've had good experiences both times. The place is clean and the servers are friendly. I got a pad see ew and a Thai iced tea and found the portion sizes to be good and fairly priced.
author: Johnathan C.

description: Maybe my palatte has been spoiled by my move to the inner richmond.  When I lived out by the ocean I thought this place was one of the better Thai places.  I had to re visit over the weekend while dog sitting in the area.  Sadly, I was not impressed.  Nothing stood out.  I ordered take out and some of the dishes seemed to have been sitting out for too long.  It was all very average.  I would not go back.
author: Chelsey G.

description: This place is the go to place for Thai Food. The lunch specials are really at a great price. They offer a 1 item lunch special, but for another dollar or two you can get another item depending on what it is. I like to order the garlic pork with the curry chicken. The garlic pork is not fatty at all and comes with a green sweet and sour sauce that makes it taste even better. The curry chicken is very tasty, the chicken is all white meat and tender and no fat with it. My girlfriend and I usually go here if there isnt any other places to go to eat because we know we get great value in the money we spend and the amount of food we get. This place can get busy, but it is rare because I usually go during lunch time. Check this place out it really is good food.
author: robin b.

description:
Some real good cookin' going on here.  The girlfriend and I just accidentally came upon this place so we decided to give it a shot.

The inside was nice and cozy, not too big.  The waitresses were dressed in traditional Thai clothing which gave the place a nice vibe to it.

We ordered:

Thai French Fries:  Nothing special, just deep fried yams with a nice coconut batter.

Garlic Pork:  Some finger licking goodness.  Had a NICE garlic aroma which wasn't too strong.  Perfectly cooked and tender.

Green Curry with Chicken:  Not too bad, wish it was more spicy though.  Your average Thai curry.

Definitely a spot to check out if you have not.
author: Chai S.

description:
The food and service are still up to par... Although, I haven't really had any problems with ordering take-out from here (I'll be real--we just did on Friday lol), I prefer to go sit and eat here.  Putting this yummy food in a chinese take-out box kinda seems like a disservice to it's deliciousness... ha  (not that there's anything wrong with chinese food!)

Must try:  calimari, yellow curry, chicken pra ram, goong pong karee
author: Olivia D.

description:
I just tried Vanida for the first time (their delivery service)

Delivery was quick! 25 mins on a Saturday night!
Ordered:
Tom Kha Pak soup- spicy, coconut milky, savory and better than I've had, delicious!
Pad Ma Keur- An eggplant/ tofu chili stir fry, light and tasty but could have been a touch more flavorful- still good.
Coconut Ice Cream :)

The soup was hot when it arrived and the ice cream still unmelted, everyone from the girl on the phone to the guy who delivered the order was friendly and professional!

Definitely to become a staple for late night term paper chow
author: Brittany T.

description: Worst Pad Thai I've had...NO flavor in the noodles at all. They charge almost $20 for delivery and this is what I got... I will not order from them again.
author: Simone A.

description: Love Thai food and have tried several in the neighborhood. This is the best so far! Great take out and delivery. The Pad Thai was excellent. Service was good and will go back again. Visited several times before leaving a review.... Small place, but very good so far.
author: Kimberly R.

description:
Vanida is a little hidden gem in the depths of the Outer Sunset. They serve a good amount of vegetarian dishes with crunchy, fresh produce. I especially love their tofu & veggie curry and the Miang Kum. 

What is Miang Kum?-- picture this.... 
a raw spinach leave delicately filled with roasted coconut, lime, red onion, ginger, cashew nuts, and lightly drizzled with secret sauce. Refreshing deliciousness!! 

A few other perks-they have free delivery, are timely, when the food comes it is packed neatly in recyclable containers. 
Did I mention that two of us can get dinner for around $30!
author: Kimber M.

description:
I have never actually been into the restaurant but I order from here any time I want some good thai food delivery. 

I recommend the garlic pork (yum!), and tom kha gai soup. You can't go wrong. This place is yummy!
author: Gabriela L.

description:
San Francisco...home of so many dives and so many obscure ethnic cuisines, and yet, kind of hard to find a Thai place.  In fact, up till now the only one I'd been to is the rather trendy and expensive Grand Pu Bah.  But I knew the Outer Sunset wouldn't let me down, and sure enough, Vanida makes a great haven for Thai lovers.  Apparently some Thai food magazine ranked them in the top 100 nationwide.  I don't know about that, but I do know the duck curry was delicious.  Pad Thai was serviceable, but then, I'm not a huge fan of it so you should try it for yourself.  They clearly specialize in curries though.  And bonus points for having a pumpkin curry special!  Unfortunately the wife was sick of my pumpkin obsession so I didn't get a chance to try it.

Decor is pretty standard Outer Sunset shoebox.  Indeed, I have a hard time differentiating it from, say, Old Mandarin Islamic.  Service could be a bit better; they brought the food out before the drinks and had to be reminded that we ordered rice.  But overall, this should definitely be on your Thai short list, especially since in SF it's a short list to begin with.
author: Wes M.

description: I ordered for take out; called ahead of time and ordered the chicken yellow curry, chicken drunken noodles, and mango and sticky rice. I'm so glad I did, it was so so sooo delicious! I can't wait to go here again!
author: Laura B.

description: Came here with a friend and each ordered a 2 item lunch special. I ordered the chicken in yellow curry and sautéed vegetables. The curry tasted way too sweet, with no other flavors cutting through. The vegetables were alright, if a bit reminiscent of typical Chinese food. However, the options were plentiful and thr portion sizes were very good for the price.
author: Lindy C.

description:
The ambiance, food, and staff were all very nice here.  The place is decorated with many warm colors and a Thai theme without going overboard.  I came here with a friend and they seated the two of us at a 4 person table, which is better for dinner than the "two person" tables.  I would recommend this place for a relaxed night or a date.

We had roti which came with a sweet cucumber salad and a yellow curry paste, the eggplant and pork, and the yellow curry with jasmine rice.  Everything was delicious.  I Especially like sweet things, so I really enjoyed the cucumber salad that came with the roti appetizer.  The eggplant was just right, not to mushy, not to raw, and the accompanying pork not too dry and full of flavor.  I would have liked a little more sweetness and coconut flavor in the curry, but this is personal preference and the curry was still good as prepared.  The appetizer and two dishes was more than enough to fill two females and we had extras to take home.

The staff was very friendly, although I felt they checked on us a little too often.  Perhaps this is because we were there at a time when the place wasn't too busy? We came on a Tuesday night.  Regardless, they made sure that we were enjoying our food and would come by very often to remove empty plates and refill our water.  It was a bit awkward though that we were often not finished with a plate before they came to remove it.  This probably wouldn't be a problem for people who don't finish their food to the last drop.

In summary, this is a great place for good food, friendly staff, and a pleasant ambiance.
author: Stella T.

description:
When you find a good thing, you stick with it.
This is our favorite Thai in The City.  
Our first try was picking up a 'to go' order.  Even though they were busy,
they graciously allowed us a table to wait at and poured us tea, even making sure to not let our cups get below half.  This type of service is rarely seen in restaurants of this price range in The City and very refreshing.
The food was fantastic.
Nowadays we usually do delivery.  They do a great job of getting your food to you immaculately, fresh and hot.
This in no way means we are avoiding dining in the restaurant.  It's a relaxing place to enjoy a great Thai meal.
but...
Great food and delivery too?
When you find a good thing, you stick with it.
author: Barry A.

description: Amazing larb drunken noodles and mee krob!  Best tom yum soup ive ever had.
author: Ani J.

description: I ordered the pad kee mao with tofu for lunch. There were 3-4 other tables and only 1 server so the wait was surprisingly longer than expected. The food tasted really bland. I like the tofu more than the flat noodles, which needed more soy sauce and flavoring. Even with chili powder, nothing could save the lack of flavor. The portion size is a little smaller than the more popular Thai restaurants but luckily I felt full afterward.
author: Dominic T.

description:
I came here for lunch on a Saturday. I was skeptical about this place since the place was empty. 

The place has cheap lunch combinations. They are about 7.50 with soup or salad, and rice. The Tom Yum soup was flavorful. My basil chicken entree was good, the portion was a lot for lunch. I took half of it home for leftovers. All my friends (group of 6) liked their food too.

I'm surprised this place wasn't more crowded.  Maybe it'll be one of those secret good places that are on the low
author: Kristina N.

description: First off great service.  Staff was attentive and always there to fill your water.  Tom Kah pak soup was very nice and the beef sayta was tender and delicious. Green curry was very nice just the right amount of heat and the vegetables  were tender.  Pad Thai was adequate nothing special and the red curry had an off taste. Certainly worth a try.
author: Craig V.

description:
portions are small! kind of pricey.

duck curry- tiny container, but goood flavor and lots of things in it.
garlic pork- rave reviews and it was really good, presentation was not that great...if I just looked at it....doesn't look too great.
thai fried rice- didn't even fill the to-go box! average taste
fried tofu- meh.

if the portions were bigger perhaps! but no thank you! maybe for a lunch combo or something
author: Christine M.

description:
Three stars but really closer to four.  I've only had a couple dishes, but I'll try it a couple more times and make a final decision.  Call me crazy, but I have to adhere to the integrity of my reviews.

All that being said . . . 

This place stands between two other restaurants on a street  I call restaurant row.  That reminds me, I have to write a review on North Beach Pizza since it's at the corner of that street.  And it calls itself the hidden Thai jewel in the outer Sunset, and I'd have to agree.

It's a tiny place.  Clean.  Friendly wait staff.  Good food.  Good prices.  They also serve their lunch menu on Saturday.  Kudos.

I love the kick in their food.  The menu says mild, so I'm thinking Lame.  Wrong.  Some places will water down their spices to make their food more mainstream, but why?  No pulling punches here.  Their Mild might be considered Hot in other places.  I can't wait to try their meaning of Medium.

There's this green sauce they serve with the roast or grilled pork that will blow your mind.  Curry has a nice balance of spice and coconut milk.  And the fried tofu with eggplant was fresh.

Maybe I should just give place four stars already, but . . . just gotta wait.

love spicy yelp
author: Dan B.

description:
Ohies, I'm so full right now so it's hard for me to type...

We had the...

Angel Wings topped with spicy sweet & sour sauce and crispy basil.  Very yummy with lots of meat and crispy skin.  The sauce had tons of minced garlic...SO GOOD.  I ended up slathering it all over my unsweetened sticky rice...hehe.  You shouldn't waste food.

Yellow Curry with roasted duck, tomato, pineapple, bell pepper, zucchini, and basil.  It was really good, not too spicy. It was obvious that both my bf and I were trying to get as many pineapple pieces as possible.  Love the sweetness of the fruit with the creaminess of the curry. I did like my sticky rice, but I must say it didn't really go with the curry.  Should have also gotten an order of regular rice.

Beef eggplant with garlic, basil, and bell pepper.  Can't go wrong with this dish.  I absolutely love eggplant and garlic together.  But out of the three dishes it was my least favorite.

I think they recently remodeled...so it looks more modern. The waitresses are very nice and pleasant and look super cute in their Thai attire.  A nice alternative to King of Thai if you are looking for Thai food on Taraval.
author: Rose J.

description:
The satay was good.
The vegetarian dishes made with fresh tofu are great.

The beef, however, is very, very poor quality.  Tough, grisly, chewy...  the tendons and fat weren't sliced off, so I end up with at least 3 completely inedible bites.  Ugh.

So, I would go back, but I would order vegetarian.
author: Eric H.

description:
I've lived in the sunset district practically my entire life and have lived REALLY close to Vanida for about half a year but I hadn't noticed it until I pulled out my phone and yelped restaurants around my house. I was pleasantly surprised to see that there was a thai place deep in the avenues with great reviews. I knew about the block it was on, but I guess I just get distracted with the other chinese restaurants next to it.

Regardless, this place was pretty damn good. We got there around 9:45 - close to their closing time - so we decided to order takeout after sitting at a table. They were accommodating enough and let us sit there with water while we waited. 

I ordered the pad thai pak and really enjoyed it. I'm  usually a carnivore but I LOVED this dish. Usually, when you order a veggie dish at a restaurant, it comes with one or two different types of veggies, but this dish had at least four or five. The vegetables were cooked perfectly, not too soggy nor too undercooked; it had the perfect crunch and it absorbed the right amount of flavor. I rarely find veggie dishes this satiating, but I could eat this dish all day.

The boy got pad see ew. We practically order this dish at any thai restaurant we go to - it's like a test for the restaurant. The dish came out flavorful but not super greasy like other places (ahem King of Thai). The chicken was cooked well, not overdone and still tender. There was a great ratio of veggies:meat:noodles. Personally, I might not order this dish but it's definitely a lot better than other places' pad see ew.

The atmosphere of the restaurant is great - something unexpected after seeing the atmospheres of the surrounding restaurants (North Beach Pizza, Wing's). Overall, this is a great restaurant and they deliver too! I'll have to try the lunch special, seems like a great deal.
author: Christina B.

description:
They really do receive 4 stars plus, but I am basing this review from what Thai food should be and it should not  be refined. This place is great for anyone, but not those who seek authenticity. But Vanida did not mention anything about authentic Thai cuisine, so good for them. Okay, lets start with what we had for dinner.
Seafood salad- It was good, I actually did like this dish.

Papaya salad- Okay, we made a request for the papaya salad, we wanted it to be the dirty style with all the black goodness and fishyness. Right when we mention that request the waitress jumped back and said we don't do that here, as if we ask her is they sold cocaine in the back. So we settled for their regular salad and asked for SPICY, but when the dish came out it was sweet at first and maybe a tiny kick at the end of the bite. When we want spicy and when we say SPICY, we expect to be dripping sweat and scratching our heads.

Tom Kha soup- Too much coconut milk, almost tasted like a dessert. 

Angel wings- okay someone specify what Angel wings are, because in every Thai restaurant it is different. Some places it is stuffed chicken wings and here it is just fried wings tossed in a mild honey basil sauce. But it was good!

Pad kee mao and Pad see ew- were rated okay!!

overall this place is nice, food is beautifully presented, taste varies on what you think Thai food should taste like. All I know is I went next door and got me a slice of pizza.
author: tony y.

description:
This place is totally legit!

This place gets a 5 star review from me for its delivery (which thus tells you this is based on a semi different standard than a sit down).

Free delivery was a great bonus. Got 3 dishes for $30 (including a $3 tip).

Ordered the bbq chicken, the red curry with pork, and the duck basil.

Let me just say all the food was really amazing. 35 minutes from order to delivery was not bad at all, and the food came relatively hot still. It doesn't look like a whole lot of food, I admit; but really I'd take their quality over quantity any day of the food.

The BBQ chicken here really is it. Smoky, tangy, sweet, delicious. I admit the small pieces (breast maybe) were dry, but the legs and thigh were amazing. A must have!

The red curry was really good, coconut flavor came through, nice and rich, but not too thick.

The duck. Man was it good. The basil hint is subtle, and just enough, and the duck itself is spicy and well seasoned. Veggies are solid too!

Pros: Fast delivery, great food, hot food, well priced!

Cons: Smaller portions than one normally expects, but hey this is quality we're going for!
author: David H.

description: I ordered angel wings and beef ga prow. I'm a big fan of thai food so I always get foods there. I like it there. I like yellow curry there too.
author: Kimberly K.

description: fast service for lunch, decent food, 8 bucks for 2 sides plus rice and soup
author: Long C.

description:
3 1/2?  It's not the best thai food, but I enjoy it better than King of Thai so we come here because it's close to home for us.

I always get the pad see ew with tofu.  It comes with chinese broccoli which most other ones don't.  The boyfriend thinks it's weird, I think it's fabulous!  He always gets the yellow chicken curry. I guess it must be good since he always gets it.

Overall, it's sufficient.  It fills the thai food craving, but it doesn't make me crave THEIR thai food.
author: Quynh-An P.

description: Craved Thai and decided to check out Vanida Thai since it was close to the house. We decided on the duck curry and the curry noodles. Curry noodles was lightly seasoned with curry..almost too dry. However the duck curry was good. Guy friend polished it off with the quickness. Thai coffee was excellent. Dine in was comfortable. No wait for a table. Will have to try a different noodle dish next time.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Vanida recently went through a facelift in terms of its physicality. It was just okay before, but I think after the changes, it is warm and inviting. There is only one block on Taraval west of Sunset that is entirely occupied by small businesses, and Vanida is one of them. (Walgreens is across the street). So although it is street parking only, it is not difficult to find a parking spot in this mainly residential area. 

I went last Friday evening around 7:30 with my two sisters and my 5 year old daughter.  There were other families in there, including a larger party who was celebrating "Grandma's" birthday.  We started with the papaya salad. Yum. For entrees we ordered the yellow curry with chicken, pad see ewe (spelling?) with beef, and the charbroiled chicken which came with a sweet and spicy honey dressing on the side. At the end of dinner we ordered sticky rice with mango, which was a perfect amount of subtle sweetness. The entire bill for all these items including steamed rice was $40! We even had left over to bring home.

The service was good. More than one waitress came by to bring our food and check in from time to time. Good Thai food AND it is a block from my home? I'll be coming back.
author: Lani S.

description: I've never sent a dish back at a restaurant. That being said, here, I did. First, the lamb was almost 95% fat. The other 5% was bone. It was inedible. I ordered a basil chicken as a replacement and the chicken was RAW! What a joke.
author: Kayla C.

description: Well... I've been a couch potato lately and crashing on various couches. Vanida Thai is particularly close to one couch that my ass has become very accustomed to. I had takeout from this spot the other night (because my ass wouldn't get off the couch). I had the papaya salad and pad thai pak. The papaya salad was your standard fare EXCEPT for the fact that I kept spitting out chunks of lime with the peel on and everything. I know lime juice is used but really, CHUNKS of lime?! in the salad?? I tried to just eat around the chunks of lime but I grew tired of picking at it and went for the pad thai pak instead. It had a good amount of veggies (i don't eat meat too often) but this was seriously lacking in flavor. I didn't each much of this and went back to the papaya salad. The next day I tried to finish off the pad thai but it was lacking so bad I wanted hot sauce.
author: Susy C.

description:
wow - I'm shocked at the rating for this restaurant.  I am not a thai expert, but I'm rarely disappointed with some basic dishes.  The Tom Ka Gai was missing the thai flavors!  The lemon grass or something - this tasted like super sweet coconut soup with no flavor!

The vegis were all really over cooked.

The yellow curry had no flavor either - totally bland.

I like my food fairly bland, but I don't order thai food for no flavor.

My husband did like the basil tofu, so I gave two stars.
author: r t.

description:
A pretty good non-chinese spot in the hinterlands of the Sunset.
The five of us all thought it was fine, nothing to complain about. Up to our usually high standards for asian food (aren't all us san franciscans food snobs?). I had pad thai - a little too sticky, but good. A little skimpy on the shrimp. The thai eggplant chicken was very good. Pad see gaw was good. You won't be surprised by greatness, but you'll leave happy.
author: Tom P.

description: Vanida is my favorite place for Thai delivery because it's consistently good and incredibly fast. I'm always caught off guard by how quickly they get to my house after ordering. I've eaten a wide variety of different dishes and I've always been satisfied with the taste and quality. I will admit that the portion sizes could be larger so you might want to add an appetizer if you have a big appetite.
author: Albert S.

description: The chicken wings are awesome.  All the dishes we had tasted good.  But they keep raising their prices.
author: Benny A.

description: Tom Yum soup full of chicken came with garlic pork & brown rice $8.50. Delicious lunch and great value. Friendly server.
author: lauren c.

description: Wow, you must have the mango salad!  Curry dishes are superb.  Always a treat to enjoy great food and in a warm and friendly atmostphere.
author: Lynn L.

description: Ate here on a late Sunday afternoon (around 2pm) and it was wonderful. The place was full when we arrived. We waited approximately 10 minutes and then had a lovely table at the window. This is essential San Francisco with the MUNI train running up and down Taraval in front of you. The place is very plain and ordinary, but the food was really good for the price. The lunch special for $7.95 included soup or salad, and two different choices from their extensive menu. I had the yellow chicken curry with potatoes and their deep fried vegetarian roll. Perfect amount of food and friendly service. I also had their Thai Ice Tea and it was perfect. I will return and I recommend this wonderful neighborhood gem.
author: Deb B.

description: Great place for dinner. Inside is very nice and their service is good. This is my go to Thai restaurant. They have great food and its so convenient since I live few blocks away.  I love their Pad Thai, Angel Wings, and the Yellow Curry!
author: Ana Alicia D.

description:
I don't know what happened to this place, either the cook changed or they just stopped caring about their food. We used to order delivery from them all the time but slowly their food quality plummeted! Just last night we ordered delivery and we felt like we totally wasted our money! I could've cooked it better and trust me, I'm no cook.
First of all, their Tom yum goong was the absolute WORST I've every tasted! No lemon grass or spice flavor but just tasted like tomato soup with some chili! Second, the beef salad was so dry and the meat was so tough it was hard to chew. And it also seemed like they decreased their portion sizes too. Third, the papaya salad was tolerable but definitely had not to the spice level we asked for... Lastly, the pad Thai was so dry, nard and flavorless that it seemed like someone had left it in the fridge for a while and heated it up in the microwave before bringing it to us.
The only reason they get 2 stars instead of 1is because they do have decent service. We're never coming back here again.
author: Lydia A.

description: Their garlic pork is definitely worth trying when you're dining here.
author: Chad B.

description: Greasy and lacking flavor. Wish this place was better but it seriously is not.
author: Brett P.

description: Small, intimate seating. I ordered the pad-see-ew . It was delicious. Excellent service. I love this spot and would go back for sure!
author: M H.

description: Horrible service waitress served me my salad half way through my meal garlic shrimp was undercooked i had ask for salad twice hole in the wall place with hole in the service
author: Eric V.

description:
There are so many thai places to visit in the city. I had never heard of Vanida and a friend suggested that we go. I was a little skeptical about his rants and raves because in my experience a lot of thai places in SF taste the same.
I immediately liked Vanida because it was small and modern inside and there were lots of sunset locals dining. The servers are very nice and professional and although you will pay more than king of thai noodle it is SO worth it. 
For apps we had the thai fries- which are sweet potatoes- and spicy chicken wings topped with fried basil. Both plates were licked clean!
The main course was yellow and green curries- both perfectly executed and served with fresh crunchy veggies. I had a thai beer to compliment.
We were stuffed and even had some leftovers for the next day.
I think that you can get comparable food at other thai places but with the location and ambiance- its a great spot to have good conversation and a relaxing meal and then walk to your car because there is also tons of free parking.
author: M K.

description:
Damn son, a Thai place that does delivery!

Forget Dominos pizza you lazy bum and wait for some REAL food to reach your doors.  Or you can go directly to their brick & mortar establishment if you're spending under $17...

Satay was good.
Papaya salad was spicy...and good.
Duck curry was really good

This place is run by some very nice individuals.  very friendly and helpful my first time here and i've been ordering delivery from them ever since whenever its too cold to step outside or whenever outer sunset's gas prices go past $3/gal.  oh well
author: Christopher N.

description: I was in the neighborhood for a job and got hungry. Booted up yelp and discovered this place. Safe to say I am not disappointed. Food was very well priced, and pretty good. The coconut milk soup was fantastic. The curry was light. and not overpowering. Pretty good for the price. I recommend this place if you are in the area and looking for a cheap lunch.
author: Gilbert L.

description: Over-spiced beyond belief.   I like spicy food and even I thought this was too spicy.   I cannot bring my friends to this restaurant because their concept of 'mild' is to eat fire.   They have a nice selection of vegetarian plates, but it is not worth the trip to eat there when the cook does not really know how to flavor the different dishes.  They all taste the same with cayenne and chili
author: Axa M.

description:
I ordered delivery. I got the Pad Thai, Garlic Pork, and the pork yellow curry.

the Pad thai was gross. It was all stuck to the bottom of the to go box and it had absolutely no flavor. I ate 2 bites and threw it away because it's disgusting. 

The yellow curry was alright. It's different than I had before because it had potatoes and you could tell they were cooked a long time because there was a lot of potato particles in the curry.

the Garlic pork was honestly the best. It's sweet savory and comes with a cilantro dipping sauce that is pretty good.
author: Jeffrey M.

description: Absolutely horrible.  Ordered Pineapple Fried Rice, Pad Woon Sen, Pad Karee, Garlic prawns and Beef Pra Ram.  I knew I should have avoided ordering from here when I saw another reviewer say that all of her dishes tasted bland.  She was right.  But I figured it couldn't be that bad.  I was wrong.  Nothing had any flavor to it.  I actually had to add salt!  The only thing that tasted right was the Diet Coke.  Very disappointing meal and pissed that I spent money here.
author: Gordon A.

description:
So how can i put this in words??? Hah,  AH-MAY-SINGGGGG

The place is so friendly, and private.  Seriously, why it's still so quite??
The food is fantastic. Plus, so much privacy for you to enjoy.

Even though the place is a bit tiny, but don't get fool by the size of this little tiny restaurant. The potion is surprisingly huge. Ohh, and it's yummy.

PS. One of the severs is pretty adorable to. Yeah, you know who you are.

I would say that they have the best peanut sauce in the bay. It's so good. They don't try to americanise the food so much too. They stay straight up thai.  I mean the food can be pretty spicy , but in a good way though.

This is one of those hole in the wall places in San Francisco for sure, because i think most of their customers must be in the neighborhood, or some hardcore fan that lucky to stumble in to the heaven of cheap awesome thai place
author: tim t.

description: Ordered take out last night from Vanida's.  LOOVE their food.  Especially love their Pra Ram and crispy tofu.  Their soup dishes are also to die for.  It definitely is a secret, but with continued good reviews it won't be.
author: Vespa V.

description:
I went here for the first time last week for lunch and it was really good. For 10 dollars with tip and tax I got the lunch special which came with soup, rice, and 2 half orders. ( you can pay a dollar extra if you want to get two different items versus just one) this was perfect for me since I couldn't decide what I wanted to eat! 

I really don't have anything bad to say about the place. It was clean, the food was good, and the staff was friendly. This is def going to be my new go to place when I am in the  sunset.
author: Sangeeta L.

description:
Someone took me here for a working lunch and I thought that the food was pretty good. A really reasonable price (less than $8) for a ton of food in the lunch special.

However, ordering in is not the way to go here. The Tom Ka Gai was totally flavorless! Uch!

However, they get one star for quick service and their papaya salad.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Vanida Thai Kitchen recently updated their restaurant and I liked it before, but now I would eat there instead of just take-out.  The people who work here are very friendly, and dress so cute.  

Get the Salad Vanida because even though it's an appetizer it is enough for one, and very healthy for Thai food.  Comes with fried tofu and peanut sauce.  The curry puffs are really good, but are fried so not so healthy.  We also like the spinach, tofu, and peanut sauce dish over rice.  Their Tom Yum isn't as good as King of Thai (but only because the broth is not as rich and spicy).  We also love their sweet potato fries and yellow curry.  

You should definitely go here for a quiet night out or get take-out or delivery for a quiet night in =).
author: Ashley S.

description:
Sorry guys, but this place was awful.  The ambiance is completely dull with droning music and awful service.  I had the worst Pad Thai I have ever had, literally. I love ALL Pad Thai and I would not even have a second taste of it, even after I had to send it back because I asked for the vegetarian version and mine came with prawns, yet was still charged the extra $1.00 for the prawns (!)
