I guess you could say their lunch special is a good deal, but if that means the curries were good, that isn't a great measure as curries are always good, they are almost impossible to get wrong!  The Thai Iced tea was WAY too sweet again, couldn't have more than a sip.

Sorry, but with a plethora of amazing cuisine in the city, this is the last place to end up.
author: Britt X.

description:
It seems that a lot of the reviews are for delivery, but my friends and I ate at Vanida.  I don't know their overall opinions, but I thought it was just okay.  

I had one of the specials on the board, Ginger Salmon, which essentially was over-cooked salmon messily mixed in with 3 kinds of mushrooms, bell peppers, onions and long strips of ginger, flooded with a rather bland sauce.  When I say mixed in, I mean it, the presentation was very messy, although the taste was okay, nothing special.

I also had a bite of my date's Pad See Yew, but it was pretty bland, the only saving grace in my opinion was the perfectly cooked, crunch chinese broccoli.  He did say he thought it was a bit sweet.

I also tried the "sauce" from the Garlic Prawns, and I haven't figured out how a sauce made of garlic, pepper and cilantro can be so bland.  And, speaking of bland, another friend got the Combo Noodle Soup, which looked like pho, but apparently didn't have much flavor, he said it was pretty bland, but okay.  The last friend got the Squid Salad, which he said was also okay, but he'd had better.

The Hot Thai Tea was nice, basically the same thing in the Thai Iced Tea, but without the condensed milk.

I should mention that service was nice, pretty relaxed but attentive.  Our water and tea would usually get topped off when half was gone.  The only glitch was that we were not eating family style, but all of our dishes came out seperately, about 10+ minutes between the first and last dish to arrive.

Was Vanida good?  To use the same thing throughout my review, it was okay.  Will I go to Vanida again? Probably not, even if I'm in the area.
author: Crystal B.

description:
This is my go-to Thai place in my neighborhood when I want better quality Thai food than King of Thai. The food is pretty good; my favorite is the duck curry and the noodles are good here too. One thing that I don't like about the food is that when you get curry, you always have to order the rice separately. At King of Thai, rice is included in the price of curry!

I've never eaten in and have always order to-go. I'm a little irked this time because I recently placed an order over the phone and was told it would be ready in 20 minutes (a little longer than the other times I've ordered to-go). Anyways, I showed up 20 minutes later and double parked because I thought I'd be in and out like I usually am. I ended up waiting an extra 15 minutes which made me really antsy and annoyed.
author: Jess H.

description:
I love this place. I always take the bus past this place, and I've always wanted to try it. So one day, I walked in and took a look at the menu. Lunch special?! OH BOY. You choose two items, and as I recall, it's pretty cheap. Less than $10 cheap. So yeah, it's pretty frking awesome.

Alrightey, so I had the garlic pork with vanida's green sauce and deep fried tofu. The garlic pork was delicious. It was cooked to perfection, and the sauce was tangy but not too sour. I love the sauce!! The fried tofu was good as well. It was in a thick peanut sauce that I was worried would be too heavy. Actually, it was perfect. It was on a bed of spinach, and surprisingly, I ate the spinach. Usually, I hate spinach. The sauce was so good that I ate the spinach!!! :D

I've had the pad thai, and I approve! It is veeery very good. Don't wait too long to eat it if you get takeout though. The noodles will start to stick together. The one time I came with the boyfriend, we decided to try to curry. It was the curry with duck I believe. It was awesome! Usually, I'm not a big fan of curry unless they're curry fish balls. I love curry fish balls. I really liked the duck though. It wasn't too spicy, but it had a nice kick. I even had leftovers for the next day & it was still great.

I had the beef once, but I didn't like it. It was overly chewy, which is a NO NO for me.

Anyways, everything else is pretty much AWESOME. I recommend.
author: Erica A.

description: 5 stars because I love love love this place! Lunch specials are the best. Two items for $7.50 and I always get the green curry with chicken and the garlic pork. Best local Thai food in my opinion.
author: Katie P.

description:
Very clean and new looking interior

Good service

Low prices

Decent size portions

About 14 small tables. 2 other couples there around 7pm Easter so not much business at that time.

Had Tom Kha Gai soup and lamb currie. Soup OK. Sauce tasty but not gourmet. Lamb was tough. Asked and they said use just a little MSG.

I would go back because it is close by and the food is decent for the price.
author: Ross W.

description:
overall, i found everything at vanida mediocre.

yellow curry tofu...good sauce, although a bit runny. potatoes a bit undercooked.

pra ram pak...tofu was very dry/overcooked. about half the veggies in the carton were cabbage, which seemed like they were just being cheap. i did like that they served the sauce on the side for takeout, which avoided the tofu getting overly soggy while in transit.

brown rice...was a little dry. what thai place doesn't get the rice right??

in terms of "greeness" this place gets 1 star. the takeout packaging was overly excessive...plastic bags around any container with sauce on it. while i understand this is to prevent leakage, it seems they would be better off getting better quality plastic containers and skipping the plastic bags, like other places do. so now in addition to being a bit undersatisfied with my meal, i'm also feeling the guilt of all the waste that went into packaging said meal.
author: Meredith K.

description:
We were in the mood for noodles, and came here since it had good reviews on Yelp. It was pretty empty when we arrived, and the service was quick and friendly. We ordered two chicken dishes that really weren't very flavorful. Both were covered in what tasted like chicken gravy, and tasted exactly alike. On the plus side though, the portions were quite generous. Once we finished our meal were then offered some complimentary sliced melon, which really was delicious. 

Overall, this isn't the best Thai place we have been to, and I doubt we will be returning in the future.
author: Sami R.

description: From the outside, this place doesn't look like much, but once inside you feel like you're in a nice restaurant. The food is good and can cost less than a meal at Carl's Junior or Subway. Our server was very polite.
author: Karen D.

description:
We drove all the way here after a bad chinese restaurant service we walked out from.

This place was the other extreme. This place is excellent! Food, service, decor, cleanliness, ambiance, noise level - excellent.
author: Aneru t.

description: Just ordered the yellow curry with chicken and I gotta say I wish there was a little more chicken and a little less potato. Especially because the potatoes were huge chunks that were difficult to eat. The flavor was on point though.
author: Kelly M.

description:
Vanida's like the first time you fall in love. You're 14 all over again, writing love notes in class, kissing in the halls, being jealous of anyone from the opposite sex talking with your (enter pet name). Then something happens because you're too young and naive and someone gets jealous and maybe throws a shoe. Before you know it your mending your broken heart of some mint chip ice cream, beers and your girlfriends. As they say time heals all wounds and before you know it you're back on your feet. 

A year or two goes by and you somehow end up seeing you them. Heart starts racing and a rush of old feelings comes back to you, like you once had. After a few drinks you end up tyring to rekindle that old flame you once had. Sad thing is, some things are never what they may seem. You grow older and change. The things you once thought were good are no longer good to you now. It's just not the same. 

It will never be the same. 

Vanida was my first love of Thai. But since the remodel everything has changed. It's just not what it use to be. Sad to say but I will not be going back anytime soon. Only thing still good is the Thai french fries.
author: Danielle K.

description:
I've been here twice so I'm pretty sure you can't say it's just inconsistency...
Their curry noodles are pretty good, if you ignore the fact that the lettuce in the dish seems completely random. Their pineapple fried rice is pretty good, if you ignore the dryness of the chicken and the soggy cashews. Their seafood pumpkin curry is pretty good, if you don't mind only getting one and a half scallops. Their Tom Yum Goong...it is not pretty good. King of Thai Noodle does most of this stuff better, also faster and cheaper. The portions are smaller so if you order family style be prepared to order one or two dishes more than the number of people eating. I was also annoyed by the n00b chef  who couldn't cut the chicken in consistent (as in able to fit in one's mouth) sizes.
author: Skye L.

description: I ordered the appetizer Mee Krob which is described on the menu as crispy sweet needles with grilled shrimp and bean sprouts.   When I got it home 5 minutes later and opened container it was a sticky mess of brown "something"s that couldn't be easily separated  AND there were only 2 shriveled "grilled shrimp".  When I called to complain I was told by the man that answered "that's the way it's supposed to be.  The noodles are the main part of the dish."  When I pointed out that all the other appetizers with the shrimp, which are the same price, which he confirmed, "yes there are many more in the other appetizers" he made no effort to try and make things right.  He just said, "that's it".  I would have expected that a restaurant that wants to maintain customers and build a good reputation would have at least offered a free side of sticky rice the next time I came in.   I'm not going back.  There's too many other good Thai restaurants in this area.  Vanida, learn how to treat your customers. You blew it! OH, and I think you should add to the description of this dish, 2 over cooked shrimp ONLY.
author: Paula C.

description:
I came here on a foggy summer Monday night. It was one of those "I don't know where to go" nights. I think we came when it was just remodeled, so it was pretty empty. Parking in the Sunset at night is rather easy, I found a spot right around the corner. Park on the avenues, there's guaranteed spots. I did not use the bathroom, so my review was based on the food. I would assume the bathroom's nice, since the restaurant looked more presentable than most Thai places.

We ordered two entrees. I think we ordered a yellow curry with chicken and some beef skewers with peanut sauce. The peanut sauce was awesome, and the yellow curry was better than most places (with a slightly larger portion). I REGRET not trying the Pad Thai, I do not know what I was thinking. I will be back one day, I promise.
author: Glen H.

description:
My parents like to frequent this place whenever my mom doesn't feel like cooking and wants her Thai. The place is small and cramped but there are hardly ever more than 3 tables full so that's ok. 

The food is pretty good, not exceptional, but I really do like their Tom Yum Noodle Soup. It's the best I've had in this city. The soup is a bit tart with a bit of savoriness from the chicken broth and some kick to it from the chili. 

I've had their pad kee mao and I must say it's hit or miss. On certain days it'll blow your mind as to how good it is. There's a lot of "breath of wok" or "wok hei" in it. Essentially the way I describe it is "the essence of the flavor in the smell of the food," (Sounded a bit like Confucius there). And basically the way you experience it is, when one eats, one breathes, either through his or her mouth or through their nose. So when eating, with food in your mouth, especially when the food is piping-fresh-from-the-wok hot, you inhale through your mouth slightly to cool the food down. Well the scent from the food, travels to the back of your mouth, and some of it goes up into your olfactory sensors. And you know how they say that 80% of the taste of food is in its scent. That's where you get the essence!

Ok Biology lesson aside, yeah the Pad Kee Mao is hit or miss. Sometimes I get that great flavor and taste and sometimes its just mush. 

The kitchen doesn't seem to have a good ventilation system because I always leave here smelling like my dinner.
author: Derrick L.

description:
3 stars just because it's Thai food, all of the regular dishes (which means super tasty, duh, it's Thai food) at the exact same degree of deliciousness that any good Thai restaurant has.  I wouldn't travel too far to go here, but Vanida is close to me so I will continue to eat here at least once weekly.

+1 extra star for having Praram and making it exactly how I want it to taste, and also having a few additional dishes that I haven't had before that are delicious.  Really every dish I've had here has been perfect.

+1 star for having incredible service.  Always really friendly, nice, and attentive.  On my first visit, I met the chef when he came out and asked if I enjoyed my meal (I wouldn't expect that though, I don't eat at 12 and 6 like most people so it was slow when I was there, I'd imagine it gets busy during normal dinner hours)
author: Greg J.

description:
I can't think of any other Thai place in the city that has the portion size, the price and the over all good food Vanida has. The people are chill, the atmosphere looks fancy without the fancy price tag. 

I would really recommend this place  to anybody who wants a break from other Thai restaurants , or anyone who wants a good meal in general.
author: Cristhian M.

description: Went last night. Got the Tofu Pra Ram. My lady bird got the Garlic Tofu. Both dishes were extremely delicious. The restaurant itself was quaint and homely, it's very ambient. We will be frequenting this place often.
author: Cove C.

description: Not sure why this restaurant could get 4 stars. Was there on sat for lunch a few weeks ago. The restaurant was packed but there's only 1 server. Waited a long time to order and of course our food as well. The server wasn't friendly at all and she didn't even get us water. The free tom yum soup is salty. Doesn't have any taste of spices you usually find in regular tom yum soup at all. I ordered a beef and it was cold, not even warm which is odd. My husband ordered yellow curry and 2/3 of the tiny little bowl was curry sauce only. The only thing hot was the rice. We had to order an extra bowl of rice. Both food and service are terrible.
author: Bethany Y.

description:
I've always loved this restaurant. I've been to a lot of thai restaurants in the city from khan toke to king of thai, and Vanida's always in a league of it's own compared to others.

The menu is extensive and offers a variety of dishes, many of which I have yet to try, but will eventually get to in the future. But of the dishes I have tried, I LOVED every one of them. I recommend getting the garlic prawns or the chicken and peanut sauce mmmmmmmmm. And all the dishes were reasonably priced.

Service is always excellent when i come here, waitresses are attentive, nice, and you can tell they care about their customers.  In fact I remember a few times when I was dining with a friend, I overhear one of the waitresses talk to another customer and the tone of the conversation is always friendly as if they knew each other for years.

Parking is kind of limited since it's in the middle of a residential area, however the MUNI L Train stops by there so it's still easy to get to.

Overall I've never had a bad experience here, the food and service is awesome, and won't hurt your wallet. I highly recommend this restaurant to any Thai food lovers out there. 






Oh yeah if you go make sure you get the fried banana and ice cream!
author: Ryan C.

description: The pork wasn't charred, but it was tasty. We Had four things and they were all good. I would come here again. It's also close to the zoo.
author: dave c.

description:
I was known, for a thai-ime (har har) as the tofu todd dude. What that means is essentially i came in here, ordered the dish several times and they remembered me. To be remembered is a good thing, but better is this bomb thai food.
 Lunch specials with choices and it includes soup and rice. The garlic pork is supreme.

 Dinner, all is good, all is delicious, the curry fantastic, the pra ram delightful. This is a good place to explore new options too.

 Come check it out!
author: Jason S.

description: Great food and service! Love all the vegetarian options. The yellow curry is the best we've had in or out of Thailand!
author: Veg V.

description: I came here when I really wanted to try this place out. The waitress seated me with a menu and shortly after brought me an iced water. I was craving some pumpkin curry but it wasn't on the menu. The waiter told me they have it and it comes with chicken in it. I was looking through the menu and he suggested that it should be enough. Okay, but later on I was craving some barbeque chicken so I ordered that as well. The curry came within 10 minutes of ordering and the same with the barbeque chicken. The pumpkin in the curry tasted like it was cooked just right but I prefer it to be cooked a little longer because it is kind of hard. The same goes for the bell peppers. I thought that the dish wasn't cooked thoroughly enough. After that my barbeque chicken came smelling oh so delicious. I thought they gave me some low quality pieces of chicken though -the pieces were small and mainly bones. I noticed they used some kind of sauce or oil that had this neon yellow color to it which made it taste very good. Both dishes were pretty average and same goes for the prices. Except for the pumpkin curry which was kind of expensive for such a small portion and not as good quality.
author: Carmen L.

description: We have been going to Vanida for over 20 years.  It is a wonderful little family-run restaurant in the Outer Sunset.  The food is consistently delicious.  Three of our favorites are the green curry (best ever), Yum Yai (a green bean dish with meat, shrimp and nuts) and fried calamari.  Service is friendly and efficient.  Prices are extremely reasonable.   We love their food so much that last week they catered our wedding reception.  They did a great job and everyone went home raving about the food and the staff.  Selfishly, I don't want to let the word get out about how great they are.  (It's a small space and I never want to have to worry about getting a table.)  But owners, Paul and Bangon, well deserve the recognition.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
I must say, I was pleasantly surprised. Always passing this place by and seeing how depressingly empty it was, I would always either go to either one of the other restaurants instead of this place. But today, my brother wanted to get some thai food and suggested this place. I think this is the last place that I haven't tried in this area of the 'hood. He wanted a chicken pad thai and ordered a shrimp pad kee mao. The only difference I could tell is mine was spicier and did not have the tofu and tamarind sauce that is used sometimes in the pad thai...Or whatever sauce they use...

Anyways, I ordered and waited. Not that long later, the food was ready and I was ready to go. Freaking touched the bottom of the bag and got scorched! It was freaking hot! Usually some places let it cool a little. This place is heat and pack! I love that! How can you not like it when a place is concerned about cold noodles? Freaking awesome! 

So when I got home, I started eating. I liked the flavors and the shrimp. It wasn't over cooked like other places usually do theirs. The noodles weren't all that clumpy. Only when it started cooling down did it start to clump together. The one thing, though, was the amount of oil that was used. Dear God, I could have stir fried another order with the oil that had settled on the bottom of the box. Maybe to keep the noodles from clumping...Still, too much oil. That's my only gripe.


So, seeing as how this is my first time here, I need more excursions for more research. But at this moment, the four star rating stands. I shall update this when I get a chance.
author: Anthony L.

description:
This is a review from a vegetarian!
Great food, tons of vegetarian options. Their lunch combo specials are super worth it and super-filling. Rice, veggies and soup..wow!
The staff is friendly and efficient.
The interiors were simple and nice, not overly done up or cluttered like other Thai places. We got parking across the street on a Sunday afternoon.
author: Soniya R.

description: I get delivery from Vanida and occasionally eat at the restaurant.  Food is good and the service is good.  Garlic Pork is a favorite as well as beef salad.
author: John G.

description: Garlic pork way yummy. Angel wings nicely tasty, very flavorful. Eggplant with chicken nearly perfect. Fish fillet with ginger a delight with bell peppers, onions and lovely sauce. Quick, friendly, reasonably priced. Love it, again.
author: Eos d.

description:
My quest to explore more Thai restaurants continues and that is why I ended up here.I have heard about this place from several people and of course here on yelp reading the reviews.I thought to give try Vanida out.

Located in the Outer Sunset on Taraval btw 40/41st avenue Vanida is not that large,but just enough room to have a decent crowd.You walk in and there are tables on the right and left.Interesting decor I must say.

So,moving on we decided to go with the lunch special which means you can make a choice of one selection of about $6 or 2 selections for about $7,of course w/tax.

We decided on:

Ga Prow-  w/chicken,chili,garlic,bell pepper and basil.This dish had an amazing taste.Quite good and flavorful(heck,I am no expect on Thai) to me.

Garlic Prawn- w/garlic,pepper and cilantro.Another filled with seasons and Pad See-ew- w/chicken,which we thought was decent.The Pad See-ew was not part of the lunch special.

I have a habit or ordering the same things,but I must say they have a really good menu to make plenty selections from.

Lunch special(I recommend)
Lunch combo(vegetarian selections)
Over rice selections
Stir-fried noodles
Soup Noodles,curries,seafood and desserts.

I must say that I will be back to try the Pa-nang curry,Prig Sod and much more.

Friendly service.
author: Dani D.

description:
I recently moved to the neighborhood and was happy to find a Thai place so close.  I have gotten take out a few times now, and it has been good (and consistent) each time.  

I know it is completely unneccesary, but I love it when they give you tea while you wait for your food.  This place does just that and it is super yummy.  The food comes out so quickly though, that I barely have time to let it cool enough to drink it...and thats a good thing (makes take-out just a little too easy...oops).  

I haven't eaten there yet, but the ambiance is very nice.  Pretty small place, but it is never too crowded.

So, why just 4 stars?...I compare every thai food place to Marnee, and never find one just as good.  This comes closer than most though :)
author: Corrie F.

description:
I'm torn between giving Vanida a great review or just a so-so one.  The reason being is that they are one of the few Thai restaurants that deliver.  I feel that I should rate them based on the food quality more than the fact that I live in the boonies of SF.  Well . . . read on for the review:

I ordered the pad see-ew and all the noodles were broken up.  How weird!  I've never had pad see-ew with completely broken noodles.  You should definitely this dessert they have.  It's the fried plantain with coconut ice cream.  OMG, it's so good.  Sadly, the dessert was better than the entree!  

Like I rated, I've experienced better . . . much better.
author: Manton R.

description: This is horrid Thai food.  I ordered the Pad See Ew, Pad Thai, and Soup and what I got was bland or uncooked noodles.  The delivery was fast but the food is not even decent.  I was starving and even then, I couldn't finish my dish.
author: Markus D.

description:
I've only come here once (May 08) but everything we ordered was OUTSTANDING.  Even as take-out, the texture and flavor integrity was not lost in the neatly packed boxes.  Spice levels perfect, veggie accents crisp and fresh.  Toasted coconut palpable.  This is one of the few restaurants in SF that I will fast for days in advance so that I can grub out on extra entrees.

I learned from my last visit the best way to roll in here is in 3-5 group and share more plates.  Like me you will probably want to order about 90% of what is on the menu, it's that good.
author: Molasses C.

description: Vanida Thai is amazing! My fiance and I are vegan and Vanida is super accommodating. I recommend the Crispy Basil Tofu and the yellow curry with potatoes and veggies. If you like curry spicy, you have to ask for it extra spicy; it usually comes pretty mild. They can pretty much make anything on the menu vegan for you, just ask : )
author: Jonathan H.

description:
A little undiscovered treasure....have only been there twice but everything has been good....tod mun, red curry, basil chicken, pork and eggplant, green curry, green beans with prawns....very reasonable prices and attentive staff, parking is always easy!

On my first visit, we were being slightly harassed by a seemingly crazy lady in the next table. she must be a regular because the staff very slyly offerred to seat us at a bigger table, far away from her comments!
author: Amina B.

description:
We had dinner here with he girlfriend and her family.  It's been a restaurant they have frequented often in the past and now I know why.

Their food is very reasonably priced, portions are good and most importantly tastes great.  Their coconut soup is unique and also very good.  We had the lamb and beef satays which were flavorful and grilled to perfection.  Yellow curry with chicken was good, but the potatoes seemed under cook. Beef salad wasn't all that. 

Come hungry, leave happy!

If this place had ladyboys hanging out inside and sex show clubs next door you would think you were in Thailand.

Sa Waa Dee Kup
author: Sun-Kai P.

description:
2 stars for the dry-as-dust, chuck-full-of-bones bbq chicken I ordered last night! Boo.

I will never order that again, and didn't even come with sauce...I'll just stick with their grilled pork with green sauce!
author: Jade B.

description:
I totally love the hot tea they serve, most excellent indeed, my good man.  It's a deep orange almost sandalwood flavored affair, something the waitress insists is called "Thai tea" ah, quite interesting.

Anyhow... I went here alone one day for lunch and it was pretty decent.  DEFINITELY one of these places where I ask for spicy food and am brought something significantly less than spicy, but the flavors were on at least, and this so-called "Thai tea" was tasty.

I went back with my roommate a couple nights ago and it was a much different experience.  He got Cashew chicken, which was tasty but greasy, I mean like orange rainbows all over the bottom of the plate, all pooling up, staring back at us like an ocean of shame and despair.  Shucks.  I got red curry with tofu and chicken and not only was it NOT spicy, it was totally bland.  Completely bogus, I was really pulling for this little place.

Insult to injury came when the bill read $6.00 for brown rice.  Double you tee eff?  SRSLY?  

So, you tell me... if you have THIS exchange with your waitress:

- would you like white rice?
- do you have brown rice?
- yes.
- okay, we'll have brown rice.

Are you going to be expecting a six DOLLAR charge for it?

Needless to say, it's tempting to leave an embarrassingly small tip when something like that happens.  She could have at least said SOMETHING.
author: Blake C.

description: Don't be fooled by the exterior. One of the best thai places in bay area. Clean inside and great service. The food was really good, flavorful without being overpowering.  i'll definitely come back the next time i'm in the neighborhood.  the family still is talking about how they're craving thai food from this place
author: Andres A.

description:
papaya salad is very good.
pass on the mango sticky rice, rice is hard.
author: Sydney L.

description:
so after searching for a place that had good reviews and delivered for 20 mins we decided to go with this place.  We were really disappointed.  We ordered pad thai and satay and garlic chicken.

the pad thai was really sticky it pretty much came in the shape of the box, only had 3 shrimp and had no flavor.

The satay was ok, it was a little tough and sauce was not that eventful

the garlic chicken was ok.  It reminded me of ground italian sausage.

I hope this is not what we have to look forward to in thai takeout
author: Jennifer S.

description: The only thing good here was the Singha beer and of course they can't take much credit for that, other than keeping it nicely chilled. The Tom Yum soup was inedible, and the chicken bits in it were particularly cardboard-like. I ordered a particular fish dish and didn't get what I ordered. I was too hungry to complain, so I just ate it, though they did offer to correct it, I just couldn't be bothered to wait longer. The fish itself was awful, had that old fishy taste that low quality or old fish often has. They did give me the beer for free to apologize for the order mix-up, but sadly, the food just wasn't good, so the only honest review is that which I'm giving here.
author: Eater S.

description: Since Silver Spoon closed down in West Portal, this is the only Thai place in Parkside I want to order from. They are extremely friendly and obliging and the food arrives literally in 10 minutes. Don't know how they can do that.
author: p v.

description:
Vanida how I love you.

Your Pad Thai is to die for.  And I think I would murder someone for your Thai French Fries.

But I do not like that you have raised your prices.  Especially when you were already overpriced to begin with.

Oh, and I really hated that time that I tried calling you for like an hour and half and your phone line was busy.  The entire time.  I now had my heart set on Vanida so I took the  Muni down to you to get something to go.  Before I ordered i asked you what was wrong with your phone because i had been calling forever and it was just busy.  You then looked down at the phone and realized it was actually on.  This whole time you had the phone laying face down while on the hook.  And you didn't even notice.  For shame.
author: Chelsea C.

description: I went here a few nights ago with a friend to meet up for dinner. It was excellent all around. The thai food here is OUTSTANDING. I ordered the vanida salad (which came with yummy peanut sauce) and the red curry with tofu. Delicious.
author: Regina W.

description:
You cannot beat this place for lunch. $6.95 for a two item lunch with yummy chicken coconut soup!

I highly recommend the Garlic Prawns, the Red curry Beef and the Garlic Pork. Everything I have tried has been delicious and affordable.
author: Hank T.

description:
I like this place. Last night the kind server gave us complimentary tea as we awaited our takeout.  
 
The vegetarian yellow curry was rich and delicious. Even when the veggies ran out, we couldn't bear to let the curry go to waste -- my brother-in-law poured it on his rice and ate it sans vegetables.  If he hadn't done that, someone else probably would've just drank it.  Yeah it's good curry. 
 
The crispy tofu with crispy basil was sticky and very sweet. I liked it, but after a while the sweetness was just too much. Definitely a dish for sharing.
author: angela n.

description:
There's nothing wrong with pizza until you eat it for what seems to be 24/7, like me. And then to "switch it up a bit," you opt for spaghetti or hamburgers? Eh. I beg to differ. I have found that my palate needs a wide variety of eclectic and interesting cuisine. After ordering Brothers' Pizza for the 52nd time since moving here, I practically begged the man who pays for my meals to order something different. Different, as in, not pizza. Or hamburgers. Or tacos with JUST meat and cheese. My tastebuds were craving something a bit more exotic. Mr. Meat and Potatoes, himself, blew me away with his suggestion of ordering Thai.

I love Thai food, so I was ecstatic. 

I had the Red Curry and that other guy I was talking about ordered the BBQ chicken (don't remember the Thai name for it) and everything was delicious. I normally order Thai as hot/Thai hot, (depending on my mood), but however they make it without any special requests was fine with me. It was more than satisfying. 

My one complaint: they didn't give us enough rice. It was good. And I wanted more of it.  And I'd appreciate it if it was complimentary. But you know, the prices are fair, so I guess I shouldn't be complaining.
author: Meghan L.

description:
If you're Asian or dating an Asian continue to read on. Anything else go ahead and eat here if you like. 

I went here based on the yelp ratings but I should have read multiple reviews further down. My family and I went here late on a Saturday night and the place was dead. I thought to myself "score". I have been to Thailand which doesn't make me a Thai food expert but I know what's good at least. BTW in Thailand, Thai food is just called food and Thai tea is just tea. They also had a picture of the king and queen on the back wall, the Thais love their royalty so I thought I was in the right place.  

We sat down immediately and questioned the waitress about the menu. She was the nicest person. We first asked about the papaya salad in which my wife had a craving for. Come to learn that it was the water down 'American' version and they did not have the ingredients to create the original Thai version, which if you're white and still reading this, order it this way, It will change your life, kind of like reading Fight Club or V for Vendetta. First rule of ordering papaya salad, order authentic. So no go on the original and she seemed to be offended that we would ask for something so horrific but in her nice way.  Then we asked for it spicy. No questions about spicyness but I think spicyness is really subjective because my level 4 spicy and your level 2 spicy is probably the same thing. She didn't ask what level like how some restaurants ask but she should know spicy. When she placed the order my over heard the waitress and the cook confirming the level of heat in the dish. We also had the angle wings and tom ka coconut soup. The wings come to find out are just wings. Every Thai place I have ever been to stuff their angle wings with some kind of chicken concoction and deep fry the crap of it. The Thais love their deep frying methods and I love them for this. But this was plain wings. When the papaya salad came out it was spicy at all. Again a water down interpretation of the salad revered by the people who created their own version of donkey show which includes a ping pong. 

The tom ka soup had to much coconut it which made it too creamy and was almost a dessert soup. Weird I know. And it used too many onions as a filler making seem like the soup was more hearty than it actually was. I hate large slivers of onion in anything. Someone else made the same comment but it was too late. I gave them a 3 out of 5 because the quality of the food was great and the wait staff was attentive and really nice. 

I'm glad to see that no where do they refer to their food as authentic because it is not and they need to take down the picture of the king and queen because if they came to eat here, he would slap her for not going on Yelp and reading my review. If you like to be catered to by really nice people but could care less about having mediocre food, this is the place to go. If you want to have good food by the worse people then go to king of Thai noodles. I hate King of Thai Noodles but their food is so delicious! Damn you insensitive artisans
author: Paul T.

description:
This is a reasonably priced Thai place - but what makes it great is the quality of the food.

The chicken satay appetizer was great - the peanut sauce was very tasty, and the chicken was juicy and well seasoned.  I had Pad Thai Pak for my entree, and it was the best Pad Thai I've had since moving to the city last year.  My partner had the red curry, which I shared, and it was also very good.

The portions are generous, especially for the price, and the wait staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

The only downside I saw is that since they don't have a soda fountain, there's no free refills on soda drinks.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Me and my buddy tried out Vanida a few weeks back.  We decided to try most of the nights special displayed on the board in the back wall.  They had an appetizer combo special and pumpkin curry with chicken special.

The soup we ordered really threw us for a loop.  I ordered the creamy corn soup, which I thought was going to be brothy.  In fact, the soup was sweet and heavy on tofu; very much resembling the chinese dessert, dofu fa. So, the soup was quite peculiar to start off our meal.

Then came the combo appetizer platter consisting of egg rolls, shrimp rolls, curry puffs and fish cakes.  It was nice that they had a different dipping sauce to accompany each item.  But none of the appetizers really stood out.

For our main course we got the pumpkin curry and Nuer Yang (BBQ ), charbroiled marinated beef; served with Vanida green sauce.  The pumpkin curry was a little too runny.  It was spicy and had a kick to it though.  The curry was actually better the next day.  I thickened it up a bit and added some heavy cream.... yum.  Now, that was good stuff.

The beef was really tough and chewy.  For some reason I haven't had much luck with grilled meat at Thai restaurants so far.

Based on the reviews for this place, we probably hit Vanida on an off night and probably ordered the wrong items.  Its a pretty nice spot in the Outer Sunset and the prices are good.  Perhaps another time Vanida.
author: Sam T.

description:
If you're not keeping an eye out, Vanida's a place that can be easily missed.  An unassuming, homey Thai restaurant in the outer reaches of the Sunset, Vanida offers the usual Thai fixins, with fast service from friendly staff.  Even though portions are smaller than usual, their lunch specials are still worth taking advantage of.  

Check out their website; just don't expect the ambience and decor to be quite as nicely designed as their site.  But the food measures up, and that's what really counts.
author: Marsha Z.

description: I ordered their food over the p hone through delivery! I enjoyed the Thai tea and the BBQ chicken. :-)
author: Ronnel C.

description: Loved the food here, but the proportions they give you vs. the price isn't really fair. I think if they gave you more servings it will be better. The outside of the restaurant looks very dirty and such, which was my first impression, but right when I went it I got wowed by it's creativity. There was lovely decorations everywhere which captured the scenario that your in Thailand, or something like that. I'd recommend this if only it was a bit cheaper.
author: Jeffy Y.

description:
We wish there was a 3.5 stars because that's what we would've given them.  However, if we give Marnee Thai a four, it can only be fair to give Vanida Thai a very full 3 stars.

We've only eaten here once, so this review may change as time progresses.  However, in the one time that we visited this place, we were very pleased.  We had their Pad See Ew and spicy pork.  The Pad See Ew  had a lot of chicken and vegetables and this was the one time that we actually preferred to eat more noodles and get less for our money.  But that shouldn't be a knock against them for providing good value.  As for the spicy pork, it was good, but not memorable-- it tasted similar to other spicy pork dishes in Thai restaurants.

What people say is true-- VT is in the boonies of the Sunset.  We live several blocks from here but if it weren't for a friend's recommendation, we would've never found the place. 

Parking is adequate, as it is in a residential area.  If you're ever stuck around 40th and Taraval, looking for a place to eat, we hope you consider Vanida Thai.
author: Kel S.

description:
great people & great food.

all the food we get is yum!!!

i nominate the following dishes:

yellow curry
garlic pork (the cilanro dipping sauce is killer)
tofu basil
pad that
duck noodle soup


mmmmm.............
author: Tiger Lily ..

description:
Red Curry -$7.75 with Brown Rice-$2.25.
Fresh,very tasty, and satisfying.
The waitresses there are Thai and wear traditional dress.
Very good and prompt service.
author: Mag N.

description:
3 1/2 Stars.

I've been here a couple of times now... It's really close to my house, so I kind of have no choice when I have nothing to eat... Haha.

Well, the ambiance of this place is very nice. It's nice and cozy in this place. Definitely a plus.

The service here is okay/ pretty good. When I come in to get take out, they always greet me really nice. But sometimes, they seem a bit off. Yesterday, I came in during lunchtime, and the waitress, though very nice, seemed quite nervous. Her smile was a bit off and a little fake... But the service otherwise is good. A while back, I came in for lunch and I wasn't feeling all that great. I was a little sick, and when I couldn't finish my food, the waitress asked if there was anything wrong with the food and if I was okay. i felt like that was a bold move and I considered it good customer service. Also, when I ask for their opinion on what to get, they are very honest on what they recommend and don't, which is another plus.

Anyways, the food here is pretty good. I consider this restaurant a little fancier than most Thai restaurants.

Yesterday, I got the lunch special. The special includes one ($6.50) or two ($7.50) picks of entrees, a big scoop of rice, and your choice of soup or salad. I ordered two things: Pad Thai (+$1) & Red Curry with Beef. I also get the Tom Yum here, so I decided to get the Tom Kha Gai (coconut milk soup) I also had a Thai Iced Tea. The first thing that came was the Thai Iced Tea. This place has, arguably, the best Thai Iced Tea. The soup came next, and I was surprised. I usually dislike things that have coconut in it, but the soup was amazingly good. The chicken in the soup melted in my mouth. The whole entree came next. The Pad Thai didn't have much flavor. I didn't enjoy it that much. But the Red Curry was delicious. It had beef, zucchini, string beans, bamboos, and basil. It was a little spicy, which I like a lot. I expected the beef to be overcooked, but it was soft and tender, which made the meal pretty good.

I've had many other things here. Fish cakes, Garlic Pork, and BBQ Chicken are all really good. I've also had the Tom Yum Noodle Soup, which is very good also. The calamari and Pad See Ew are things I'd skip. They're both OKAY, but nothing special. And the one complaint I have about all these dishes? The portions are kinda small and the price is a little more than other Thai places. When I ate the Tom Yum Noodle Soup, I drank it down til there was not a drop left of it, and I felt like I ate almost nothing... I mean, c'mon...

Overall, I really like this place. I will come back here time after time to try more things, but I really think they need to have bigger portions. I think it's only fully worth it during lunchtime. And when they do give big portions, I'll give them a full 4 stars.
author: Derek T.

description: I love Thai food and just moved to the area, so when I saw there was a Thai restaurant a few blocks from my house, I felt obligated to check it out. When I went to Vanida, I was the only person in the restaurant, primarily because it was in the middle of the week and they had just opened for dinner five minutes earlier. Every other time I've passed by, they've always had a full house. In any case, service was great: quick, friendly, helpful. Decor was relaxing and very clean feeling. The food was fresh and delicious. Much lighter and cripser than a lot of other Thai food I've had (and Thai tends to be pretty light to begin with). I ordered the tom kha gai soup and there was so much of it that I had to take my yellow curry chicken and jasmine rice home. Everything was very inexpensive and well worth it. They do delivery with a $17 minimum. Can't wait to go back.
author: Jen H.

description:
Vanida means 'beautiful lady." 
There were about a half dozen things on the menu that fought for first meal status. I'm not sure why I never stopped in here before, but now that I have, I will be a regular. Only a couple blocks from my house, and open until 9:30, this little well-made-over Thai restaurant looks like it has been around a while from the signs outside, but the interior looks recently remodeled. I like that they carried the wood flooring up onto walls, benches and window sills. 
We started with hot tea and appetizers of lamb satay, and the Thai French Fries. Yam fried in cocoa butter - not on my diet, but very tasty! 
I ordered the duck curry with brown rice, and was thrilled at the medium spicy taste. The duck was tender for the most part, and the veggies seemed fresh. The by-the-glass merlot was reasonable. 
My bf ordered the Nuer Beef, that came with a green sauce that went amazingly well with the pineapple chunks from my curry. The beef was tender overall, and well cooked. 
They offer an unsweetened Thai Iced Tea, which is on my list to try next time.
Presentation was lovely on square and trapezoidal service. 
The acoustics are, well, let's just say you should keep your voice down if you want to have a private conversation. The smooth ceiling bounces every sound across the room. 
A table of biologists chatted about turtles and manatee across from us, and a couple of regulars ate quietly. I'm not sure what the couple next to us did, but they refused a free entree from the staff laughingly saying, "You gave us a free one last time. We WANT to pay!" 
The impression overall was that the hipster grandkids of the original owners have redone the place and contemporized it. Still feels family, but everyone behind the counter was under 30, and the music was a local radio station playing what is probably called 'adult contemporary.'
The dinner prices are very reasonable. We got out of there under $50 for two appetizers, wine, tea, and two entrees. 
Lunch specials look really good and fairly priced. 
Closed Sunday!
author: Char Z.

description:
I have lived in the neighborhood for a few years now and have been here about 4 times and ordered delivery twice. 

I had lunch there today and enjoyed it very much. I wanted to have Tom Yum soup and a good Thai salad, but they don't seem to serve salad for lunch or dinner. Except for one papaya salad appetizer for dinner. Oh well, I would rather they not serve it at all if they can't make it fresh and well. 

I had Gai Yang which is Charbroiled marinated chicken with a Sweet and sour sauce on the side. This came with house salad or Tom Yum. So I ordered the vegi Tom Yum and loved it. The chicken dish was a first for me, the skin was left on, so I removed it. I did taste it and it was delicious, spiced and crispy. I would have eaten it if I were not trying to eat healthy. 

The new deco was way nicer than before, the place was more than 1/2 full at 2:00 an a Wednesday. The server was nice and prompt, the food came out timely and hot. 

My only recommendations for improvement are...1. Take out has something to be desired. I don't know what exactly, but by the time it is delivered it seems the timing, temperature and textures are off. 2. Play something other than modern pop music, the ambiance would have encouraged me to stay longer and perhaps order more and 3. when seating a party of one say "lunch or dinner for one?" instead of "all by yourself? " Some people are sensitive about eating alone. 

A lady had her lap top and was drinking a glass of wine. This led me to believe that they are OK with you hanging around for awhile and catching up on work which was cool. 

I will be back, with my lap top.

I have a new favorite dish. The yum green bean. Its a salad of green beans with cashews, lime jice, chiles, toasted coconut. Super yummy!
author: Amanda L.

description:
Good food, especially if you live in the Outer Sunset where choices are somewhat limited.

Is it worth a trek crosstown? I dunno...
author: Stanley L.

description:
Came here one night for dinner with my cousin craving some thai food, and boy did we go to the right place. We were seated immediately. We came on a weekday so the place wasnt packed. The service was very nice and patient.

The food was great. We had the chicken Pad Thai, Chicken with peanut sauce, and 2 sides of white rice. All very good.

A great alternative to King of Thai if you're in the neighborhood, otherwise it can be a bit far. Parking was not too bad, but I hear it can be difficult.
author: David D.

description: I love this place only been there twice but each time the food has been great.  the fried tofu and eggplant is a favorite and last night I had their special which was mango curry...it was soooo delicious!  The prices are super reasonable...the décor nothing special but it is clean and really I am there for the food.  My roommate has ordered take out a few time from there and she said they delivery time is super fast.
author: Shawn M.

description: I've been there twice, once dine in, and once take out - food was only ok, but BAD service! I don't care how busy or under staffed they are, you don't just collect the $$$ and walk away. No greeting, no smile, and the worst part? The food was ready, sitting on a table, I had to ask to find that out, and all she did was pointed at the box! Really?? That's how you guys treat your customers in this economy? Well good luck. For sure I won't go back. I'd rather go a little further to Marnee Thai on Irving, who has better food and way better service.
author: Kai Z.

description:
i came here for lunch with my boyfriend, because it was near my work. we both ordered lunch specials - they came with a soup. mine was a vegetarian one and his was the chicken. his soup had nice big chunks of chicken, mine had some tiny but obvious pieces of chicken. 

the rest of our food was ok but a little greasy. 

vegetarians beware!!!
author: huong n.

description: Gotta love delivery in 30 minutes that arrives in about 12 minutes (well, we do live 3 blocks away).  Must have been slow on a Sunday night.  Eggplant with pork, duck curry and musamun (sp?) chicken were all good.  My daughter chowed down on beef noodle soup (since she is a full on noodle junkie).   No leftovers so that should say enough.
author: Glenn L.

description:
Honestly the food wasnt that bad . . . but still below average.  Servings were on the small side, we order a side of brown rice for 2.25 and it was only enough for one person . . . . prices defiantly dont match the serving size.  Also delivery was late.

Last time we go through them, sorry Vanida.
author: vanessa f.

description:
This place is helllllla good yo.

I had the yellow curry chicken and some of the (not really) spicy prawns with rice for a lunch combo, with the chicken coconut soup. Plus, a delish Thai iced tea and some fried banana with coconut ice cream for dessert. IT WAS SO FREAKING GOOD and I was really full at the end. The yellow curry was exactly what I was craving for - Something spicy yet mostly on the sweeter side. The Thai iced tea was one of the best that I've had! Extremely affordable, and VTK's been remodeled recently so it looks lovely! You definitely want to come here. 5 stars! YAYYYYY
author: M J.

description:
Vanida thai is awesome! 

Fresh dishes, well balanced curries with yummy rices. Seafood eggplant is delicious and so is the pumpkin curry. They have a very unique cashew chicken and if you can get past the abundance of oil, it is a treat. (I just strain the dish:)

Their green sauce adds great flavor to anything and is a must add!

You truly cannot go wrong with this restaurant. Oh, and they deliver...usually in a flash!
author: Kim P.

description: Excellent value with excellent food.  Just the way I like it.  Cheap and good.  Went for lunch.  My son got the Chicken Satay, Wife - Chicken Pad Thai and Red curry, Sister - Yellow Curry and I got the Panang.  The Pad Thai was great, the red curry and panang were pretty similar, did need a little salt.  Yellow curry was good and my son devoured the Satay.  Would definitely go there again!
author: Andrew O.

description:
Vanida is a good place to go. It is small, modern, authentic, and yummy. Pad Thai is about 6/7 dollars. The curries are tasteful, the dinner plates are pretty good. Vanida is a nice Thai restaurant to check out! 
And they accept Credit cards!
author: Ashley M.

description:
O, what an ingrate am I, not having given Vanida Thai Kitchen a proper review after the excellent dinner I had here several months ago. 

My uncle and his family were in town, and the onus was on me to find a suitable venue for our dinner. Luckily, I remembered that my friend from work has a restaurant - well, his parents have a restaurant - and I thought it would impress my uncle, who is always upstaging me with stories of his latest exploits with Jack Johnson (yes, THE Jack Johnson.)  Now,  of course, on a par with knowing a famous singer/guitarist, having a friend whose parents own a good Thai restaurant is, well, not much to brag about. Still, thanks to Vanida Thai Kitchen, I feel somewhat redeemed.  We had an excellent dinner in a relaxed, yet stylish setting; and, the staff/owners were extremely accomodating and hospitable. 

Of course, I am willing to admit that some of the royal treatment was owing to my friendship with the owners' son, but collegial kindness notwithstanding, the food was excellent, the service was friendly, and the location exactly what was needed for this occasion. There were five of us adults and one baby, and so the restaurant boasted the perfect combination of style and relaxation that is needed when dining out with a little tyke. They even brought us a baby spoon to share the dessert! 

As it was some time ago, I don't recall exactly what we ordered, but I know we did have some chicken satay, curries, Thai beer, dessert, and pad Thai. As I've stated in other reviews, I am in no way an expert on Thai cuisine, but when the experience is pleasant and the food is good, that is enough for me to be happy. Oh, and the price was extremely reasonable for the size of our party.

It may be out of the way to trek all the way out to the end of the city to come here, but there is always parking, and of course the Muni. Or with the money you save by not eating at an overpriced "Thai" restaurant on, say, Fillmore street, you might even have money to take a taxi home.  My uncle and aunt, who were initially a bit confused by the location ( as visitors to the city, they were surprised that it was in such an out-of-the-way place) but they did end up enjoying the meal. It may not be on par with having a rock star be your friend, but hey, at least you know that you can have a good meal in a nice restaurant that is owned by people you know!
author: eliz s.

description:
Food: Not bad. I tried the Bbq chicken and my friend had the pad thai. She liked hers, mine was just okay.

Price: I used a coupon from the Entertainment book so dinner was very cheap.

Service: Fine

Location: All the way down on Taraval, parking available at meters.

Atmosphere: A nice small sized restaurant.
author: Miss H K.

description:
Mmmm!  Just thinking about this place gets me salivating! :)
I've never tried Thai food until I came here (thanks to some friends), and since then I've been hooked!  I live in Santa Cruz, but none of their Thai restaurants (or anywhere else, actually) can compare to Vanida.  You can bet I make the trip up just to eat here.
Located in quaint Sunset district, a bit hidden, everything they offer is just absolutely delicious! 
Totally friendly and attentive staff too!  A definite must-try!
author: Crys L.

description:
I've walk by Vanida Thai Kitchen every day on my way home from work and I've been eager to try it for a while now.  My recent new found love for Thai food finally got me to try Vanida last night.  I ordered a few dishes because the prices were decent and I wanted to try different tastes to get a more tested feel for the restaurant.  

I started with the Spring Rolls.  These were great because they were free!  Any order over $20, you get a free order of Spring Rolls.  They were nice and crispy but I didn't care very much for the accompanying sauce.  Being a spicy fiend, I ended up using the chili sauce for my spring rolls, which did the trick.  I was pretty satisfied with the mix of flavorful vegetables along with the oily and crispy outer shell.

My next appetizer was the Angel Wings, in which I was thoroughly dissatisfied with.  I suppose I was spoiled by being recently introduced to the angel wings at Marnee Thai, which puts all other chicken wings to shame.  The angel wings at Vanida were comparatively pretty puny and not very crispy.  I only ate 3 of the 10 or so.

One of my staples when I have Thai is Pad See Eww (I'm not quite sure how to spell it, it seems like it's spelled differently at every restaurant!)  Like the Angel Wings I wasn't impressed with this dish.  Compared to Osha Thai and Marnee, Vanida's Pad See Eww tasted rather bland and unremarkable.  I'm not saying it tasted bad per say, it just didn't overwhelm me with a plethora of amazing spices and flavors like the other two restaurants I mentioned.

My last dish was green curry with shrimp which did justice for the disappointing angel wings and Pad See Eww.  The curry was a little thin, not much body to it, but it had a wonderful flavor.  It gave off a nice kick (I ordered it spicy) and definitely made me want to keep eating, although I was full.  

So I had two good dishes and two not so good dishes at Vanida Thai Kitchen.  The prices were very cheap compared to other Thai restaurants I've tried, and the free spring rolls were definitely a great treat.  I'm giving it three stars, however they're really close to four.  I will assuredly eat there again; perhaps another decent experience will give it the extra bump for an additional star.
author: Timothy C.

description:
Now, I LOVE thai food.. I've gone to plenty of thai restaurants around the bay area, and Vanida has to be one of the best. Not only do you get HUGE plates of food, but the prices are amazing, ESPECIALLY with the lunch special. The spinach, tofu and peanut sauce deal is to die for. Seriously, I've never gone there and had a bad experience or still felt hungry or unsatisfied. best best thai food ever. love it.  

It's a nice quiet place, you can have a good meal and not be harassed with the waitresses asking you if you need more water/tea anything. Everyone is so polite, the food is always hot and delicious, and really, no complaints. You always feel welcomed coming in and leave happy!
author: Diana R.

description: Wow. Over by the new TLC home. This place is a gem.
author: Seth W.

description: I was surprised by the shop's presentation and decor. The restaurant looked very nice from the outside, much like a 4 star place. The interior feels very Thai-like with the colors they picked out with the red and cream colored walls. They also have plants scattered throughout the shop which is a nice little touch. I like how they made the counter near the kitchen into a tiki style bar. I went in for lunch and they had a bunch of lunch specials for under $8, steal! I opted for the yellow curry with chicken and garlic pork. The lunch specials also came with a choice of soup or salad and I got the hot and sour soup. It was not that great, it pretty much tasted like flavored water. The food came out reasonably quick and it was delish. The curry was perfect, it had great flavor and not too spicy. The curry also had good texture where it was not too watery or too thick.The garlic pork was good too, not too salty or sweet. The portion size was pretty filling for the price. Overall, the quality of food here is definitely worth the price. I only docked off a star for the soup otherwise this place is highly recommended. Oh, I almost forgot this is a nice place to take your date, it has the perfect setting anyone could ask for.
author: Gary T.

description:
Tasty tasty. First, they have these awesome lunch specials - on the weekend! You choose two - yes two dishes -  and it comes with soup. Yes, of course they're sized accordingly, but we did end up taking some home.

So my wife and I ordered four different plates and the two soups so that we could try as much as possible. Everything was great, but I have to give a special mention to the Coconut Milk soup - so good!

We tried a yellow curry with chicken and a red curry with beef. Both hit the spot and then some.

Then we had the garlic prawns (for garlic lovers!), they don't skimp on the garlic. Also very tasty. And finally the garlic pork in the Vanida sauce that I've seen others raving about. Very nice.

Parking was easy on a Sunday out there in the avenues. We had lunch and went to Ocean Beach for a walk. Very nice combo.
author: ISAAC C.

description:
This place is pretty good - small, very nice atmosphere.
Great neighborhood restaurant.

The food is good, prices are right and the service is attentive and very friendly. 

I liked the red curry and pad thai. The chicken is high quality and they give a generous amount. Definitely recommend it.
author: Chili B.

description:
I live not far from Vanida Thai, but don't eat there that often, as I generally go to Chaaba on Irving (near 22nd Ave).

Just over a week ago, we decided to get take-out from Vanida because of their proximity. We kept it simple and ordered three pad thais, three cocanut/shrimp soups, and plain white rice for two.

When the food arrived, we were charged about $49 for the order. The price seemed rather high...especially as the food was mostly cheap noodles and rice, but I didn't raise the point to the driver. Instead I referenced one of the many Vanida Thai menus we have as well as their current online menu. What I found was the the total should have been about $40. I called the restaurant to inquire about the discrepancy, and they said their prices has recently gone up and they hadn't had time to update their online menu. That was over a week ago, and they still have not updated the prices on their menu. How long does it take to update online menu prices....30 minutes at the most.

Strike 1: false advertising


Now on to the food. The pad thai was so-so. About the quality of a $4 pad thai plate at a mall food court. The soup was a letdown. First of all, I have no problem with paying $3.75 for a soup, but to pay that and get it in a single 8 oz container is ridiculous. Furthermore, the shrimp in the soup was very dry. In a city like SF...being served what tasted like shrimp which had been frozen for months is not excusable.

Strike 2: tiny portions
Strike 3: ingredients not fresh


For the life of me, I don't get what people see in Vanida Thai. Unadvertised high prices (probably to pay for their renovation) for small portions of food that is not fresh.

Your far better off at Chaaba...although the parking is much worse there.
author: Michael W.

description: Having spent a good part of my life in the Outer Sunset, I was surprised to come across this little place the other afternoon.  Clean, modern interior and lunch specials that included rice, Tom Kha or Tom Yum soup, and an entree for $6.50.  The Tom Kha soup didn't have as much of a kick as I prefer, but the yellow curry was good as was the pad thai.  Nice to be able to eat at a decent, modern, clean little Thai place so far out.
author: Toni C.

description:
The people who work here are very kind and always have a smile. The food is always fresh, and very good.  I have never had anything there that I didn't like, and I go a lot!
It's decently priced too.
The only thing I have to complain about was one time I found a rubber band in my dish.  The of course apologized profusely, and remade the dish, no questions asked.  I believe the rubber band was from around vegetables. 

This has not stopped me from going back at all.  One not too bad experience can not compare to dozens of great experiences.
They have a $10 credit card min.
author: Lisa F.

description: I would give it five stars for 'as good as it gets', but I havent had a lot of Thai food so I don't have much to compare it to.  I live close by to here and I have had it ordered and it was pretty good.  The other day my friend Zach and I walked here for lunch.  We had great service and great food!  I love the thai french fries with that really tangy sauce.  I had the cashew chicken and Zach had some spring roll type things and the chicken skewers with peanut sauce.  Everything was great.  I also came here with my boyfriend and his family and we had a GREAT dinner.  Im actually planning on taking Ace for lunch on v-day/chinese new year!
author: Jen S.

description: Vanida Thai is always me and my sister's go-to for Thai; then again, she lives in the Sunset so there's also a huge convenience factor. She always gets the beef noodle soup for the savory broth that reminds her of home (we're actually Taiwanese, but that's irrelevant). I've always been impartial towards meat and poultry so I always get a tofu dish. Their tofu is usually extra firm and triangular, definitely fried. They're really lenient with substituting tofu for meat in any of their dishes, which I love. Their curries are pretty good, although I don't order them as often as I do stir-fried dishes with eggplant. Prices are relatively cheap, and seating is ample. Interior is very clean and modern, same with the restrooms. I always accompany my food with their delicious thai iced tea although I've noticed as of late that they started filling up the cups with a LOT more ice. Definitely recommend if you're feeling "asian tonight" and you're in the area!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
This is a quaint little Jewel of a restaurant hidden out in the avenues. 40Th and Taraval isn't the likely spot to find some of the best Thai food in the city but there it is, Vanida Thai. It's a great spot for a quick bite, or bring the family and stay a while. It's also perfect for a quite date. After my trip to Thailand it's hard to match the quality of food I got over there but Vanida does it, the set up is quaint the staff are friendly and the service is quick. 

If you like Thai food and spicy food try there Green Curry it's the Best in the city!!
author: Ariona E.

description:
I know there are not many reasons to like the sunset but ... you now have at least one reason to head out there. Forget about the fog/mist/lack of sunshine/wind.
Vanida Thai is the real deal! 
I have eaten thier food twice now and it consistently comes through in a big way.
This place is very reasonably priced, they DELIVER, the menu is extensive but not too large and now we get into the food.
The curries are rich, creamy and aromatic...
The Tom Kah soup is tangy and satisfying .... 
The cashew chicken is different than any other I have ever had and I mean that in the best way possible.....tons of veggies, medium spicy, not dry, lots of drippy,lght-sauce 
The pad see ew ranks right up there .... not skimpy on the chicken either... 
I have nothing but great things to say about Vanida
It's in my top 3 thai spots now in S.F.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
My BF and i learned about this place on yelp. we were really hung over and wanted some kind of delivery. When we found a Thai place that delivered and on my side of town (sunset) were jumped at the opportunity to try something new. THE FOOD IS PHENOMENAL. Every time we order something different and never have we gotten something that we didn't like. The cashew chicken is my fav. it's not like Chinese cashew chicken. they have their own spin on it and it's sooo good and spicy. The soup that we ordered was also really good. Like i said nothing that we have order has ever been a disappointment. 

I have never actually been inside the place but now that they have remodeled i am looking forward to going to see the place that satisfies my every this food need. I will update my review when i do so
author: Diana Elena B.

description: I ordered the pad thai and I've never had pad thai I wasn't crazy about, until tonight. I went here because of the high ratings on yelp but as far as the pad thai... I have seriously had better. It was dry and not very flavorful. Maybe try other things at this place.
author: Olivia D.

description: I am definitely a fan of this place. Only done delivery so far, and every time it comes hot and so good. I always get the drunken noodle with beef and man does that punch me in the gut every time. So spicy and delicious. Also love the fact that they say 40 minutes and it's here in 35
author: David G.

description:
I really want to give them 4 stars but they made a noob mistake of not de-vaining the shrimp or doing a bad job of it. 

that aside the food was quite good, the prices are reasonable, and delivery was as quoted.

I thought the pad thai was good and the yellow curry was amazing, the spring rolls were decent too.

I'll for sure be back, but next time I'm asking for chicken to be substituted for shrimp.
author: Tyler C.

description: This is the best Thai food restaurant I have been to in the city. They cater very well to vegetarians and cook their tofu perfectly. The Pad Thai is exactly how I like it with thinner rice noodles some veggies, tofu and bean sprouts (egg optional). However, my favorite dish is any thing Pra Ram, I go for the pra ram pak which is vegetables and peanut sauce, but the pra ram tofu and pra ram meats are just as good, it's all about the sauce! If you can get to the area you should definitely check it out!
author: Matthew G.

description: Vanida Thai Kitchen is cute! I ordered the drunken noodles and it was so satisfying! The prices are good, the food portions are just enough to fill you up, and the service is excellent. It may not look like it from the outside, but the appearance and ambiance inside is pretty. Vanida is a small restaurant, so there's definitely not a lot of seating and I'm not aware of how busy it usually gets, but it was nice and cozy when I was dining there. This place beats King of Thai!
author: Bets Y.

description:
Just moved to the neighborhood, craving Thai, thought we'd give this place a whirl. What a pleasant surprise! Lovely space + delish/fresh food + reasonable prices = food happiness.

We've been twice now. First time we got yum yai salad, garlic prawn, and sticky rice with mango for dessert. Second time: papaya salad, goong ga prow, and chicken cashew nut. (Don't you just love how half the dishes use the English words and half use the Thai on the menu?)

All of the dishes were first-rate -- hot, fresh, light, flavorful, completely satisfying. The prawn dishes were particularly outstanding. 

And the service is wonderful. Judging by what other yelpers have said, it sounds like it's better to eat in than take out or get delivery.

Haven't tried any curries or noodle dishes yet, but we'll be back...
author: Val P.

description:
Beef Gra Prow is excellent.

Try their online ordering service for delivery.
author: china s.

description: Solid traditional Thai food. This is our "go to" place in the lake merced/outer sunset area. Great for takeout. Top marks for their pad-sew-ew, green curry, and the quality of the chicken they use. There are probably 5 or 6 other restaurants that are just as good or better than Vanida. This being the closest to me makes it my new favorite. Oh yeah, free delivery baby!
author: Asa S.

description:
I really love going here

-It's quiet, even when it's busy
-Super friendly service
-Inexpensive
-Easy parking, right off the L train too. 
-Awesome Thai Iced Tea
-Portions seem small, but fill you up. And they always give us extra rice for leftovers if we need it.
author: Mat O.

description: I got the curry noodles which were decent . The Thai iced tea was decent but a total rip off !! It was like half the size of what a thai tea looked like in all other Thai restaurants !! How stingy of them !! I really think they deserve a 2.5 stars but obviously I can't do that .. so I'm just going to give them 3 stars to be fair . Even though they are stingy , their food was decent after all ..
author: Eileen L.

description: The food is freaking horrible.  Today I got spring rolls, tom yum goong and flat noodles with chinese brokoli.  The spring rolls tasted like mold.  The soup just tasted like water, not flavor whatsoever.  The noodle is okay.  Don't know if the cook has changed, but the food used to taste okay.  And it's freaking Saturday usually Asian restaurants cook the food better than on weekdays.  I can't imagine what the food is taste like.  I have been to Thailand several times and the food at Vanida taste nothing like the real Thai food.  Not even that, there are far and much more better Thai restaurant that Vanida.  I would never come back again.  Better take a little far drive to King Thai Noodles for better food or elsewhere.
author: Jasmijn L.

description: Well........... First of all thai food is my least favorite food so yeah. LOL My best friends wanted to go eat thai here because it was only a few blocks away from the house we were hanging out at and we were starving from taking the ACTs. It wasn't a long wait for us to get a seat and the service was pretty nice. I ordered the yellow curry with the sour&spicy soup. I really liked the soup(: The yellow curry ........ eh I had better curry but I still liked it, espicially since it had tofu lol (: Overall its good and I would come back if I'm ever around (:
author: Didi L.

description: I'm with Tiffany Y. on this one.  Vanida Thai used to be a 5 star for me, but something's just not the same with the food since the remodeling.  The new decor is gorgeous, and it's still one of the better Thai places.  The service remains incredible.  I just hope they bring back the quality of food that they had before the remodeling. *fingers crossed*
author: Christena T.

description: Vanida is great!! The service is amazing. From the minute you walk in they are very attentive and offer you jasmine tea.  The prices are reasonable and the portion size large.  My only gripe they don't have fresh spring rolls which seems weird for a Thai restaurant. Their Tom Yum soup is quite tasty.  I have only sampled a couple of the curries which were good. Well spiced food.  Its a nice little treasure in the outer sunset.
author: Halima T.

description:
curry is good. tom kha is great. pad thai uses thin noodles and tons of tamarind and vinegar. yumm. 

there's never a wait, and your drinks come with little origami roses on the straws.
author: Lizzie O.

description: This is a cozy lil spot in the outer sunset where you are greeted by lovely waitresses in traditional Thai outfits with smiles on their faces.  I went wit the boys for late dinner and found it to be pretty empty. I ordered the Pad Sai Rong which is thin noodles with chicken and many assorted veggies. It was yummy and the portion size was decent. I would like to come back before I can give them a better or worst rating depending on the other food I try. After you start exploring different thai restaurants and get away from King of Thai it makes the eating experience in a Thai restaurant even better because King of Thai is too commercialized for me now. I rather go to smaller places because the quality of the food is much better.
author: Jonathan W.

description: Delicious!  It's my neighborhood Thai place, and never disappoints.  Great service and food.  I almost always get the coconut soup with chicken and the pad see yew noodles.  The pad thai is also good, naturally.  Yummy!!
author: Nicholle B.

description: Beautiful restaurant, friendly service, very reasonable prices. I wish I lived closer to Vanida. I'd go all the time.
author: J W.

description: Just moved to the neighborhood 2 months ago and I have eaten here many times. I enjoy the lunch specials over dinner service. The food is always good and sometimes great. I wanted to give them 5 stars but chose 4 because they aren't as consistant as I would like. The garlic pork is one of my favorite dishes. The curry puffs are an awesome appetizer. Quality and consistency of the curry dishes is where I've been disappointed before - some days these are great and some days just average. I've also been a little disappointed with lunch when one option was hot and fresh and it was obvious the other had sat around for a few minutes and was not hot (lunch specials give you the option to try two main dishes for $1 extra.) Service is always prompt, efficient, and courteous. The dining area is always clean, although the inspection score leaves room for improvement in the kitchen and storage areas, apparently. Of the several casual Thai restaurants I've tried this is easily the best.
author: Jayson H.

description: Primo Thai!...  always good...  soooo glad i learned of the Thai food when I came to the bay area...  think  this is the beginning of a great relationship...  =)~
author: Anthony Z.

description: Om nom nom nom! The lunch specials offer large, satisfying portions, with good selections for both meat-eaters and vegetarians alike. Kick ass curry. Savory coconut soup. Luscious Thai iced tea. Lunch for two comes out to less than $20! Easy parking. And it's a short walk to the beach, so you can have your post-lunch constitutional with a view.
author: Melinda K.

description: This place is what King of Thai used to be:  good prices, decent amount of food, and good tastes. They have a killer 2-item lunch special that is even available on Saturdays.  The food is good...but I hear this may be hit or miss; my 3 trips have been identical in terms of taste and quality.  The place is clean (ever since the facelift) and welcoming for being a hidden gem in the lower Sunset.  The place is never crowded and this is no the kind of place where you have to wait for an hour to get a table.  Wait staff is super friendly and they do a good job at making themselves available.  With your bill comes some chocolate breath mints....I'll keep going back here for my Sunset Thai food.
author: Jonnathan C.

description: Best thai restaurant in the area. Flavorful curry dishes and good woon sen soup!  Angel wings are good but a bit greasy.  Only complaint I have is that they never give me any plastic utensils with my take out orders. Getting takeout means I don't have to cook and I don't want to clean either
author: Jenny W.

description: Yes, I agree with other yelpers, nice renovation...the place looks great and service is still awesome but the food is no longer as good as it used to be. I went into the city craving their food and was surprised when I ordered my usual there, it's just not the same. It seems like they changed their chef.
