The yellow curry isn't what it used to be and the tom kha gai isn't as tasty as it once was. What happened? I mean it wasn't bad but it wasn't super fantastic like it once was before the change. Oh Vanida Thai...you have fallen from grace.
author: nancy l.

description: lightning speed and soooooo delicioso~ i crave vanida!
author: Christine B.

description: My roommate is kinda addicted to this place and I like it too.  It's a super hole-in-the-wall place, but it seems really clean and the food is really good.
author: Tara B.

description: I really like this quaint thai place, hidden away in the Sunset not too far from the ocean.  I've been several times now and have always been pleased with the good food, friendly service, and family home feel.  I'll be coming again soon!
author: Debbie Y.

description: Vanita thai kitchen is right down the street from our house, so i'm sure i'll be there many times again. it's a nice little place with a very friendly waitress. the thai iced tea was good but a little watery. i had sweet n sour tofu, which was yummy, with tomatoes and pineapples. my friend had a good ginger chicken and my other friend had chicken eggplant, which i thought was delicious, although he felt a little sick. it wasn't the best place, but still good...
author: Merredith L.

description:
my friends and I tried the lunch combinations, and they were actually pretty valuable and delicious.

the restaurant is pretty small and not easy to find from outside.

it is very clean and small, but still comfortable to enjoy our food.
The service is VERY good and fast.

We tried the green curry, pad thai, ga prow, and pad tofu, and they were unexpectedly amazing...they were so authentic that we kept eating until we couldn't consume any more 

We are so satisfied and left.    
(Delivery only for DINNER)
author: Sue S.

description: I ate here last night with my crazy drunk friends. The waitresses was so nice and accomodating. I requested that every plate we ordered be split into 2 and placed on each side of the table since there was 9 of us. She did. The food is pretty good and decent sized. When we were paying the bill, i realized that they didn't factor in the tip. So if you decide to eat here, make sure you tip these nice peoples :)
author: Dao C.

description: First came here a couple years ago, and the foods been consistently good since then. Nice quiet place, friendly (not overly perky) service.
author: Sandra S.

description: I was going to Win's Restaurant, and they were CLOSED! aww buggah! I was too hungry to get back in the car and drive somewhere else. Luckily there was a Thai restaurant right next door. Vanida Thai Kitchen to the rescue! Delicious water to start while my bf and I were looking at the menus. We ordered the yellow curry with chicken, and pad see yew with beef. MMMMMMMMMM sooo good I'm still food chomatosing.
author: Stefanie Y.

description: Great service, and its a great little place considering its in the outter sunset. You'll have to try the woon sun soup. It is the best if you are feeling under the weather. Clear chicken broth soup, with glass noodle inside.
author: Gilbert D.

description: This is a great neighborhood-y place with friendly service and very good food. It's a bit of a trek for me, but I'd go back - it's like a trip out of town - or if I happened to be in the area. I was impressed by the number and variety of vegetarian appetizers. I had a bit of the spring rolls but was saving room for FBI (fried bananas and ice cream). My vegetables and tofu with peanut sauce were very good, and my dining companion enjoyed his beef dish. The FBI was great! Look carefully between the 3 Chinese restaurants and pizza place to find it.
author: Amy E.

description: Greatest kept secret in the sunset. This place is never really full and I don't know why. The pad thai is great plus I don't think I've ever spent more then 25 for two people here or 45 for 4 people. Great tea! Try the chicken skewers. Really good service too.
author: kArlos A.

description: This place has great lunch prices. Two item combos with rice and your choice of soup or salad is about 7.50. My faves are the marinated bbq chicken and chicken or steamed veggies/tofu pra ram (peanut sauce).  They can get busy in the evening and service can be slow. Their fried rice is good but the onions are ridiculously large in size. I'm not a fan of the pad thai because it taste too much like fish sauce. If you live in the 'Set or are in the hood, you have to try this place at least once.
author: Jenniflava R.

description:
I love Vanida, and I usually am not the biggest fan of Thai food. It's the epitome of the hole in the wall, family-run, authentic, sweet little restaurant that serves up such amazingly delicious food that you don't want to share the place's whereabouts with other people. If you're in the area, definitely make a stop here. You'll love it; I promise.

BTW: Anything with "Panang Curry" is legit. Also, their mango with sticky rice is a must.
author: Jackie C.

description: This place is hit or miss. The Lunch deals are great... i think $6.50 for a two item combo with rice and soup... problem is sometimes the soup is great and sometimes it tastes watered down.
author: Noah T.

description: Amazing Thai in a foggy, forgettable Sunset business strip. The Pad Thai was pretty good, with nice but not overpowering nuttiness and tasty shrimp, but the chicken satay blew me away. Best I've ever had, bar none. Cheap, too- about $7-8 an entree. Apparently they have homemade coconut fried ice cream, too, which is kind of exciting.
author: David S.

description: Food is very tasty and delicious. Small and cozy place. Get the Garlic Pork with the Vanida green sauce. That green sauce is the bomb! I think it contains lemon, lime, salt, pepper, cilantro. That's the only thing I order when I go there.
author: Roger C.

description: go go green sauce.....yummy. my fav. We go just for that. Nice staff.The place is really fancy now. Prices are still good.
author: Freaky T.

description: Observed the facelift this place got, wondered what affect that may have on the food? Well, the food is still sagging in flair and flavor. Nothing spectacular, I would rather travel the 10 blocks to King of Thai Noodle. The squid salad smelt like the marina, dead fish...don't order it. The Pad Se-Ew was decent, soft and delicate with a nice balance of seasoning, I'd order it again. As yellow curries go this one was average with a bit too much sweetness and too raw of chili.  The most notable theme was the music, a subliminal blend of Madonna and Taylor Dane, took my mind off the stinky squid at the table. The tofu was fresh as was the grilled chicken. I'd go and try something different next time.
author: Anthony A.

description:
Vanida is my new favorite Thai place. 

I like the hole-in-the-wall feeling of the place and the low-key service.

Most of all, I dig the food. I've always been there with guests, and they're always blown away. It's just simple, family-style Thai food, but the flavors are rich and complex. 

It's a pain to get all the way out there, but worth it. In fact, the spouse & I have become so spoiled by Vanida, we refuse to go to any of the five Thai places that are within a few blocks of our flat. Better to hop on the L Taraval and have some real Thai food...
author: Caitlin M.

description: What more could ask for in a Thai place? Good service, free delivery, and excellent food. Tofu ga prow is my stand-by, and with all the thai in the sunset, vanida stands out. And super cheap too!!
author: J S.

description: I ate here for the first time tonight and I really enjoyed it.  The portions were just enough and the food was flavorful.  I will come again!
author: Mieke V.

description:
Brilliant. The food is cooked fresh- I happened to go to the bathroom and came saw the chefs peacefully debating on the flavours of the freshly cooked dishes that we had ordered and you could really taste their perfection in the food. 

I recommend Miang Kum (number 18 on the menu), it is really flavourful and starts the eating experience off perfectly.

The staff are friendly and attentive (we always had full water).

Check it out, you will not be sorry.
author: Chris G.

description: had takeout from this restaurant.  ordered from the lunch combo menu (which is offered every day) comes with 2 items, rice, salad or soup for $7.50....well worth it!  food was excellent.  yellow curry sauce is so authentic.  ga prow was prepared perfectly.  basil is super yummy.  Salad dressing is very light and salad was very fresh.  ordered pad thai separately...it was good, served with all ingredients separately and you mix it yourself, so if you like your spouts on the soft side, this isn't the place to buy the pad thai to go.  ordered thai tea and it held up very well, mixed it at home.  strong and sweet, perfect.  Overall a great deal for the price and good quality of food.  would definately go back.  convenient location.
author: Laura A.

description: The food is mediocre.  Delivery lately has been one bad experience after another.  They told us that it would take 45 minutes.  But the last few times it's taken over an hour even up to an hour and a half.  The delivery really soured me on ordering from them again.
author: Lyn C.

description: Vanida Thai Kitchen's Garlic Pork (#3 and #43 on the lunch and dinner menus, respectively) is shouldering the bulk of the 4 stars for this review because it was the unexpected highlight of my lunch. It could have used more charbroiling but their refreshing (a hint of lime juice?), vinegar-based green sauce really elevated the meat's flavor profile. I had so much leftover rice--they could've plated more pork frankly--that I drenched it with the remaining green sauce and then topped it with the unremarkable Yellow Curry Chicken (#2 lunch; #38 dinner) that I got with the lunch combo. The Tom Kha soup was alright; there was some acidity/sourness found similarly in Tom Yum soup. I also ordered their over-hyped, seven-piece Angel Wings (#12 dinner-appetizer). Sure, I enjoyed the spicy sweet & sour sauce on the wings' skin but the un-marinated chicken wings lacked flavor in the meat and were horribly overcooked and not juicy. Ironically, there appeared to be more meat from this appetizer than the Garlic Pork to fill me up.
author: Cliff W.

description: had dinner here last night with my sister, the trout special was really good.  the ginger pork was ok.
author: pochini m.

description: Terrible PadThai....all the noodles stuck together as one big lump.  Red curry is tasteless and the soup was too hot to consume.  4 tiny egg rolls for $6.00???  All the prices in the on line menu is not updated....... We got carry out using the on line menu and when we picked up the food, it was a big wopping $10.00 difference.  The stick rice and Mango desert was stale with brown Mango. We were craving so much for some authentic Thai and what we got was anything but.........
author: Mel T.

description: Love this place!  Have been here for lunch only but would be happy to go for dinner too.  The lunch special is a great deal and tasty.  Two dishes plus some good soup for $7.50.  The place is clean, parking is easy, staff is friendly, dishes all taste fresh and authentic.  A great find in the outer Sunset/Parkside.
author: John G.

description: Nothing transcendent, but all quiet good.  I only get takeout here, but the service is very fast and consistent.  The food is not too greasy, which I like.  Obviously, living in San Francisco, there are plenty of excellent Thai places.  So, I wouldn't expect people to drive across the city to come here.  I have had a number of things on the menu and have been happy with all of it.
author: Jon T.

description: Best Thai food in town. I used to live next door to a King of Thai Noodle, which is ok Thai food, but now my go-to Thai place is Vanida. I've been there three times and each time the food and service have been amazing. The curry is delicious! The atmosphere is clean and inviting. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an alternative to King of Thai Noodle.
author: A S.

description: Good food, great prices for lunch. I can pick up a two item combo with soup for less than $8. That's not too bad, and it's usually my to-go spot when I work from home.
author: Jeremy A.

description: great small thai restaurant.. their combo appertizer consists of fish cakes,  curry puff ( which taste like potato mixed with curry), egg rolls and shrimp rolls, theur pumpkin curry chicken is spicy but just right. when we order a pint of rice, it is more than a pint.. their fried banana with homemade coconut ice cream which delicious and it hitted that spOt.. i would recommend great for dates and friends and can share.
author: Lily T.

description: mm i always order the Tofu Ga Prow which is stir fried tofu with peppers. its not too spicy and not too sweet with a slice of watermelon on the side=) yumm. the waitresses are friendly and will refill your water when its low. the restaurant doesn't get too crowded.. maybe cuz i go there in the early afternoon..and they give u chocolate breath mints with your bill=) its pretty cheap ..around 6 dollars per person.
author: christy w.

description: This is place is a hidden gem. It is a residential neighborhood, and doesn't look inviting from outside. But the food is pretty good. The quantity is just right, and not too much as at most places. I go every once, in a while, and am satisfied.
author: Kuldeep T.

description:
Still on the delivery mission for the Sunset.  We live out by SFSU, and delivery/food in general is a little sketchy after ten years of delivery abundance in the Mission and Haight.  Vanida was, happily, great.  Delivery was relatively quick, prices were decent, and the food was tasty.  BF had the angel wings, which he loved.  We shared vegetarian pad thai, which was very tamarind-y and improved very easily with the (included) squeeze of lime.  All the vegetables were beautiful and very fresh.  I also ordered a red curry which was spicy and flavorful.  Tom kha (coconut milk, lemongrass, ginger) soup was kinda on the sweet side but fantastic the next day when I added my red curry to it.  Thinking on it now I could have added the lime squeeze to that too and probably done away with the sweetness.  In (real) Thai cuisine there is a balance of flavors so possibly I threw off the balance by leaving the lime out.  Either way, yum!  
I will definitely order from here again.
author: nicole p.

description: This place is awesome! I'm not Thai, but whenever I'm looking for some comfort food, Vanida always tops the list.  The food always tastes home cooked and amazingly fresh.  My favorites are definitely the vegetarian pad thai, Tom Yum Gai, the egg rolls and the chicken curry.  Writing this is making me hungry...
author: Diesel D.

description: Yummy food, cozy place, friendly people! It's a place we normally go when we want authentic Thai food. There's no holes on the wall, but definitely a mom-n-pa shop type of family owned restaurant. In fact, the mom is the chef!! We can't wait to go back there again!
author: J.K D.

description: I went to this place after reading all the raving reviews posted....I was sadly disappointed.....The only thing that was true of the reviews was about the price......The quantity was really less and nothing tasted good.....I have been to several thai places before and I would rate each one of them better than this one......To add to our annoyance of the mediocre dishes, the waitress even had the audacity of giggle in front of us when we asked her to pack the leftovers eventually leaving us with an extremely bad dining experience.......I am not sure if we caught it on an off day but I cannot believe that every single one of the en tree's we ordered was wrong...The appetizers were not too bad......I wouldn't venture to this place again...The only saving grace was the trip to beach which is so close......
author: Smita K.

description: I've eaten at dozens of Thai places all over the Bay Area and this is one of my favorites (top 5).  The chicken red curry has great kick, but it's the prawns that are the best.  The freshest I've ever tasted anywhere.  The pad thai could use some improvement.  The portion is huge (box must weigh over a pound) but the flavor isn't as nutty and rich as I like but its still ok.
author: kim h.

description: My fav place for Thai! I've been there about 4 times and the service is always as great as the food.
author: Mandi A.

description: Small local place, usually not too crowded, but its getting more popular as people find out.  Good food, easy takeout, quick delivery - every once in a while the service is a little slow, bust mostly this place is great, and one of my favorite SF thai joints.
author: dontdoit d.

description: This place certainly screams value.  Anytime you can get an above average meal for a below average price, you're left feeling pretty good.  Nothing beats a little hole in the wall neighborhood restaurant that serves delicious meals.  If you're looking for an upscale dining area with all the amenities, this isn't the place for you.  If you're looking to be pampered by busboys, valet parking attendants, and waiters who wear suits, this isn't the place for you.  Yet, if you're looking for authentic Thai food which tastes great and doesn't take a large chunk out of your wallet, this is the place for you.  VALUE at its finest.
author: Rex J.

description: mmmm, delicious! one of the best kept secrets in the outer sunset. lunch is an especially goood deal. choose from one or two combination plates, i recommend a sauteed something with a curried selection. all for about 8 bucks. it also includes a soup...get the coconut milk soup...to die for! a glass of wine is about $5. and the service is superb. i usually dine for lunch solo here, as it is a comfortable quiet place. i believe it is family owned and operated. always a pleasure.
author: punk l.

description: this is the BEST place to go for thai food!!! this is a small family restaurant and the family has always been good to me whenever i visit. all the servers are super friendly and the food is amazing. i try to order different things whenever i come here, and there hasn't been one thing i didn't like. they remodeled a couple months ago and it looks amazing!! the other thai restaurants cannot match up to vanida!!
author: Tiff L.
